Text

ï»¿After entering at break of day [the inner roadstead of [the Port of [Toulon]1-toulon]217-the port of toulon]216-the inner roadstead of the port of toulon , exchanging several loud hails with [one of [the guardboats of [the Fleet]220-the fleet]219-the guardboats of the fleet , which directed [him]221-his where [he]221-his was to take up [[his]221-his berth]222-his berth]218-one of the guardboats of the fleet , which directed him where he was to take up his berth , [Master - Gunner Peyrol]110-master - gunner peyrol let go the anchor of [the sea - worn and battered ship in [his]221-his charge]223-the sea - worn and battered ship in his charge , between [the arsenal]224-the arsenal and [the town]225-the town , in full view of [the principal quay]226-the principal quay . The course of [his]221-his life , which in the opinion of [any ordinary person]227-any ordinary person might have been regarded as full of marvellous incidents only [he]221-his [himself]221-his had never marvelled at them , had rendered [him]221-his undemonstrative to such a degree that [he]221-his did not even let out a sigh of relief at the rumble of the cable . And yet it ended a most anxious six months of knocking about at [sea]228-sea with valuable merchandise in a damaged hull , most of the time on short rations , always on the lookout for [English cruisers]229-english cruisers , once or twice on the verge of shipwreck and more than once on the verge of capture . But as to that , [old Peyrol]136-peyrol had made up [his]221-his mind from the first to blow up [his]221-his valuable charge - unemotionally , for such was [his]221-his character , formed under the sun of [the Indian Seas]2-the indian seas in lawless contests with [his]221-his kind for a little loot that vanished as soon as grasped , but mainly for bare life almost as precarious to hold through its ups and downs , and which now had lasted for fifty - eight years . While [[his]221-his crew of half - starved scarecrows , hard as nails and ravenous as so many wolves for the delights of [the shore]231-the shore]230-his crew of half - starved scarecrows , hard as nails and ravenous as so many wolves for the delights of the shore , swarmed aloft to furl the sails nearly as thin and as patched as the grimy shirts on [their]230-his crew of half - starved scarecrows , hard as nails and ravenous as so many wolves for the delights of the shore backs , [Peyrol]136-peyrol took a survey of [the quay]232-the quay . [Groups]233-groups were forming along [its]232-the quay whole stretch to gaze at [the new arrival]234-the new arrival . [Peyrol]136-peyrol noted particularly [a good many men in red caps]235-a good many men in red caps and said to [himself]136-peyrol - " Here [they]235-a good many men in red caps are . "[136-peyrol] Amongst [the crews of ships that had brought the tricolour into [the seas of [the East]3-the east]237-the seas of the east]236-the crews of ships that had brought the tricolour into the seas of the east , there were [hundreds professing sans - culotte principles]238-hundreds professing sans - culotte principles ; [boastful and declamatory beggars [he]136-peyrol had thought [them]238-hundreds professing sans - culotte principles]239-boastful and declamatory beggars he had thought them . But now [he]136-peyrol was beholding [the shore]231-the shore breed . Those who had made [the Revolution]155-the revolution safe . The real thing . [Peyrol]136-peyrol , after taking a good long look , went below into [[his]136-peyrol cabin]241-his cabin to make [himself]136-peyrol ready to go ashore . [He]136-peyrol shaved [his]136-peyrol big cheeks with a real English razor , looted years ago from [[an officer]242-an officer 's cabin]243-an officer 's cabin in [an English East Indiaman]244-an english east indiaman captured by [a ship [he]136-peyrol was serving in then]245-a ship he was serving in then . [He]136-peyrol put on a white shirt , a short blue jacket with metal buttons and a high roll - collar , a pair of white trousers which [he]136-peyrol fastened with a red bandana handkerchief by way of a belt . With a black , shiny low - crowned hat on [his]136-peyrol head [he]136-peyrol made [a very creditable prize - master]246-a very creditable prize - master . [He]136-peyrol beckoned from the poop to [a boatman]247-a boatman and got [himself]136-peyrol rowed to [the quay]232-the quay . By that time [the crowd]249-the crowd had grown to a large size . [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's eyes ranged over it with no great apparent interest , though it was a fact that [he]136-peyrol had never in all [[his]136-peyrol man]250-his man 's life seen [so many idle white people]251-so many idle white people massed together to stare at [a sailor]252-a sailor . [He]136-peyrol had been [a rover of [the outer seas]254-the outer seas]253-a rover of the outer seas ; [he]136-peyrol had grown into [a stranger to [[his]136-peyrol native country]256-his native country]255-a stranger to his native country . During the few minutes it took [the boatman]257-the boatman to row [him]136-peyrol to the step , [he]136-peyrol felt like [a navigator]258-a navigator about to land on [a newly discovered shore]259-a newly discovered shore . On putting [his]136-peyrol foot on it [he]136-peyrol was mobbed . The arrival of a prize made by [a squadron of [the Republic]261-the republic in [distant seas]262-distant seas]260-a squadron of the republic in distant seas was not an everyday occurrence in [Toulon]1-toulon . The wildest rumours had been already set flying . [Peyrol]136-peyrol elbowed [himself]136-peyrol through [the crowd]249-the crowd somehow , but it continued to move after [him]136-peyrol . A voice cried out , " Where do [you]136-peyrol come from , [citoyen]2654-citoyen ? "[249-the crowd] - " From [the other side of [the world]2656-the world]2655-the other side of the world , "[136-peyrol] [Peyrol]136-peyrol boomed out . [He]136-peyrol did not get rid of [[his]136-peyrol followers]264-his followers till the door of [the Port Office]265-the port office . [There]266-there [he]136-peyrol reported [himself]136-peyrol to [the proper officials]267-the proper officials as master of a prize taken off [the Cape]5-the cape by [Citoyen Renaud]112-citoyen renaud , [Commander - in - Chief of [the Republican Squadron in [the Indian Seas]2-the indian seas]6-the republican squadron in the indian seas]268-commander - in - chief of the republican squadron in the indian seas . [He]136-peyrol had been ordered to make for [Dunkerque]7-dunkerque but , said [he]136-peyrol , having been chased by [the sacrs Anglais]113-the sacrs anglais three times in a fortnight between [Cape Verde]8-cape verde and [Cape Spartel]9-cape spartel , [he]136-peyrol had made up [his]136-peyrol mind to run into [the Mediterranean]269-the mediterranean where , [he]136-peyrol had understood from [a Danish brig [he]136-peyrol had met at [sea]228-sea]270-a danish brig he had met at sea , there were [no English men - of - war]272-no english men - of - war just then . And here [he]136-peyrol was ; and there were [[his]136-peyrol ship]273-his ship 's papers and [his]136-peyrol own papers and everything in order . [He]136-peyrol mentioned also that [he]136-peyrol was tired of rolling about [the seas]274-the seas , and that [he]136-peyrol longed for a period of repose on [shore]275-shore . But till all the legal business was settled [he]136-peyrol remained in [Toulon]1-toulon roaming about [the streets]276-the streets at a deliberate gait , enjoying general consideration as [Citizen Peyrol]136-peyrol , and looking [everybody]277-everybody coldly in the eye . [His]136-peyrol reticence about [his]136-peyrol past was of that kind which starts a lot of mysterious stories about [a man]278-a man . No doubt [the maritime authorities of [Toulon]1-toulon]279-the maritime authorities of toulon had a less cloudy idea of [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's past , though it need not necessarily have been more exact . In [the various offices connected with [the sea]281-the sea where [his]136-peyrol duties took [him]136-peyrol]280-the various offices connected with the sea where his duties took him , [the wretched scribes]282-the wretched scribes , and even [some of [the chiefs]284-the chiefs]283-some of the chiefs , looked very hard at [him]136-peyrol as [he]136-peyrol went in and out , dressed very neatly , and always with [his]136-peyrol cudgel , which [he]136-peyrol used to leave outside the door of [private offices]285-private offices when called in for an interview with one or another of [the " gold - laced lot]2657-the " gold - laced lot . "[136-peyrol] Having , however , cut off [his]136-peyrol queue and got in touch with [some prominent patriots of the Jacobin type]286-some prominent patriots of the jacobin type , [Peyrol]136-peyrol cared little for [people]287-people 's stares and whispers . [The person that came nearest to trying [his]136-peyrol composure]288-the person that came nearest to trying his composure was [a certain naval captain with a patch over one eye and a very threadbare uniform coat who was doing some administrative work at [the Port Office]265-the port office]289-a certain naval captain with a patch over one eye and a very threadbare uniform coat who was doing some administrative work at the port office . [That officer]291-that officer , looking up from some papers , remarked brusquely , " As a matter of fact [you]136-peyrol have been the best part of [your]136-peyrol life skimming [the seas]274-the seas , if the truth were known . [You]136-peyrol must have been [a deserter from [the Navy]2660-the navy]2659-a deserter from the navy at one time , whatever [you]136-peyrol may call [yourself]136-peyrol now . "[291-that officer] There was not a quiver on the large cheeks of [the gunner Peyrol]136-peyrol . " If there was anything of the sort it was in the time of [kings]2661-kings and [aristocrats]2662-aristocrats , "[291-that officer] [he]291-that officer said steadily . " And now [I]291-that officer have brought in a prize , and a service letter from [Citizen Renaud]114-citizen renaud , commanding in [the Indian Seas]2-the indian seas . [I]291-that officer can also give [you]136-peyrol the names of [good republicans in [this town]2664-this town who know [my]291-that officer sentiments]2663-good republicans in this town who know my sentiments . [Nobody]2665-nobody can say [I]291-that officer was ever anti - revolutionary in [my]291-that officer life . [I]291-that officer knocked about [the Eastern seas]2666-the eastern seas for forty - five years - that 's true . But let [me]291-that officer observe that it was [the seamen who stayed at [home]2668-home that let [the English]115-the english into [the Port of [Toulon]1-toulon]217-the port of toulon]2667-the seamen who stayed at home that let the english into the port of toulon . "[291-that officer] [He]291-that officer paused a moment and then added : " When [one]2670-one thinks of that , [citoyen Commandant]2671-citoyen commandant , [any little slips [I]291-that officer and fellows of [my]291-that officer kind]2672-any little slips i and fellows of my kind may have made five thousand leagues from here and twenty years ago can not have much importance in these times of equality and fraternity . "[291-that officer] " As to fraternity , "[292-the post - captain in the shabby coat] remarked [the post - captain in the shabby coat]292-the post - captain in the shabby coat , " the only one [you]2671-citoyen commandant are familiar with is [the Brotherhood of [the Coast]10-the coast]2673-the brotherhood of the coast , [I]292-the post - captain in the shabby coat should say . "[292-the post - captain in the shabby coat] " Everybody in [the Indian Ocean]11-the indian ocean except [milksops]2674-milksops and [youngsters]2675-youngsters had to be , "[136-peyrol] said the untroubled [Citizen Peyrol]136-peyrol . " And [we]2676-we practised republican principles long before a republic was thought of ; for [the Brothers of [the Coast]10-the coast]2677-the brothers of the coast were all equal and elected [[their]2677-the brothers of the coast own chiefs]2678-their own chiefs . "[136-peyrol] " [They]2677-the brothers of the coast were [an abominable lot of [lawless ruffians]2680-lawless ruffians]2679-an abominable lot of lawless ruffians , "[293-the officer] remarked [the officer]293-the officer venomously , leaning back in [his]293-the officer chair . " [You]293-the officer will not dare to deny that . "[293-the officer] [Citizen Peyrol]136-peyrol refused to take up a defensive attitude . [He]136-peyrol merely mentioned in a neutral tone that [he]136-peyrol had delivered [his]136-peyrol trust to [the Port Office]265-the port office all right , and as to [his]136-peyrol character [he]136-peyrol had a certificate of civism from [[his]136-peyrol section]295-his section . [He]136-peyrol was [a patriot]296-a patriot and entitled to [his]136-peyrol discharge . After being dismissed by a nod [he]136-peyrol took up [his]136-peyrol cudgel outside the door and walked out of [the building]297-the building with the calmness of rectitude . [His]136-peyrol large face of the Roman type betrayed nothing to [the wretched quill - drivers]298-the wretched quill - drivers , who whispered on [his]136-peyrol passage . As [he]136-peyrol went along [the streets]276-the streets [he]136-peyrol looked as usual [everybody]277-everybody in the eye ; but that very same evening [he]136-peyrol vanished from [Toulon]1-toulon . It was n't that [he]136-peyrol was afraid of anything . [His]136-peyrol mind was as calm as the natural set of [his]136-peyrol florid face . [Nobody]2665-nobody could know what [his]136-peyrol forty years or more of sea - life had been , unless [he]136-peyrol told [them]302-them [himself]136-peyrol . And of that [he]136-peyrol did n't mean to tell more than what [he]136-peyrol had told [the inquisitive captain]303-the inquisitive captain with the patch over one eye . But [he]136-peyrol did n't want any bother for certain other reasons ; and more than anything else [he]136-peyrol did n't want to be sent perhaps to serve in the fleet now fitting out in [Toulon]1-toulon . So at dusk [he]136-peyrol passed through the gate on [the road]304-the road to [Frjus]12-frjus in [a high two - wheeled cart]305-a high two - wheeled cart belonging to [a well - known farmer whose habitation lay that way]306-a well - known farmer whose habitation lay that way . [His]136-peyrol personal belongings were brought down and piled up on the tailboard of [the cart]307-the cart by [some ragamuffin patriots whom [he]136-peyrol engaged in [the street]309-the street for that purpose]308-some ragamuffin patriots whom he engaged in the street for that purpose . The only indiscretion [he]136-peyrol committed was to pay [them]308-some ragamuffin patriots whom he engaged in the street for that purpose for [their]308-some ragamuffin patriots whom he engaged in the street for that purpose trouble with [a large handful of [assignats]311-assignats]310-a large handful of assignats . From [such a prosperous seaman]312-such a prosperous seaman , however , this generosity was not so very compromising . [He]136-peyrol [himself]136-peyrol got into [the cart]307-the cart over the wheel , with such slow and ponderous movements , that [the friendly farmer]314-the friendly farmer felt called upon to remark : " Ah , [we]2681-we are not so young as [we]2681-we used to be - [you]136-peyrol and [I.]314-the friendly farmer "[314-the friendly farmer] - " [I]136-peyrol have also an awkward wound , "[136-peyrol] said [Citizen Peyrol]136-peyrol , sitting down heavily . And so from [[farmer]315-farmer 's cart]316-farmer 's cart to [[farmer]315-farmer 's cart]316-farmer 's cart , getting lifts all along , jogging in a cloud of dust between stone walls and through [little villages well known to [him]136-peyrol]319-little villages well known to him from [[his]136-peyrol boyhood]320-his boyhood 's days , in a landscape of stony hills , pale rocks , and dusty green of olive trees , [Citizen Peyrol]136-peyrol went on unmolested till [he]136-peyrol got down clumsily in the yard of [an inn on [the outskirts of [the town of Hyres]323-the town of hyres]322-the outskirts of the town of hyres]321-an inn on the outskirts of the town of hyres . The sun was setting to [his]136-peyrol right . Near a clump of dark pines with blood - red trunks in the sunset , [Peyrol]136-peyrol perceived a rutty track branching off in the direction of [the sea]281-the sea . At that spot [Citizen Peyrol]136-peyrol had made up [his]136-peyrol mind to leave [the high road]325-the high road . [Every feature of [the country]327-the country]326-every feature of the country with [the darkly wooded rises]328-the darkly wooded rises , [the barren flat expanse of stones and sombre bushes to [his]136-peyrol left]329-the barren flat expanse of stones and sombre bushes to his left , appealed to [him]136-peyrol with a sort of strange familiarity , because they had remained unchanged since the days of [his]136-peyrol boyhood . The very cartwheel tracks scored deep into the stony ground had kept their physiognomy ; and far away , like a blue thread , there was the sea of [the Hyres roadstead with a lumpy indigo swelling still beyond]330-the hyres roadstead with a lumpy indigo swelling still beyond - which was [the island of [Porquerolles]13-porquerolles]331-the island of porquerolles , but [he]136-peyrol really did not know . The notion of [a father]332-a father was absent from [his]136-peyrol mentality . What [he]136-peyrol remembered of [[his]136-peyrol parents]333-his parents was [a tall , lean , brown woman in rags]334-a tall , lean , brown woman in rags , who was [[his]136-peyrol mother]335-his mother . But then [they]333-his parents were working together at [a farm which was on [the mainland]337-the mainland]336-a farm which was on the mainland . [He]136-peyrol had fragmentary memories of [her]335-his mother shaking down olives , picking stones out of [a field]338-a field , or handling a manure fork like [a man]278-a man , tireless and fierce , with wisps of greyish hair flying about [her]335-his mother bony face ; and of [himself]136-peyrol running barefooted in connection with a flock of turkeys , with hardly any clothes on [his]136-peyrol back . At night , by [the farmer]340-the farmer 's favour , [they]333-his parents were permitted to sleep in a sort of ruinous byre built of stones and with only half a roof on [it]341-it , lying side by side on some old straw on the ground . And it was on a bundle of straw that [[his]136-peyrol mother]335-his mother had tossed ill for two days and had died in the night . In the darkness , [her]335-his mother silence , [her]335-his mother cold face had given [him]136-peyrol an awful scare . [He]136-peyrol supposed [they]333-his parents had buried [her]335-his mother but [he]136-peyrol did n't know , because [he]136-peyrol had rushed out terror - struck , and never stopped till [he]136-peyrol got as far as [a little place by [the sea]281-the sea called [Almanarre]14-almanarre]343-a little place by the sea called almanarre , where [he]136-peyrol hid [himself]136-peyrol on board [a tartane]345-a tartane that was lying there with [no one on board]346-no one on board . [He]136-peyrol went into [the hold]347-the hold because [he]136-peyrol was afraid of some dogs on [shore]275-shore . [He]136-peyrol found down there a heap of empty sacks , which made a luxurious couch , and being exhausted went to sleep like a stone . Some time during the night [the crew]349-the crew came on board and [the tartane]350-the tartane sailed for [Marseilles]15-marseilles . That was another awful scare - being hauled out by the scruff of the neck on [the deck]351-the deck and being asked who [the devil]352-the devil [he]352-the devil was and what [he]352-the devil was doing [there]266-there . Only from that one [he]136-peyrol could not run away . There was water all around [him]136-peyrol and [the whole world]354-the whole world , including [the coast not very far away]355-the coast not very far away , wobbled in a most alarming manner . [Three bearded men]356-three bearded men stood about [him]136-peyrol and [he]136-peyrol tried to explain to [them]356-three bearded men that [he]136-peyrol had been working at [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's . [Peyrol]136-peyrol was [the farmer]340-the farmer 's name . [The boy]358-the boy did n't know that [he]358-the boy had one of [his]358-the boy own . Moreover , [he]358-the boy did n't know very well how to talk to [people]287-people , and [they]287-people must have misunderstood [him]358-the boy . Thus the name of [Peyrol]136-peyrol stuck to [him]358-the boy for life . There the memories of [[his]358-the boy native country]256-his native country stopped , overlaid by other memories , with a multitude of impressions of [endless oceans]361-endless oceans , of [the Mozambique Channel]16-the mozambique channel , of [Arabs]17-arabs and [negroes]362-negroes , of [Madagascar]18-madagascar , of [the coast of [India]19-india]363-the coast of india , of [islands and channels and reefs]364-islands and channels and reefs ; of fights at [sea]228-sea , rows on [shore]275-shore , desperate slaughter and desperate thirst , of [all sorts of ships]367-all sorts of ships one after another : [merchant ships]368-merchant ships and [frigates]369-frigates and [privateers]370-privateers ; of [reckless men]371-reckless men and enormous sprees . In the course of years [he]358-the boy had learned to speak intelligibly and think connectedly and even to read and write after a fashion . The name of [the farmer Peyrol]136-peyrol , attached to [[his]358-the boy person]372-his person on account of [his]358-the boy inability to give a clear account of [himself]358-the boy , acquired a sort of reputation , both openly , in [the ports of [the East]3-the east]373-the ports of the east and , secretly , amongst [the Brothers of [the Coast]10-the coast]2677-the brothers of the coast , that strange fraternity with something masonic and not a little piratical in its constitution . Round [the Cape of Storms]375-the cape of storms , which is also [the Cape of Good Hope]376-the cape of good hope , the words Republic , Nation , Tyranny , Liberty , Equality , and Fraternity , and the cult of [the Supreme Being]116-the supreme being came floating on board [ships]377-ships from [home]2668-home , new cries and new ideas which did not upset the slowly developed intelligence of [the gunner Peyrol]136-peyrol . [They]379-they seemed the invention of [landsmen]380-landsmen , of whom [the seaman Peyrol]381-the seaman peyrol knew very little - nothing , so to speak . Now , after nearly fifty years of lawful and lawless sea - life , [Citizen Peyrol]136-peyrol , at [the yard gate of [the roadside inn]383-the roadside inn]382-the yard gate of the roadside inn , looked at the late scene of [his]136-peyrol childhood . [He]136-peyrol looked at [it]384-it without any animosity , but a little puzzled as to [his]136-peyrol bearings amongst [the features of [the land]386-the land]385-the features of the land . " Yes , it must be somewhere in that direction , "[136-peyrol] [he]136-peyrol thought vaguely . Decidedly [he]136-peyrol would go no further along [the high road]325-the high road . . . . A few yards away [the woman of [the inn]389-the inn]388-the woman of the inn stood looking at [him]136-peyrol , impressed by the good clothes , the great shaven cheeks , the well - to - do air of [that seaman]390-that seaman ; and suddenly [Peyrol]136-peyrol noticed [her]388-the woman of the inn . With [her]388-the woman of the inn anxious brown face , [her]388-the woman of the inn grey locks , and [her]388-the woman of the inn rustic appearance [she]388-the woman of the inn might have been [[his]136-peyrol mother]335-his mother , as [he]136-peyrol remembered [her]388-the woman of the inn , only [she]388-the woman of the inn was n't in rags . " H ! [La mre]2682-la mre , "[388-the woman of the inn] hailed [Peyrol]136-peyrol . " Have [you]2682-la mre got [a man]278-a man to lend a hand with [my]136-peyrol chest into [the house]2684-the house ? "[136-peyrol] [He]136-peyrol looked so prosperous and so authoritative that [she]388-the woman of the inn piped without hesitation in a thin voice , " Mais oui , [citoyen]2654-citoyen . [He]136-peyrol will be here in a moment . "[388-the woman of the inn] In the dusk the clump of pines across [the road]304-the road looked very black against the quiet clear sky ; and [Citizen Peyrol]136-peyrol gazed at the scene of [his]136-peyrol young misery with the greatest possible placidity . Here [he]136-peyrol was after nearly fifty years , and to look at things it seemed like yesterday . [He]136-peyrol felt for all this neither love nor resentment . [He]136-peyrol felt a little funny as it were , and the funniest thing was the thought which crossed [his]136-peyrol mind that [he]136-peyrol could indulge [his]136-peyrol fancy if [he]136-peyrol had a mind to it to buy up all [this land]393-this land to [the furthermost field]394-the furthermost field , away over there where the track lost itself sinking into the flats bordering [the sea]281-the sea where [the small rise at the end of [the Giens peninsula had assumed the appearance of a black cloud]397-the giens peninsula had assumed the appearance of a black cloud]396-the small rise at the end of the giens peninsula had assumed the appearance of a black cloud . " Tell [me]136-peyrol , [[my]136-peyrol friend]2686-my friend , "[136-peyrol] [he]136-peyrol said in [his]136-peyrol magisterial way to [the farmhand with a tousled head of hair who was awaiting [his]136-peyrol good pleasure]398-the farmhand with a tousled head of hair who was awaiting his good pleasure , " does n't [this track]2687-this track lead to [Almanarre]14-almanarre ? "[136-peyrol] " Yes , "[399-the labourer] said [the labourer]399-the labourer , and [Peyrol]136-peyrol nodded . [The man]400-the man continued , mouthing [his]400-the man words slowly as if unused to speech . " To [Almanarre]14-almanarre and further too , beyond [the great pond]2688-the great pond right out to [the end of [the land]386-the land]2689-the end of the land , to [Cape Esterel]20-cape esterel . "[400-the man] [Peyrol]136-peyrol was lending [his]136-peyrol big flat hairy ear . " If [I]136-peyrol had stayed in [this country]2691-this country , "[136-peyrol] [he]136-peyrol thought , " [I]136-peyrol would be talking like [this fellow]2692-this fellow . "[136-peyrol] And aloud [he]136-peyrol asked : " Are there [any houses]2693-any houses [there]266-there , at [the end of [the land]386-the land]2689-the end of the land ? "[136-peyrol] " Why , [a hamlet]2697-a hamlet , [a hole]2698-a hole , just [a few houses]2699-a few houses round [a church]2700-a church and [a farm]2701-a farm where at one time [they]2702-they would give [you]136-peyrol a glass of wine . "[136-peyrol] [Citizen Peyrol]136-peyrol stayed at [the inn - yard]401-the inn - yard gate till the night had swallowed up all those features of [the land]386-the land to which [his]136-peyrol eyes had clung as long as the last gleams of daylight . And even after the last gleams had gone [he]136-peyrol had remained for some time staring into the darkness in which all [he]136-peyrol could distinguish was [the white road at [his]136-peyrol feet]403-the white road at his feet and the black heads of pines where [the cart track]404-the cart track dipped towards [the coast]405-the coast . [He]136-peyrol did not go [indoors]406-indoors till [some carters who had been refreshing [themselves]407-some carters who had been refreshing themselves]407-some carters who had been refreshing themselves had departed with [[their]407-some carters who had been refreshing themselves big two - wheeled carts]408-their big two - wheeled carts piled up high with empty wine - casks , in the direction of [Frjus]12-frjus . The fact that [they]407-some carters who had been refreshing themselves did not remain for the night pleased [Peyrol]136-peyrol . [He]136-peyrol ate [his]136-peyrol bit of supper alone , in silence , and with a gravity which intimidated [the old woman who had aroused in [him]136-peyrol the memory of [[his]136-peyrol mother]335-his mother]409-the old woman who had aroused in him the memory of his mother . Having finished [his]136-peyrol pipe and obtained a bit of candle in a tin candle - stick , [Citizen Peyrol]136-peyrol went heavily [upstairs]411-upstairs to rejoin [his]136-peyrol luggage . [The crazy staircase]412-the crazy staircase shook and groaned under [his]136-peyrol feet as though [he]136-peyrol had been carrying a burden . The first thing [he]136-peyrol did was to close the shutters most carefully as though [he]136-peyrol had been afraid of a breath of night air . Next [he]136-peyrol bolted the door of [the room]413-the room . Then sitting on the floor , with the candlestick standing before [him]136-peyrol between [his]136-peyrol widely straddled legs , [he]136-peyrol began to undress , flinging off [his]136-peyrol coat and dragging [his]136-peyrol shirt hastily over [his]136-peyrol head . The secret of [his]136-peyrol heavy movements was disclosed then in the fact that [he]136-peyrol had been wearing next [his]136-peyrol bare skin - like a pious penitent [his]136-peyrol hair - shirt - a sort of waistcoat made of two thicknesses of old sail - cloth and stitched all over in the manner of a quilt with tarred twine . Three horn buttons closed it in front . [He]136-peyrol undid them , and after [he]136-peyrol had slipped off the two shoulder - straps which prevented this strange garment from sagging down on [his]136-peyrol hips [he]136-peyrol started rolling it up . Notwithstanding all [his]136-peyrol care there were during this operation several faint chinks of some metal which could not have been lead . [His]136-peyrol bare torso thrown backwards and sustained by [his]136-peyrol rigid big arms heavily tattooed on the white skin above the elbows , [Peyrol]136-peyrol drew a long breath into [his]136-peyrol broad chest with a pepper - and - salt pelt down the breastbone . And not only was the breast of [Citizen Peyrol]136-peyrol relieved to the fullest of its athletic capacity , but a change had also come over [his]136-peyrol large physiognomy on which the expression of severe stolidity had been simply the result of physical discomfort . It is n't a trifle to have to carry girt about [your]414-your ribs and hung from [your]414-your shoulders a mass of mixed foreign coins equal to sixty or seventy thousand francs in hard cash ; while as to the paper money of [the Republic]261-the republic , [Peyrol]136-peyrol had had already enough experience of it to estimate the equivalent in cartloads . A thousand of them . Perhaps two thousand . Enough in any case to justify [his]136-peyrol flight of fancy , while looking at [the countryside]416-the countryside in the light of the sunset , that what [he]136-peyrol had on [him]136-peyrol would buy all that soil from which [he]136-peyrol had sprung : [houses]417-houses , woods , vines , olives , [vegetable gardens]418-vegetable gardens , rocks and [salt lagoons]419-salt lagoons - in fact , the whole landscape , including the animals in [it]416-the countryside . But [Peyrol]136-peyrol did not care for [the land]386-the land at all . [He]136-peyrol did not want to own any part of [the solid earth]421-the solid earth for which [he]136-peyrol had no love . All [he]136-peyrol wanted from [it]421-the solid earth was [a quiet nook]422-a quiet nook , an obscure corner out of [men]423-men 's sight where [he]136-peyrol could dig a hole unobserved . That would have to be done pretty soon , [he]136-peyrol thought . [One]2670-one could not live for an indefinite number of days with a treasure strapped round [one]2670-one 's chest . Meantime , an utter stranger in [[his]136-peyrol native country]256-his native country the landing on which was perhaps the biggest adventure in [his]136-peyrol adventurous life , [he]136-peyrol threw [his]136-peyrol jacket over the rolled - up waistcoat and laid [his]136-peyrol head down on it after extinguishing the candle . The night was warm . The floor of [the room]413-the room happened to be of planks , not of tiles . [He]136-peyrol was no stranger to that sort of couch . With [his]136-peyrol cudgel laid ready at [his]136-peyrol hand [Peyrol]136-peyrol slept soundly till the noises and the voices about [the house]2684-the house and on [the road]304-the road woke [him]136-peyrol up shortly after sunrise . [He]136-peyrol threw open the , shutter , welcoming the morning light and the morning breeze in the full enjoyment of idleness which , to [a seaman of [his]136-peyrol kind]430-a seaman of his kind , is inseparable from the fact of being on [shore]275-shore . There was nothing to trouble [his]136-peyrol thoughts ; and though [his]136-peyrol physiognomy was far from being vacant , it did not wear the aspect of profound meditation . It had been by the merest accident that [he]136-peyrol had discovered during the passage , in a secret recess within [one of the lockers of [his]136-peyrol prize]432-one of the lockers of his prize , two bags of mixed coins : gold mohurs , Dutch ducats , Spanish pieces , English guineas . After making that discovery [he]136-peyrol had suffered from no doubts whatever . Loot big or little was a natural fact of [[his]136-peyrol freebooter]433-his freebooter 's life . And now when by the force of things [he]136-peyrol had become [a master - gunner of [the Navy]21-the navy]434-a master - gunner of the navy [he]136-peyrol was not going to give up [his]136-peyrol find to [confounded landsmen]435-confounded landsmen , [mere sharks]436-mere sharks , [hungry quill - drivers]437-hungry quill - drivers , who would put it in [their]437-hungry quill - drivers own pockets . As to imparting the intelligence to [[his]136-peyrol crew]438-his crew all bad characters , [he]136-peyrol was much too wise to do anything of the kind . [They]438-his crew would not have been above cutting [his]136-peyrol throat . [An old fighting sea]439-an old fighting sea - dog , [a Brother of [the Coast]405-the coast]440-a brother of the coast , had more right to such plunder than anybody on [earth]442-earth . So at odd times , while at [sea]228-sea , [he]136-peyrol had busied [himself]136-peyrol within the privacy of [[his]136-peyrol cabin]241-his cabin in constructing the ingenious canvas waistcoat in which [he]136-peyrol could take [his]136-peyrol treasure ashore secretly . It was bulky , but [his]136-peyrol garments were of an ample cut , and [no wretched customs - guard]445-no wretched customs - guard would dare to lay hands on [a successful prize - master going to [the Port Admiral 's offices]447-the port admiral 's offices]446-a successful prize - master going to the port admiral 's offices to make [his]136-peyrol report . The scheme had worked perfectly . [He]136-peyrol found , however , that this secret garment , which was worth precisely its weight in gold , tried [his]136-peyrol endurance more than [he]136-peyrol had expected . It wearied [his]136-peyrol body and even depressed [his]136-peyrol spirits somewhat . It made [him]136-peyrol less active and also less communicative . It reminded [him]136-peyrol all the time that [he]136-peyrol must not get into trouble of any sort - keep clear of rows , of intimacies , of promiscuous jollities . This was one of the reasons why [he]136-peyrol had been anxious to get away from [the town]225-the town . Once , however , [his]136-peyrol head was laid on [his]136-peyrol treasure [he]136-peyrol could sleep the sleep of the just . Nevertheless in the morning [he]136-peyrol shrank from putting it on again . With a mixture of [sailor]449-sailor 's carelessness and of old - standing belief in [his]136-peyrol own luck [he]136-peyrol simply stuffed the precious waistcoat up the flue of the empty fireplace . Then [he]136-peyrol dressed and had [his]136-peyrol breakfast . An hour later , mounted on a hired mule , [he]136-peyrol started down [the track]450-the track as calmly as though setting out to explore the mysteries of [a desert island]451-a desert island . [His]136-peyrol aim was the end of [the peninsula]452-the peninsula which , advancing like [a colossal jetty into [the sea]281-the sea]453-a colossal jetty into the sea , divides [the picturesque roadstead of [Hyres]22-hyres]455-the picturesque roadstead of hyres from the headlands and curves of [the coast]405-the coast forming the approaches of [the Port of [Toulon]1-toulon]217-the port of toulon . [The path along which the sure - footed mule took [him]136-peyrol for [Peyrol]136-peyrol]458-the path along which the sure - footed mule took him for peyrol , once [he]136-peyrol had put its head the right way , made no attempt at steering descended rapidly to [a plain of and aspect]459-a plain of and aspect , with the white gleams of [the Salins]24-the salins in the distance , bounded by bluish hills of no great elevation . Soon all traces of human habitations disappeared from before [his]136-peyrol roaming eyes . This part of [[his]136-peyrol native country]256-his native country was more foreign to [him]136-peyrol than [the shores of [the Mozambique Channel]462-the mozambique channel]461-the shores of the mozambique channel , [the coral strands of [India]19-india]463-the coral strands of india , [the forests of [Madagascar]18-madagascar]464-the forests of madagascar . Before long [he]136-peyrol found [himself]136-peyrol on the neck of [[the Giens]31-the giens peninsula peninsula]465-the giens peninsula , impregnated with salt and containing a blue lagoon , particularly blue , darker and even more still than the expanses of [the sea]281-the sea to the right and left of [it]467-it from which it was separated by [narrow strips of land]468-narrow strips of land not a hundred yards wide in places . [The track]450-the track ran indistinct , presenting no wheel - ruts , and with patches of efflorescent salt as white as snow between the tufts of wiry grass and the particularly dead - looking bushes . [The whole neck of land]470-the whole neck of land was so low that it seemed to have no more thickness than a sheet of paper laid on [the sea]281-the sea . [Citizen Peyrol]136-peyrol saw on the level of [his]136-peyrol eye , as if from a mere raft , sails of [various craft]472-various craft , some white and some brown , while before [him]136-peyrol [[his]136-peyrol native island of Porquerolles]473-his native island of porquerolles rose dull and solid beyond [a wide strip of water]474-a wide strip of water . [The mule , which knew rather better than [Citizen Peyrol]136-peyrol where it was going to]475-the mule , which knew rather better than citizen peyrol where it was going to , took [him]136-peyrol presently amongst the gentle rises at [the end of [the peninsula]452-the peninsula]476-the end of the peninsula . [The slopes]478-the slopes were covered with scanty grass ; crooked boundary walls of dry stones ran across [the fields]479-the fields , and above [them]479-the fields , here and there , peeped a low roof of red tiles shaded by the heads of delicate acacias . At a turn of [the ravine]480-the ravine appeared [a village with [[its]481-a village with its few houses , mostly with their blind walls to the path , and , at first , no living soul in sight few houses]482-its few houses , mostly with [their]482-its few houses blind walls to [the path]483-the path , and , at first , [no living soul in sight]484-no living soul in sight]481-a village with its few houses , mostly with their blind walls to the path , and , at first , no living soul in sight . Three tall platanes , very ragged as to [their]485-their bark and very poor as to foliage , stood in a group in [an open space]486-an open space ; and [Citizen Peyrol]136-peyrol was cheered by the sight of a dog sleeping in the shade . The mule swerved with great determination towards [a massive stone trough under [the village fountain]488-the village fountain]487-a massive stone trough under the village fountain . [Peyrol]136-peyrol , looking round from the saddle while [the mule]489-the mule drank , could see no signs of [an inn]490-an inn . Then , examining [the ground nearer to [him]136-peyrol]491-the ground nearer to him , [he]136-peyrol perceived [a ragged man sitting on a stone]492-a ragged man sitting on a stone . [He]492-a ragged man sitting on a stone had a broad leathern belt and [his]492-a ragged man sitting on a stone legs were bare to the knee . [He]492-a ragged man sitting on a stone was contemplating [the stranger on the mule]493-the stranger on the mule with stony surprise . [His]492-a ragged man sitting on a stone dark nut - brown face contrasted strongly with [his]492-a ragged man sitting on a stone grey shock of hair . At a sign from [Peyrol]136-peyrol [he]492-a ragged man sitting on a stone showed no reluctance and approached [him]492-a ragged man sitting on a stone readily without changing the stony character of [his]492-a ragged man sitting on a stone stare . The thought that if [he]136-peyrol had remained at [home]2668-home [he]136-peyrol would have probably looked like [that man]495-that man crossed unbidden the mind of [Peyrol]136-peyrol . With that gravity from which [he]136-peyrol seldom departed [he]136-peyrol inquired if there were [any inhabitants besides [himself]136-peyrol in [the village]497-the village]496-any inhabitants besides himself in the village . Then , to [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's surprise , [that destitute idler]498-that destitute idler smiled pleasantly and said that [the people]499-the people were out looking after [[their]499-the people bits of land]500-their bits of land . There was enough of [the peasant - born]501-the peasant - born in [Peyrol]136-peyrol , still , to remark that [he]498-that destitute idler had seen [no man]502-no man , [woman]503-woman , or [child]504-child , or four - footed beast for hours , and that [he]498-that destitute idler would hardly have thought that there was [any land worth looking after anywhere around]505-any land worth looking after anywhere around . But [the other]506-the other insisted . Well , [they]507-they were working on it all the same , at least those that had any . At the sound of the voices the dog got up with a strange air of being all backbone , and , approaching in dismal fidelity , stood with [his]136-peyrol nose close to [[his]136-peyrol master]508-his master 's calves . " And [you]400-the man , "[136-peyrol] said [Peyrol]136-peyrol , " [you]400-the man have [no land]2703-no land then ? "[136-peyrol] [The man]400-the man took [his]400-the man time to answer . " [I]400-the man have [a boat]2704-a boat . "[400-the man] [Peyrol]136-peyrol became interested when [the man]400-the man explained that [[his]400-the man boat]511-his boat was on [the salt pond]512-the salt pond , [the large , deserted and opaque sheet of water lying dead between [the two great bays of the living sea]514-the two great bays of the living sea]513-the large , deserted and opaque sheet of water lying dead between the two great bays of the living sea . [Peyrol]136-peyrol wondered aloud why [any one]515-any one should want [a boat]2704-a boat on [it]512-the salt pond . " There is fish there , "[400-the man] said [the man]400-the man . " And is [the boat]2705-the boat all [your]400-the man worldly goods ? "[136-peyrol] asked [Peyrol]136-peyrol . The flies buzzed , the mule hung its head , moving its ears and flapping its thin tail languidly . " [I]400-the man have a sort of hut down by [the lagoon]2706-the lagoon and a net or two , "[400-the man] [the man]400-the man confessed , as it were . [Peyrol]136-peyrol , looking down , completed the list by saying : " And this dog . "[136-peyrol] [The man]400-the man again took [his]400-the man time to say : " [He]2707-he is [company]2708-company . "[400-the man] [Peyrol]136-peyrol sat as serious as [a judge]520-a judge . " [You]400-the man have n't much to make a living of , "[136-peyrol] [he]136-peyrol delivered [himself]136-peyrol at last . " However ! . . . Is there [no inn]2709-no inn , [caf]2710-caf , or some place where [one]2670-one could put up for a day ? [I]136-peyrol have heard up inland that there was some such place . "[136-peyrol] " [I]400-the man will show it to [you]400-the man , "[400-the man] said [the man]400-the man , who then went back to where [he]400-the man had been sitting and picked up a large empty basket before [he]400-the man led the way . [His]400-the man dog followed with [his]400-the man head and tail low , and then came [Peyrol]136-peyrol dangling [his]136-peyrol heels against the sides of the intelligent mule , which seemed to know before - hand all that was going to happen . At the corner where [the houses]522-the houses ended there stood an old wooden cross stuck into a square block of stone . [The lonely boatman of [the Lagoon of [Pesquiers]27-pesquiers]26-the lagoon of pesquiers]523-the lonely boatman of the lagoon of pesquiers pointed in the direction of a branching path where [the rises terminating [the peninsula]452-the peninsula]524-the rises terminating the peninsula sank into [a shallow pass]526-a shallow pass . There were leaning pines on the skyline , and in [the pass]527-the pass [itself]527-the pass dull silvery green patches of olive orchards below a long yellow wall backed by dark cypresses , and the red roofs of buildings which seemed to belong to [a farm]2701-a farm . " Will [they]2712-they lodge [me]136-peyrol there "[136-peyrol] asked [Peyrol]136-peyrol . " [I]136-peyrol do n't know . [They]2712-they will have [plenty of room]2713-plenty of room , that 's certain . There are [no travellers]2714-no travellers [here]2715-here . But as for [a place of refreshment]2716-a place of refreshment , it used to be that . [You]2717-you have only got to walk in . If [he]2718-he is n't [there]266-there , [the mistress]2720-the mistress is sure to be there to serve [you]2717-you . [She]2720-the mistress belongs to [the place]2721-the place . [She]2720-the mistress was born on [it]2721-the place . [We]2722-we know all about [her]2720-the mistress . "[136-peyrol] " What sort of woman is [she]2720-the mistress ? "[136-peyrol] asked [Citizen Peyrol]136-peyrol , who was very favourably impressed by the aspect of [the place]2721-the place . " Well , [you]2717-you are going [there]266-there . [You]2717-you shall soon see . [She]2720-the mistress is young . "[136-peyrol] " And [the husband]2724-the husband ? "[136-peyrol] asked [Peyrol]136-peyrol , who , looking down into the other 's steady upward stare , detected a flicker in the brown , slightly faded eyes . " Why are [you]506-the other staring at [me]506-the other like this ? [I]506-the other have n't got a black skin , have [I]506-the other ? "[506-the other] [The other]506-the other smiled , showing in the thick pepper - and - salt growth on [his]506-the other face as sound a set of teeth as [Citizen Peyrol]136-peyrol [himself]136-peyrol . And this seemed to [him]136-peyrol outrageous . "[536-the fellow] The sun blazed on the boulders and stones and bushes in the perfect stillness of the air . [Peyrol]136-peyrol remembered suddenly [the sans - culotte]571-the sans - culotte - [the blood - drinker]572-the blood - drinker . [[Her]561-the woman husband]573-her husband . Was it possible ? . . . Well , perhaps it was possible . [He]136-peyrol could not tell . [He]136-peyrol felt [his]136-peyrol utter incompetence . As to catching [her]561-the woman glance , [you]574-you might just as well have tried to catch a wild sea - bird with [your]574-you hands . And altogether [she]561-the woman was like a sea - bird - not to be grasped . But [Peyrol]136-peyrol knew how to be patient , with that patience that is so often a form of courage . [He]136-peyrol was known for it . It had served [him]136-peyrol well in dangerous situations . Once it had positively saved [his]136-peyrol life . Nothing but patience . [He]136-peyrol could well wait now . [He]136-peyrol waited . And suddenly as if tamed by [his]136-peyrol patience [this strange creature]575-this strange creature dropped [her]575-this strange creature eyelids , advanced quite close to [him]136-peyrol and began to finger the lapel of [his]136-peyrol coat - something that [a child]2774-a child might have done . [Peyrol]136-peyrol , staring at the open [kitchen]579-kitchen door , saw after a moment [an elderly woman]580-an elderly woman 's head , with brown thin cheeks and tied up in a coloured handkerchief , peeping at [him]136-peyrol fearfully . " A bottle of wine , please , "[136-peyrol] [he]136-peyrol shouted at it . The affectation common to seamen of never being surprised at anything that [sea or land]581-sea or land can produce had become in [Peyrol]136-peyrol a second nature . Having learned from childhood to suppress every sign of wonder before all extraordinary sights and events , [all strange people]582-all strange people , all strange customs , and the most alarming phenomena of nature as manifested , for instance , in the violence of volcanoes or the fury of [human beings]583-human beings , [he]136-peyrol had really become indifferent - or only perhaps utterly inexpressive . [He]136-peyrol had seen so much that was bizarre or atrocious , and had heard so many astounding tales , that [his]136-peyrol usual mental reaction before a new experience was generally formulated in the words , " J'en ai vu bien d'autres . "[136-peyrol] The last thing which had touched [him]136-peyrol with the panic of the supernatural had been the death under a heap of rags of [that gaunt , fierce woman]584-that gaunt , fierce woman , [[his]136-peyrol mother]335-his mother ; and the last thing that had nearly overwhelmed [him]136-peyrol at the age of twelve with another kind of terror was the riot of sound and the multitude of mankind on [the quays in [Marseilles]15-marseilles]586-the quays in marseilles , something perfectly inconceivable from which [he]136-peyrol had instantly taken refuge behind a stack of wheat sacks after having been chased ashore from [the tartane]350-the tartane . [He]136-peyrol had remained there quaking till [a man in a cocked hat]588-a man in a cocked hat and with a sabre at [his]136-peyrol side [the boy]358-the boy had never seen either such a hat or such a sabre in [his]136-peyrol life had seized [him]136-peyrol by the arm close to the armpit and had hauled [him]136-peyrol out from there ; [a man who might have been [an ogre]591-an ogre only [Peyrol]136-peyrol had never heard of [an ogre]591-an ogre but at any rate in [his]136-peyrol own way]590-a man who might have been an ogre only peyrol had never heard of an ogre but at any rate in his own way was alarming and wonderful beyond anything [he]136-peyrol could have imagined - if the faculty of imagination had been developed in [him]136-peyrol then . No doubt all this was enough to make [one]2670-one die of fright , but that possibility never occurred to [him]136-peyrol . Neither did [he]136-peyrol go mad ; but being only [a child]2774-a child , [he]136-peyrol had simply adapted [himself]136-peyrol , by means of passive acquiescence , to the new and inexplicable conditions of life in something like twenty - four hours . After that initiation the rest of [his]136-peyrol existence , from flying fishes to whales and on to [black men]595-black men and [coral reefs]596-coral reefs , to decks running with blood , and thirst in [open boats]597-open boats , was comparatively plain sailing . By the time [he]136-peyrol had heard of a Revolution in [France]28-france and of certain Immortal Principles causing the death of [many people]598-many people , from the mouths of [seamen]599-seamen and [travellers]600-travellers and [year - old gazettes coming out of [Europe]29-europe]601-year - old gazettes coming out of europe , [he]136-peyrol was ready to appreciate contemporary history in [his]136-peyrol own particular way . Mutiny and throwing [officers]602-officers overboard . [He]136-peyrol had seen that twice and [he]136-peyrol was on a different side each time . As to this upset , [he]136-peyrol took no side . It was too far - too big - also not distinct enough . But [he]136-peyrol acquired the revolutionary jargon quickly enough and used it on occasion , with secret contempt . What [he]136-peyrol had gone through , from a spell of crazy love for [a yellow girl]603-a yellow girl to the experience of treachery from [a bosom friend]604-a bosom friend and [shipmate]605-shipmate and both those things [Peyrol]136-peyrol confessed to [himself]136-peyrol [he]136-peyrol could never hope to understand , with all the graduations of varied experience of [men]423-men and passions between , had put a drop of universal scorn , a wonderful sedative , into the strange mixture which might have been called the soul of [the returned Peyrol]136-peyrol . Therefore [he]136-peyrol not only showed no surprise but did not feel any when [he]136-peyrol beheld [the master]2770-the master , in the right of [[his]136-peyrol wife]608-his wife , of [the Escampobar Farm]609-the escampobar farm . [The homeless [Peyrol]136-peyrol , sitting in the bare salle with a bottle of wine before [him]136-peyrol]610-the homeless peyrol , sitting in the bare salle with a bottle of wine before him , was in the act of raising the glass to [his]136-peyrol lips when [the man]400-the man entered , [ex - orator in the sections]612-ex - orator in the sections , [leader of [red - capped mobs]614-red - capped mobs]613-leader of red - capped mobs , [hunter of [the ci - devants]616-the ci - devants and [priests]617-priests]615-hunter of the ci - devants and priests , [purveyor of the guillotine]618-purveyor of the guillotine , in short [a blood - drinker]619-a blood - drinker . And [Citizen Peyrol , who had never been nearer than six thousand miles as the crow flies to the realities of the Revolution]620-citizen peyrol , who had never been nearer than six thousand miles as the crow flies to the realities of the revolution , put down [his]136-peyrol glass and in [his]136-peyrol deep unemotional voice said : " [Salut]122-salut . "[136-peyrol] [The other]506-the other returned [a much fainter " Salut]2785-a much fainter " salut , "[506-the other] staring at [the stranger of whom [he]136-peyrol had heard already]622-the stranger of whom he had heard already . [His]136-peyrol almond - shaped , soft eyes were noticeably shiny and so was to a certain extent the skin on [his]136-peyrol high but rounded cheekbones , coloured red like a mask of which all the rest was but a mass of clipped chestnut hair growing so thick and close around the lips as to hide altogether the design of the mouth which , for all Citizen [Peyrol]136-peyrol knew , might have been of a quite ferocious character . A careworn forehead and a perpendicular nose suggested a certain austerity proper to [an ardent patriot]623-an ardent patriot . [He]136-peyrol held in [his]136-peyrol hand a long bright knife which [he]136-peyrol laid down on one of the tables at once . [He]136-peyrol did n't seem more than thirty years old , [a well - made man of medium height , with a lack of resolution in [his]136-peyrol bearing]624-a well - made man of medium height , with a lack of resolution in his bearing . Something like disillusion was suggested by the set of [his]136-peyrol shoulders . The effect was subtle , but [Peyrol]136-peyrol became aware of it while [he]136-peyrol explained [his]136-peyrol case and finished the tale by declaring that [he]136-peyrol was [a seaman of [the Republic]261-the republic]625-a seaman of the republic and that [he]136-peyrol had always done [his]136-peyrol duty before [the enemy]627-the enemy . [The blood - drinker]572-the blood - drinker had listened profoundly . The high arches of [his]136-peyrol eyebrows gave [him]136-peyrol an astonished look . [He]136-peyrol came close up to the table and spoke in a trembling voice . " [You]2786-you may have ! But [you]2786-you may all the same be corrupt . [The seamen of [the Republic]261-the republic]2787-the seamen of the republic were eaten up with corruption paid for with the gold of [the tyrants]2789-the tyrants . Who would have guessed it ? [They]2787-the seamen of the republic all talked like [patriots]2790-patriots . And yet [the English]544-the english entered [the harbour]2792-the harbour and landed in [the town]225-the town without opposition . [The armies of [the Republic]261-the republic]2794-the armies of the republic drove [them]544-the english out , but treachery stalks in [the land]386-the land , it comes up out of the ground , it sits at [our]2797-our hearthstones , lurks in the bosom of [the representatives of [the people]499-the people]2798-the representatives of the people , of [[our]2797-our fathers]2800-our fathers , of [[our]2797-our brothers]2801-our brothers . There was a time when civic virtue flourished , but now it has got to hide [its]261-the republic head . And [I]136-peyrol will tell [you]2802-you why : there has not been enough killing . [It]2803-it seems as if there could never be enough of it . It 's discouraging . Look what [we]2797-our have come to . "[136-peyrol] [His]629-his voice died in [his]629-his throat as though [he]629-his had suddenly lost confidence in [himself]629-his . " Bring another glass , [citoyen]2654-citoyen , "[136-peyrol] said [Peyrol]136-peyrol , after a short pause , " and let 's drink together . [We]2797-our will drink to the confusion of [traitors]2758-traitors . [I]136-peyrol detest treachery as much as [any man]2806-any man , but . . . "[136-peyrol] [He]136-peyrol waited till [the other]506-the other had returned , then poured out the wine , and after [they]631-they had touched glasses and half emptied them , [he]136-peyrol put down [his]136-peyrol own and continued : " But [you]2802-you see [I]136-peyrol have nothing to do with [your]2802-you politics . [I]136-peyrol was at [the other side of [the world]2656-the world]2655-the other side of the world , therefore [you]2802-you ca n't suspect [me]136-peyrol of being [a traitor]2809-a traitor . [You]2802-you were cutting off heads without much compunction . . . . The pure complexion of [her]660-the girl standing in the doorway white cheeks was set off brilliantly by [her]660-the girl standing in the doorway coral lips and the bands of raven - black hair only partly covered by a muslin cap trimmed with lace . [She]660-the girl standing in the doorway made no sign , uttered no sound , behaved exactly as if there had been [nobody]2665-nobody in [the room]413-the room ; and [Peyrol]136-peyrol suddenly averted [his]136-peyrol eyes from that mute and unconscious face with its roaming eyes . " [You]136-peyrol have a view of salt water on three sides of [you]136-peyrol , "[667-peyrol 's future host] remarked [[Peyrol]136-peyrol 's future host]667-peyrol 's future host . [The farmhouse]655-the farmhouse was [a tall building]669-a tall building , and [this large attic with [its]670-this large attic with its three windows three windows]670-this large attic with its three windows commanded on one side the view of [[Hyres]22-hyres roadstead]671-hyres roadstead on the first plan , with further blue undulations of [the coast]405-the coast as far as [Frjus]12-frjus ; and on the other the vast semicircle of [barren high hills]673-barren high hills , broken by the entrance to [[Toulon]1-toulon harbour guarded by [forts and batteries]675-forts and batteries]674-toulon harbour guarded by forts and batteries , and ending in [Cape Cpet]33-cape cpet , [a squat mountain , with sombre folds and a base of brown rocks]676-a squat mountain , with sombre folds and a base of brown rocks , with a white spot gleaming on the very summit of [it]33-cape cpet , [a ci - devant shrine dedicated to [Our Lady]678-our lady]677-a ci - devant shrine dedicated to our lady , and [a ci - devant place of pilgrimage]679-a ci - devant place of pilgrimage . " It 's like being in [a lighthouse]2823-a lighthouse , "[136-peyrol] said [Peyrol]136-peyrol . " Not [a bad place for [a seaman]2825-a seaman to live in]2824-a bad place for a seaman to live in . "[136-peyrol] The sight of the sails dotted about cheered [his]136-peyrol heart . [The people of [landsmen]380-landsmen]681-the people of landsmen with [[their]681-the people of landsmen houses]683-their houses and animals and activities did not count . What made for [him]136-peyrol the life of [any strange shore]684-any strange shore were the craft that belonged to [it]684-any strange shore : [canoes]685-canoes , catamarans , ballahous , praus , lorchas , [mere dug - outs]686-mere dug - outs , or even rafts of tied logs with a bit of mat for a sail from which [naked brown men]687-naked brown men fished along stretches of white sand crushed under the tropical skyline , sinister in its glare and with a thunder - cloud crouching on the horizon . But here [he]136-peyrol beheld a perfect serenity , nothing sombre on [the shore]231-the shore , nothing ominous in the sunshine . The sky rested lightly on the distant and vaporous outline of [the hills]689-the hills ; and the immobility of all things seemed poised in the air like a gay mirage . On [this tideless sea]690-this tideless sea several tartanes lay becalmed in [the Petite Passe]34-the petite passe between [Porquerolles]13-porquerolles and [Cape Esterel]20-cape esterel , yet theirs was not the stillness of death but of light slumber , the immobility of a smiling enchantment , of a Mediterranean fair day , breathless sometimes but never without life . Whatever enchantment [Peyrol]136-peyrol had known in [his]136-peyrol wanderings it had never been so remote from all thoughts of strife and death , so full of smiling security , making all [his]136-peyrol past appear to [him]136-peyrol like a chain of lurid days and sultry nights . [He]136-peyrol thought [he]136-peyrol would never want to get away from it , as though [he]136-peyrol had obscurely felt that [[his]136-peyrol old rover]691-his old rover 's soul had been always rooted there . Yes , this was the place for [him]136-peyrol ; not because expediency dictated , but simply because [his]136-peyrol instinct of rest had found its home at last . [He]136-peyrol turned away from the window and found [himself]136-peyrol face to face with [the sans - culotte]571-the sans - culotte , who had apparently come up to [him]136-peyrol from behind , perhaps with the intention of tapping [him]136-peyrol on the shoulder , but who now turned away [his]136-peyrol head . [The young woman]693-the young woman had disappeared . [The coast]405-the coast , of course , was full of indentations , but this was a perfect little pool . " Salut , [citoyen]2654-citoyen . "[710-the patron] There was in [Peyrol]136-peyrol a fund of self - command amounting to placidity . There were men living in [the East]3-the east who had no doubt whatever that [Peyrol]136-peyrol was [a calmly terrible man]711-a calmly terrible man . And [they]712-they would quote illustrative instances which from [their]712-they own point of view were simply admirable . But all [Peyrol]136-peyrol had ever done was to behave rationally , as it seemed to [him]136-peyrol in all sorts of dangerous circumstances without ever being led astray by the nature , or the cruelty , or the danger of any given situation . [He]136-peyrol adapted [himself]136-peyrol to the character of the event and to the very spirit of it , with a profound responsive feeling of a particularly unsentimental kind . Sentiment in itself was an artificiality of which [he]136-peyrol had never heard and if [he]136-peyrol had seen it in action would have appeared to [him]136-peyrol too puzzling to make anything of . That sort of genuineness in acceptance made [him]136-peyrol [a satisfactory inmate of [the Escampobar Farm]609-the escampobar farm]713-a satisfactory inmate of the escampobar farm . [He]136-peyrol duly turned up with all [his]136-peyrol cargo , as [he]136-peyrol called it , and was met at the door of [the farmhouse]655-the farmhouse itself by [the young woman with the pale face and wandering eyes]716-the young woman with the pale face and wandering eyes . Nothing could hold [her]716-the young woman with the pale face and wandering eyes attention for long amongst [her]716-the young woman with the pale face and wandering eyes familiar surroundings . Right and left and far away beyond [you]717-you , [she]716-the young woman with the pale face and wandering eyes seemed to be looking for something while [you]717-you were talking to [her]716-the young woman with the pale face and wandering eyes , so that [you]717-you doubted whether [she]716-the young woman with the pale face and wandering eyes could follow what [you]717-you said . But as a matter of fact [she]716-the young woman with the pale face and wandering eyes had all [her]716-the young woman with the pale face and wandering eyes wits about [her]716-the young woman with the pale face and wandering eyes . In the midst of this strange search for something that was not there [she]716-the young woman with the pale face and wandering eyes had enough detachment to smile at [Peyrol]136-peyrol . Then , withdrawing into [the kitchen]645-the kitchen , [she]716-the young woman with the pale face and wandering eyes watched , as much as [her]716-the young woman with the pale face and wandering eyes restless eyes could watch anything , [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's cargo and [Peyrol]136-peyrol [himself]136-peyrol passing up the stairs . The most valuable part of [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's cargo being strapped to [his]136-peyrol person , the first thing [he]136-peyrol did after being left alone in [that attic room]719-that attic room which was like the lantern of [a lighthouse]2823-a lighthouse was to relieve [himself]136-peyrol of the burden and lay it on the foot of the bed . Then [he]136-peyrol sat down and leaning [his]136-peyrol elbow far on the table [he]136-peyrol contemplated it with a feeling of complete relief . That plunder had never burdened [his]136-peyrol conscience . It had merely on occasion oppressed [his]136-peyrol body ; and if it had at all affected [his]136-peyrol spirits it was not by its secrecy but by its mere weight , which was inconvenient , irritating , and towards the end of a day altogether insupportable . It made [a free - limbed , deep - breathing sailor - man]721-a free - limbed , deep - breathing sailor - man feel like a mere overloaded animal , thus extending whatever there was of compassion in [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's nature towards the four - footed beasts that carry [men]423-men 's burdens on [the earth]723-the earth . The necessities of a lawless life had taught [Peyrol]136-peyrol to be ruthless , but [he]136-peyrol had never been cruel . Sprawling in the chair , stripped to the waist , robust and grey - haired , [his]136-peyrol head with a Roman profile propped up on a mighty and tattooed forearm , [he]136-peyrol remained at ease , with [his]136-peyrol eyes fixed on [his]136-peyrol treasure with an air of meditation . Yet [Peyrol]136-peyrol was not meditating as [a superficial observer]724-a superficial observer might have thought on the best place of concealment . It was not that [he]136-peyrol had not had a great experience of that sort of property which had always melted so quickly through [his]136-peyrol fingers . What made [him]136-peyrol meditative was its character , not of a share of a hard - won booty in toil , in risk , in danger , in privation , but of a piece of luck personally [his]136-peyrol own . [He]136-peyrol knew what plunder was and how soon it went ; but this lot had come to stay . [He]136-peyrol had it with [him]136-peyrol , away from the haunts of [his]136-peyrol lifetime , as if in [another world altogether]725-another world altogether . It could n't be drunk away , gambled away , squandered away in any sort of familiar circumstances , or even given away . In [that room]726-that room , raised a good many feet above [[his]136-peyrol revolutionized native land]727-his revolutionized native land where [he]136-peyrol was more of a stranger than [anywhere else in [the world]2656-the world]728-anywhere else in the world , in [this roomy garret full of light]730-this roomy garret full of light and as [it]730-this roomy garret full of light were surrounded by [the sea]281-the sea , in a great sense of peace and security , [Peyrol]136-peyrol did n't see why [he]136-peyrol should bother [his]136-peyrol head about it so very much . It came to [him]136-peyrol that [he]136-peyrol had never really cared for any plunder that fell into [his]136-peyrol hands . No , never for any . And to take particular care of this for which [no one]732-no one would seek vengeance or attempt recovery would have been absurd . [Peyrol]136-peyrol got up and opened [his]136-peyrol big sandalwood chest secured with an enormous padlock , part , too , of some old plunder gathered in [a Chinese town in [the Gulf of]36-the gulf of [Tonkin]37-tonkin]733-a chinese town in the gulf of tonkin , in company of [certain Brothers of [the Coast]405-the coast]734-certain brothers of the coast , who having boarded at night [a Portuguese schooner]736-a portuguese schooner and sent [[her]736-a portuguese schooner crew]737-her crew adrift in [a boat]2704-a boat , had taken a cruise on [their]734-certain brothers of the coast own account , years and years and years ago . [He]136-peyrol was young then , very young , and the chest fell to [his]136-peyrol share because [nobody else]739-nobody else would have anything to do with the cumbersome thing , and also for the reason that the metal of the curiously wrought thick hoops that strengthened it was not gold but mere brass . [He]136-peyrol , in [his]136-peyrol innocence , had been rather pleased with the article . [He]136-peyrol had carried it about with [him]136-peyrol into all sorts of places , and also [he]136-peyrol had left it behind [him]136-peyrol - once for a whole year in [a dark and noisome cavern on [a certain part of [the Madagascar coast]742-the madagascar coast]741-a certain part of the madagascar coast]740-a dark and noisome cavern on a certain part of the madagascar coast . [He]136-peyrol had left it with [various native chiefs]743-various native chiefs , with [Arabs]744-arabs , with [a gambling - hell keeper in [Pondicherry]38-pondicherry]745-a gambling - hell keeper in pondicherry , with [[his]136-peyrol various friends]746-his various friends in short , and even with [[his]136-peyrol enemies]747-his enemies . Once [he]136-peyrol had lost it altogether . That was on the occasion when [he]136-peyrol had received a wound which laid [him]136-peyrol open and gushing like a slashed wine - skin . A sudden quarrel broke out in [a company of [Brothers]749-brothers]748-a company of brothers over some matter of policy complicated by personal jealousies , as to which [he]136-peyrol was as innocent as [a babe unborn]750-a babe unborn . [He]136-peyrol never knew who gave [him]136-peyrol the slash . [Another Brother]751-another brother , [a chum of his]752-a chum of his , [an English boy]753-an english boy , had rushed in and hauled [him]136-peyrol out of the fray , and then [he]136-peyrol had remembered nothing for days . Even now when [he]136-peyrol looked at the scar [he]136-peyrol could not understand why [he]136-peyrol had not died . That occurrence , with the wound and the painful convalescence , was the first thing that sobered [his]136-peyrol character somewhat . Many years afterwards , when in consequence of [his]136-peyrol altered views of mere lawlessness [he]136-peyrol was serving as quartermaster on board [the Hirondelle]39-the hirondelle , [a comparatively respectable privateer]754-a comparatively respectable privateer , [he]136-peyrol caught sight of that chest again in [Port Louis]40-port louis , of [all places in [the world]2656-the world]755-all places in the world , in [a dark little den of [a shop kept by a lone Hindoo]758-a shop kept by a lone hindoo]757-a dark little den of a shop kept by a lone hindoo . The hour was late , [the side street]759-the side street was empty , and so [Peyrol]136-peyrol went in [there]266-there to claim [[his]136-peyrol property]761-his property , all fair , a dollar in one hand and a pistol in the other , and was entreated abjectly to take it away . [He]136-peyrol carried off the empty chest on [his]136-peyrol shoulder , and that same night [the privateer]762-the privateer went to [sea]228-sea ; then only [he]136-peyrol found time to ascertain that [he]136-peyrol had made no mistake , because , soon after [he]136-peyrol had got it first , [he]136-peyrol had , in grim wantonness , scratched inside the lid , with the point of [his]136-peyrol knife , the rude outline of a skull and cross - bones into which [he]136-peyrol had rubbed afterwards a little Chinese vermilion . And there it was , the whole design , as fresh as ever . In [the garret full of light of [the Escampobar farmhouse]765-the escampobar farmhouse]764-the garret full of light of the escampobar farmhouse , [the grey - haired Peyrol]136-peyrol opened the chest , took all the contents out of it , laying them neatly on the floor , and spread [his]136-peyrol treasure - pockets downwards - over the bottom , which it filled exactly . Busy on [his]136-peyrol knees [he]136-peyrol repacked the chest . A jumper or two , a fine cloth jacket , a remnant piece of Madapolam muslin , costly stuff for which [he]136-peyrol had no use in [the world]2656-the world - a quantity of fine white shirts . [Nobody]2665-nobody would dare to rummage in [his]136-peyrol chest , [he]136-peyrol thought , with the assurance of [a man who had been feared in [his]136-peyrol time]768-a man who had been feared in his time . Then [he]136-peyrol rose , and looking round [the room]413-the room and stretching [his]136-peyrol powerful arms , [he]136-peyrol ceased to think of the treasure , of the future and even of to - morrow , in the sudden conviction that [he]136-peyrol could make [himself]136-peyrol very comfortable [there]266-there . In a tiny bit of a looking - glass hung on the frame of the east window , [Peyrol]136-peyrol , handling the unwearable English blade , was shaving [himself]136-peyrol - for the day was Sunday . The years of political changes ending with the proclamation of [Napoleon]126-napoleon as [Consul for life]771-consul for life had not touched [Peyrol]136-peyrol except as to [his]136-peyrol strong thick head of hair , which was nearly all white now . After putting the razor away carefully , [Peyrol]136-peyrol introduced [his]136-peyrol stockinged feet into a pair of sabots of the very best quality and clattered [downstairs]772-downstairs . [His]136-peyrol brown cloth breeches were untied at the knee and the sleeves of [his]136-peyrol shirt rolled up to [his]136-peyrol shoulders . That sea - rover turned rustic was now perfectly at [home]2668-home in [that farm which , like [a lighthouse]2823-a lighthouse , commanded the view of [two roadsteads]776-two roadsteads and of [the open sea]777-the open sea]774-that farm which , like a lighthouse , commanded the view of two roadsteads and of the open sea . [He]136-peyrol passed through [the kitchen]645-the kitchen . It was exactly as [he]136-peyrol had seen [it]645-the kitchen first , sunlight on the floor , red copper utensils shining on the walls , the table in the middle scrubbed snowy white ; and it was only the old woman , [Aunt Catherine]127-catherine , who seemed to have acquired a sharper profile . The very hen manuvring [her]127-catherine neck pretentiously on the doorstep , might have been standing there for the last eight years . [Peyrol]136-peyrol shooed [her]127-catherine away , and going into [the yard]553-the yard washed [himself]136-peyrol lavishly at the pump . When [he]136-peyrol returned from [the yard]553-the yard [he]136-peyrol looked so fresh and hale that [old Catherine]127-catherine complimented [him]136-peyrol in a thin voice on [his]136-peyrol " bonne mine . "[127-catherine] Manners were changing , and [she]127-catherine addressed [him]136-peyrol no longer as citoyen but as [Monsieur Peyrol]128-peyrol . [He]136-peyrol answered readily that if [her]127-catherine heart was free [he]136-peyrol was ready to lead [her]127-catherine to the altar that very day . This was such an old joke that [Catherine]127-catherine took no notice of it whatever , but followed [him]136-peyrol with [her]127-catherine eyes as [he]136-peyrol crossed [the kitchen]645-the kitchen into [the salle]782-the salle , which was cool , with [its]782-the salle tables and benches washed clean , and no living soul in [it]782-the salle . [Peyrol]128-peyrol passed through to the front of [the house]2684-the house , leaving the outer door open . At the clatter of [his]128-peyrol clogs [a young man sitting outside on a bench]784-a young man sitting outside on a bench turned [his]784-a young man sitting outside on a bench head and greeted [him]136-peyrol by a careless nod . [His]784-a young man sitting outside on a bench face was rather long , sunburnt and smooth , with a slightly curved nose and a very well - shaped chin . [He]784-a young man sitting outside on a bench wore a dark blue naval jacket open on a white shirt and a black neckerchief tied in a slip - knot with long ends . White breeches and stockings and black shoes with steel buckles completed [his]784-a young man sitting outside on a bench costume . A brass - hilted sword in a black scabbard worn on a cross - belt was lying on the ground at [his]784-a young man sitting outside on a bench feet . [Peyrol]128-peyrol , silver - headed and ruddy , sat down on the bench at some little distance . [The level piece of rocky ground in front of [the house]2684-the house]785-the level piece of rocky ground in front of the house was not very extensive , falling away to [the sea]281-the sea in a declivity framed between [the rises of [two barren hills]789-two barren hills]788-the rises of two barren hills . Yet there were no signs of debility about [[his]795-the master of the escampobar farm person]372-his person . [His]795-the master of the escampobar farm oval face with rounded cheek - bones remained unwrinkled except at the corners of [his]795-the master of the escampobar farm almond - shaped , shiny , visionary 's eyes , which had not changed since the day when [old Peyrol]128-peyrol 's gaze had met [them]803-them for the first time . "[843-he] [He]843-he had been a horror and an abomination to [the people]499-the people for years , what with one story and another , and now [they]499-the people thought it was [their]499-the people chance . [He]843-he just tucked up [his]843-he skirts and dashed out , taking short cuts over the walls and leaping from boulder to boulder like a blessed goat . What [he]843-he could say to quieten [them]853-his parishioners [I]0-i do n't know , but these were early days and [they]853-his parishioners were very fond of [[their]853-his parishioners new priest]855-their new priest . [He]843-he could have turned them round [his]843-he little finger . [I]0-i had [my]0-i head and shoulders out of the window - it was interesting enough . The way the moon was then , [the ravine]480-the ravine was in black shadow . And [I]0-i did n't try to see . " [He]136-peyrol strode off , followed by [Peyrol]136-peyrol .
