" [He]136-peyrol moved on , [Peyrol]136-peyrol following [him]136-peyrol on [the awkward path]2892-the awkward path without losing [his]136-peyrol wind and arguing in a steady voice : "[898-the english corvette which has been dodging in and out of hyres roads] [She]898-the english corvette which has been dodging in and out of hyres roads has [no companion]903-no companion but [she]898-the english corvette which has been dodging in and out of hyres roads may have seen [a friend]905-a friend at daylight this morning . " "[898-the english corvette which has been dodging in and out of hyres roads] Bah ! " retorted [the officer]293-the officer without checking [his]293-the officer pace . "[898-the english corvette which has been dodging in and out of hyres roads] [You]900-you talk now like [a child]2774-a child or else [you]900-you take [me]0-i for one . Funny blockade that ! " [Peyrol]136-peyrol growled in answer : "[914-gunner] Why , a twelve . The heaviest [she]898-the english corvette which has been dodging in and out of hyres roads carries . " "[898-the english corvette which has been dodging in and out of hyres roads] Well , then , it was fired as a recall for one of [[her]898-the english corvette which has been dodging in and out of hyres roads boats]705-her boats somewhere out of sight along [the shore]231-the shore . " "[0-i] [You]0-i are right there . " [The officer]293-the officer stopped suddenly . And there is no other way to explain that gun . " [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's face expressed no emotion of any sort . "[898-the english corvette which has been dodging in and out of hyres roads] There is something there worth investigating , " continued [the officer]293-the officer with animation . What could there be ? As likely as not [they]922-they sent [her]898-the english corvette which has been dodging in and out of hyres roads inshore early in the morning with lines to try to catch some fish for [the captain]923-the captain 's breakfast . Why do [you]0-i open [your]0-i eyes like this ? Do n't [you]0-i know [the English]115-the english ? [They]115-the english have enough cheek for anything . The path following [the contour of [the hill]694-the hill]2898-the contour of the hill took a turn towards [its]694-the hill [sea - face]2900-sea - face and very soon [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant passed out of sight with startling suddenness . [He]136-peyrol could see distinctly the pigeons walking on the roof ridges . [Somebody]131-somebody was drawing water from the well in [the middle of [the yard]553-the yard]2904-the middle of the yard . [He]136-peyrol was n't [a man]278-a man to lose time in idle wonder , and [his]136-peyrol sabots did not seem to weigh heavy on [his]136-peyrol feet . The fermire , whom [the villagers down there]2916-the villagers down there spoke of as [Arlette]121-arlette as though [she]121-arlette had been [a little girl]2917-a little girl , but in a strange tone of shocked awe , walked with [her]121-arlette head drooping and [her]121-arlette feet as [Peyrol]136-peyrol used to say touching the ground as lightly as falling leaves . The clatter of the clogs made [her]121-arlette raise [her]121-arlette black , clear eyes that had been smitten on the very verge of womanhood by such sights of bloodshed and terror , as to leave in [her]121-arlette a fear of looking steadily in any direction for long , lest [she]121-arlette should see coming through the empty air some mutilated vision of the dead . [Peyrol]136-peyrol called it trying not to see something that was not there ; and this evasive yet frank mobility was so much a part of [her]121-arlette being that the steadiness with which [she]121-arlette met [his]136-peyrol inquisitive glance surprised [old Peyrol]136-peyrol for a moment . [It]2925-it had quite a pronounced slope , so that a short and robust pine growing true out of the soil yet leaned well over the edge of the sheer drop of some fifty feet or so . It was as simple as that . [The people of [the farmhouse]655-the farmhouse]3002-the people of the farmhouse , [husband]3004-husband and [wife]3005-wife , were well - to - do , [good class altogether]3006-good class altogether , and [staunch royalists]3007-staunch royalists . [He]137-bolt had got to know [them]3002-the people of the farmhouse well . [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent wondered whether [the same people]3008-the same people were still living [there]266-there . [Bolt]137-bolt could see no reason why [they]3008-the same people should n't be . As far as [he]137-bolt could make out , [the farm]2746-the farm was [[their]3008-the same people own property]3012-their own property . [He]137-bolt , [Bolt]137-bolt , knew only very few French words at that time . [His]137-bolt captivity had done away with [his]137-bolt feeble chance of promotion , [he]137-bolt could not help remarking . [Bolt]137-bolt was [a master 's mate]3014-a master 's mate still . [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent , in common with [a good many officers of all ranks in [Lord Nelson]141-lord nelson 's fleet]3015-a good many officers of all ranks in lord nelson 's fleet , had [his]133-captain vincent misgivings about the system of distant blockade from which [the Admiral]3016-the admiral apparently would not depart . Yet [one]2670-one could not blame [Lord Nelson]141-lord nelson . [Everybody in the fleet]3018-everybody in the fleet understood that what was in [his]3018-everybody in the fleet mind was the destruction of [the enemy]627-the enemy ; and if the enemy was closely blockaded [he]3018-everybody in the fleet would never come out to be destroyed . On the other hand it was clear that as things were conducted [the French]3020-the french had too many chances left [them]3020-the french to slip out unobserved and vanish from all human knowledge for months . Those possibilities were a constant worry to [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent , who had thrown [himself]133-captain vincent with the ardour of passion into the special duty with which [he]133-captain vincent was entrusted . Oh , for a pair of eyes fastened night and day on the entrance of [the harbour of [Toulon]1-toulon]3021-the harbour of toulon ! Oh , for the power to look at the very state of [French ships]3022-french ships and into the very secrets of French minds ! But [he]133-captain vincent said nothing of this to [Bolt]137-bolt . [He]133-captain vincent only observed that the character of the French Government was changed and that the minds of [the royalist people in [the farmhouse]655-the farmhouse]3023-the royalist people in the farmhouse might have changed too , since [they]3023-the royalist people in the farmhouse had got back the exercise of [their]3023-the royalist people in the farmhouse religion . [Bolt]137-bolt 's answer was that [he]137-bolt had had a lot to do with [royalists]3025-royalists , in [his]137-bolt time , on board [[Lord Howe]139-lord howe 's fleet]2981-lord howe 's fleet , both before and after [Toulon]1-toulon was evacuated . All sorts , [men]423-men and [women]2762-women , [barbers]3029-barbers and [noblemen]3030-noblemen , [sailors]3031-sailors and [tradesmen]3032-tradesmen ; almost [every kind of royalist one]3033-every kind of royalist one could think of ; and [his]137-bolt opinion was that [a royalist]3034-a royalist never changed . As to [the place]2721-the place itself , [he]137-bolt only wished [the captain]923-the captain had seen it . It was the sort of spot that nothing could change . [He]137-bolt made bold to say that it would be just the same a hundred years hence . The earnestness of [[his]137-bolt officer]3037-his officer caused [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent to look hard at [him]137-bolt . [He]137-bolt was [a man of about]3038-a man of about [his]137-bolt own age , but while [Vincent]133-captain vincent was [a comparatively young captain]3039-a comparatively young captain , [Bolt]137-bolt was [[an old master]3040-an old master 's mate]3041-an old master 's mate . [Each]142-each understood [the other]506-the other perfectly . [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent fidgeted for a while and then observed abstractedly that [he]137-bolt was not [a man to put a noose round a dog]3043-a man to put a noose round a dog 's neck , let alone [a good seaman]3044-a good seaman 's . This cryptic pronouncement caused no wonder to appear in [Bolt]137-bolt 's attentive gaze . [He]137-bolt only became a little thoughtful before [he]137-bolt said in the same abstracted tone that [an officer in uniform]3045-an officer in uniform was not likely to be hanged for [a spy]3046-a spy . The service was risky , of course . It was necessary , for its success , that , assuming [the same people]3008-the same people were [there]266-there , it should be undertaken by [a man well known to [the inhabitants]3050-the inhabitants]3049-a man well known to the inhabitants . Then [he]137-bolt added that [he]137-bolt was certain of being recognized . And while [he]137-bolt enlarged on the extremely good terms [he]137-bolt had been on with [the owners of [the farm]2746-the farm]3051-the owners of the farm , especially [[the farmer]340-the farmer 's wife]3054-the farmer 's wife , [a comely motherly woman , who had been very kind to [him]137-bolt]3055-a comely motherly woman , who had been very kind to him , and had all [her]3054-the farmer 's wife wits about [her]3054-the farmer 's wife , [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent , looking at [[the master]2770-the master 's mate]3057-the master 's mate 's bushy whiskers , thought that these in themselves were enough to insure recognition . This impression was so strong that [he]133-captain vincent asked point - blank : "[942-you] [You]942-you have n't altered the growth of the hair on [your]942-you face , [Mr. Bolt]137-bolt , since then ? " There was just a touch of indignation in [Bolt]137-bolt 's negative reply ; for [he]137-bolt was proud of [his]137-bolt whiskers . [He]137-bolt declared [he]137-bolt was ready to take the most desperate chances for the service of [[his]137-bolt king]3058-his king and [[his]137-bolt country]3059-his country . [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent added : "[137-bolt] For the sake of [Lord Nelson]141-lord nelson , too . " [One]2670-one understood well what [[his]137-bolt Lordship]3061-his lordship wished to bring about by that blockade at sixty leagues off . [He]137-bolt was talking to [a sailor]252-a sailor , and there was no need to say any more . Did [Bolt]137-bolt think that [he]137-bolt could persuade [those people]3063-those people to conceal [him]137-bolt in [[their]3063-those people house]3064-their house on [that lonely shore end of [the peninsula]452-the peninsula]3065-that lonely shore end of the peninsula for some considerable time ? [Bolt]137-bolt thought it was the easiest thing in [the world]2656-the world . [He]137-bolt would simply go up there and renew [the old acquaintance]3068-the old acquaintance , but [he]137-bolt did not mean to do that in a reckless manner . It would have to be done at night , when of course there would be [no one]732-no one about . [He]137-bolt would land just where [he]137-bolt used to before , wrapped up in [a Mediterranean sailor]3070-a mediterranean sailor 's cloak - [he]137-bolt had one of [his]137-bolt own - over [his]137-bolt uniform , and simply go straight to the door , at which [he]137-bolt would knock . Ten to one [the farmer]340-the farmer [himself]340-the farmer would come down to open it . [He]137-bolt knew enough French by now , [he]137-bolt hoped , to persuade [those people]3063-those people to conceal [him]137-bolt in [some room]3073-some room having a view in the right direction ; and there [he]137-bolt would stick day after day on the watch , taking a little exercise in the middle of the night , ready to live on mere bread and water if necessary , so as not to arouse suspicion amongst [the farmhands]3074-the farmhands . And who knows if , with [the farmer]340-the farmer 's help , [he]137-bolt could not get some news of what was going on actually within [the port]3076-the port . Then from time to time [he]137-bolt could go down in the dead of night , signal to [the ship]2931-the ship and make [his]137-bolt report . [Bolt]137-bolt expressed the hope that [the Amelia]3078-the amelia would remain as much as possible in sight of [the coast]405-the coast . It would cheer [him]137-bolt up to see [her]3078-the amelia about . [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent naturally assented . [He]133-captain vincent pointed out to [Bolt]137-bolt , however , that [his]133-captain vincent post would become most important exactly when [the ship]2931-the ship had been chased away or driven by the weather off [[her]3078-the amelia station]3081-her station , as could very easily happen . - "[141-lord nelson] [You]943-you would be then the eyes of [[Lord Nelson]141-lord nelson 's fleet]944-lord nelson 's fleet , [Mr. Bolt]137-bolt - think of that . The actual eyes of [[Lord Nelson]141-lord nelson 's fleet]944-lord nelson 's fleet ! " After dispatching [[his]133-captain vincent officer]3037-his officer , [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent spent the night on [deck]3083-deck . The break of day came at last , much paler than the moonlight which it replaced . And still [no boat]3084-no boat . And again [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent asked [himself]133-captain vincent if [he]133-captain vincent had not acted indiscreetly . Impenetrable , and looking as fresh as if [he]133-captain vincent had just come up on [deck]3083-deck , [he]133-captain vincent argued the point with [himself]133-captain vincent till the rising sun clearing [the ridge on [Porquerolles Island]42-the porquerolles island]3086-the ridge on porquerolles island flashed its level rays upon [[his]133-captain vincent ship]273-his ship with [her]273-his ship dew - darkened sails and dripping rigging . [He]133-captain vincent roused [himself]133-captain vincent then to tell [[his]133-captain vincent first lieutenant]3088-his first lieutenant to get [the boats]3089-the boats out to tow [the ship]2931-the ship away from [the shore]231-the shore . The report of the gun [he]133-captain vincent ordered to be fired expressed simply [his]133-captain vincent irritation . [The Amelia]3078-the amelia , pointing towards [the middle of [the Passe]47-the passe]3093-the middle of the passe , was moving at a snail 's pace behind [[her]3078-the amelia string of [boats]3095-boats]3094-her string of boats . Minutes passed . And then suddenly [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent perceived [[his]133-captain vincent boat]511-his boat pulling back in [shore]275-shore according to orders . When nearly abreast of [the ship]2931-the ship , [she]3078-the amelia darted away , making for [her]3078-the amelia side . [Mr. Bolt]137-bolt clambered on board , alone , ordering [the gig]3099-the gig to go ahead and help with the towing . [Captain Vincent , standing apart on the quarter - deck]3100-captain vincent , standing apart on the quarter - deck , received [him]137-bolt with a grimly questioning look . [Mr. Bolt]137-bolt 's first words were to the effect that [he]137-bolt believed the confounded spot to be bewitched . Then [he]137-bolt glanced at the group of [officers on the other side of the quarter - deck]3101-officers on the other side of the quarter - deck . [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent led the way to [[his]133-captain vincent cabin]241-his cabin . " "[946-night - walkers there] Come , [Bolt]137-bolt , what the devil have [you]137-bolt seen ? Did [you]137-bolt get near [the house]2684-the house at all ? " "[137-bolt] [I]0-i got within twenty yards of the door , [sir]935-sir , " said [Bolt]137-bolt . And encouraged by [the captain]923-the captain 's much less ferocious - "[0-i] Well ? " began [his]137-bolt tale . [He]137-bolt did not pull up to the path which [he]137-bolt knew , but to a little bit of beach on which [he]137-bolt told [[his]137-bolt men]3105-his men to haul up [the boat]2705-the boat and wait for [him]137-bolt . [The beach]3107-the beach was concealed by a thick growth of bushes on [the landward side]3108-the landward side and by some rocks from [the sea]281-the sea . Then [he]137-bolt went to what [he]137-bolt called [the ravine]480-the ravine , still avoiding the path , so that as a matter of fact [he]137-bolt made [his]137-bolt way up on [his]137-bolt hands and knees mostly , very carefully and slowly amongst the loose stones , till by holding on to a bush [he]137-bolt brought [his]137-bolt eyes on a level with the piece of flat ground in front of [the farmhouse]655-the farmhouse . The familiar aspect of [the buildings]824-the buildings , totally unchanged from the time when [he]137-bolt had played [his]137-bolt part in what appeared as a most successful operation at the beginning of the war , inspired [Bolt]137-bolt with great confidence in the success of [his]137-bolt present enterprise , vague as it was , but the great charm of which lay , no doubt , in mental associations with [his]137-bolt younger years . Nothing seemed easier than to stride across [the forty yards of open ground]3113-the forty yards of open ground and rouse [the farmer whom [he]137-bolt remembered so well]3114-the farmer whom he remembered so well , [the well - to - do man]3115-the well - to - do man , [a grave sagacious royalist in [his]3115-the well - to - do man humble way]3116-a grave sagacious royalist in his humble way ; certainly , in [Bolt]137-bolt 's view , [no traitor to [[his]137-bolt country]3059-his country]3117-no traitor to his country , and preserving so well [his]137-bolt dignity in ambiguous circumstances . To [Bolt]137-bolt 's simple vision neither that , [man]3119-man nor [[his]137-bolt wife]608-his wife could have changed . In this view of [[Arlette]121-arlette 's parents]3121-arlette 's parents [Bolt]137-bolt was influenced by the consciousness of there having been no change in [himself]137-bolt . [He]137-bolt was the same [Jack Bolt]143-jack bolt , and everything around [him]137-bolt was the same as if [he]137-bolt had left [the spot]3122-the spot only yesterday . Already [he]137-bolt saw [himself]137-bolt in [the kitchen which [he]137-bolt knew so well]3123-the kitchen which he knew so well , seated by the light of a single candle before a glass of wine and talking [his]137-bolt best French to [that worthy farmer of sound principles]3124-that worthy farmer of sound principles . The whole thing was as well as done . [He]137-bolt imagined [himself]137-bolt [a secret inmate of [that building]3126-that building]3125-a secret inmate of that building , closely confined indeed , but sustained by the possible great results of [his]137-bolt watchfulness , in many ways more comfortable than on board [the Amelia]3078-the amelia and with the glorious consciousness that [he]137-bolt was , in [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent 's phrase , [the actual physical eyes of [the fleet]220-the fleet]3128-the actual physical eyes of the fleet . [He]137-bolt did n't , of course , talk of [his]137-bolt private feelings to [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent . All those thoughts and emotions were compressed in the space of not much more than a minute or two while , holding on with one hand to [his]137-bolt bush and having got a good foothold for one of [his]137-bolt feet , [he]137-bolt indulged in that pleasant anticipatory sense of success . In the old days [[the farmer]340-the farmer 's wife]3054-the farmer 's wife used to be [a light sleeper]3132-a light sleeper . [The farmhands who , [he]137-bolt remembered , lived in [the village]497-the village or were distributed in [stables]3135-stables and [outhouses]3136-outhouses]3133-the farmhands who , he remembered , lived in the village or were distributed in stables and outhouses , did not give [him]137-bolt any concern . [He]137-bolt would n't need to knock heavily . [He]137-bolt pictured to [himself]137-bolt [[the farmer]340-the farmer 's wife]3054-the farmer 's wife sitting up in bed , listening , then rousing [[her]3054-the farmer 's wife husband]573-her husband , who , as likely as not , would take the gun standing against the dresser [downstairs]772-downstairs and come to the door . And then everything would be all right . . . . But perhaps . . . Yes ! It was just as likely [the farmer]340-the farmer would simply open the window and hold a parley . That really was most likely . Naturally . In [his]137-bolt place [Bolt]137-bolt felt [he]137-bolt would do that very thing . Yes , that was what [a man in [a lonely house]3143-a lonely house]3142-a man in a lonely house , in the middle of the night , would do most naturally . And [he]137-bolt imagined [himself]137-bolt whispering mysteriously [his]137-bolt answers up the wall to the obvious questions - Ami - Bolt - Ouvrez - moi - vive le roi - or things of that sort . And in sequence to those vivid images it occurred to [Bolt]137-bolt that the best thing [he]137-bolt could do would be to throw small stones against the window shutter , the sort of sound most likely to rouse a light sleeper . [He]137-bolt was n't quite sure which window on the floor above the ground floor was that of [[those people]3063-those people 's bedroom]3145-those people 's bedroom , but there were anyhow only three of [them]3145-those people 's bedroom . In a moment [he]137-bolt would have sprung up from [his]137-bolt foothold on to the level if , raising [his]137-bolt eyes for another look at the front of [the house]2684-the house , [he]137-bolt had not perceived that one of the windows was already open . How [he]137-bolt could have failed to notice that before [he]137-bolt could n't explain . [He]137-bolt confessed to [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent in the course of [his]137-bolt narrative that "[0-i] this open window , [sir]935-sir , checked [me]0-i dead . In fact , [sir]935-sir , it shook [my]0-i confidence , for [you]935-sir know , [sir]935-sir , that [no native of these parts]952-no native of these parts would dream of sleeping with [his]952-no native of these parts window open . It struck [me]0-i that there was something wrong there ; and [I]0-i remained where [I]0-i was . " That fascination of repose , of secretive friendliness , which houses present at night , was gone . By the power of an open window , a black square in the moon - lighted wall , [the farmhouse]655-the farmhouse took on the aspect of a man - trap . [Bolt]137-bolt assured [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent that the window would not have stopped [him]137-bolt ; [he]137-bolt would have gone on all the same , though with an uncertain mind . But while [he]137-bolt was thinking it out , there glided without a sound before [his]137-bolt irresolute eyes from somewhere a white vision - [a woman]2780-a woman . [He]137-bolt could see [her]953-she black hair flowing down [her]953-she back . [A woman whom [anybody would have been excused for taking for a ghost]3150-anybody would have been excused for taking for a ghost]3149-a woman whom anybody would have been excused for taking for a ghost . "[0-i] [I]0-i wo n't say that [she]953-she froze [my]0-i blood , [sir]935-sir , but [she]953-she made [me]0-i cold all over for a moment . [Lots of people]955-lots of people have seen [ghosts]956-ghosts , at least [they]955-lots of people say so , and [I]0-i have an open mind about that . [She]953-she was a weird thing to look at in the moonlight . [She]953-she did not act like [a sleep - walker]957-a sleep - walker either . If [she]953-she had not come out of a grave , then [she]953-she had jumped out of bed . But when [she]953-she stole back and hid [herself]953-she round the corner of [the house]2684-the house [I]0-i knew [she]953-she was not a ghost . [She]953-she could not have seen [me]0-i . There [she]953-she stood in the black shadow watching for something - or waiting for [somebody]876-somebody , " added [Bolt]137-bolt in a grim tone . "[953-she] [She]953-she looked crazy , " [he]137-bolt conceded charitably . One thing was clear to [him]137-bolt : there had been changes in [that farmhouse]3151-that farmhouse since [his]137-bolt time . [Bolt]137-bolt resented [them]3152-them , as if that time had been only last week . [The woman concealed round the corner]3153-the woman concealed round the corner remained in [his]137-bolt full view , watchful , as if only waiting for [him]137-bolt to show [himself]137-bolt in the open , to run off screeching and rouse all [the countryside]416-the countryside . [Bolt]137-bolt came quickly to the conclusion that [he]137-bolt must withdraw from [the slope]3155-the slope . On lowering [himself]137-bolt from [his]137-bolt first position [he]137-bolt had the misfortune to dislodge a stone . This circumstance precipitated [his]137-bolt retreat . In a very few minutes [he]137-bolt found [himself]137-bolt by [the shore]231-the shore . [He]137-bolt paused to listen . Above [him]137-bolt , up [the ravine]480-the ravine and all round amongst the rocks , everything was perfectly still . [He]137-bolt walked along in the direction of [[his]137-bolt boat]511-his boat . There was nothing for it but to get away quietly and perhaps . . . "[953-she] Yes , [Mr. Bolt]137-bolt , [I]0-i fear [we]960-we shall have to give up [our]960-we plan , " interrupted [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent at that point . [Bolt]137-bolt 's assent came reluctantly , and then [he]137-bolt braced [himself]137-bolt to confess that this was not the worst . Before the astonished face of [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent [he]137-bolt hastened to blurt it out . [He]137-bolt was very sorry , [he]137-bolt could in no way account for it , but - [he]137-bolt had lost [a man]278-a man . [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent seemed unable to believe [his]133-captain vincent ears . "[0-i] What do [you]137-bolt say ? Lost [a man out of [[my]0-i boat 's crew]962-my boat 's crew]961-a man out of my boat 's crew ! " [He]133-captain vincent was profoundly shocked . [Bolt]137-bolt was correspondingly distressed . [He]137-bolt narrated that , shortly after [he]137-bolt had left [them]962-my boat 's crew , [the seamen]3160-the seamen had heard , or imagined [they]3160-the seamen had heard , some faint and peculiar noises somewhere within [the cove]3161-the cove . [The coxswain]3162-the coxswain sent [one of [the men]3164-the men]3163-one of the men , [the oldest of [the boat 's crew]3166-the boat 's crew]3165-the oldest of the boat 's crew , along [the shore]231-the shore to ascertain whether [[their]962-my boat 's crew boat hauled on [the beach]3107-the beach]3168-their boat hauled on the beach could be seen from [the other side of [the cove]3161-the cove]3170-the other side of the cove . [The man]400-the man - it was [Symons]144-symons - departed crawling on [his]400-the man hands and knees to make the circuit and , well - [he]400-the man had not returned . This was really the reason why [the boat]2705-the boat was so late in getting back to [the ship]2931-the ship . Of course [Bolt]137-bolt did not like to give up [the man]400-the man . It was inconceivable that [Symons]144-symons should have deserted . [He]144-symons had left [his]144-symons cutlass behind and was completely unarmed , but had [he]144-symons been suddenly pounced upon [he]144-symons surely would have been able to let out a yell that could have been heard all over [the cove]3161-the cove . But till daybreak a profound stillness , in which it seemed a whisper could have been heard for miles , had reigned over [the coast]405-the coast . It was as if [Symons]144-symons had been spirited away by some supernatural means , without a scuffle , without a cry . For it was inconceivable that [he]144-symons should have ventured inland and got captured [there]266-there . It was equally inconceivable that there should have been on that particular night [men]423-men ready to pounce upon [Symons]144-symons and knock [him]144-symons on the head so neatly as not to let [him]144-symons give a groan even . [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent said : "[137-bolt] All this is very fantastical , [Mr. Bolt]137-bolt , " and compressed [his]133-captain vincent lips firmly for a moment before [he]133-captain vincent continued : "[137-bolt] But not much more than [[your]137-bolt woman]963-your woman . [I]0-i suppose [you]137-bolt did see something real . . . . " "[137-bolt] [I]0-i tell [you]0-i , [sir]935-sir , [she]963-your woman stood there in full moonlight for ten minutes within a stone 's throw of [me]0-i , " protested [Bolt]137-bolt with a sort of desperation . "[963-your woman] [She]963-your woman seemed to have jumped out of bed only to look at [the house]2684-the house . If [she]963-your woman had a petticoat over [her]963-your woman night - shift , that was all . [Her]963-your woman back was to [me]0-i . When [she]963-your woman moved away [I]0-i could not make out [her]963-your woman face properly . Then [she]963-your woman went to stand in the shadow of [the house]2684-the house . " "[963-your woman] On the watch , " suggested [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent . "[963-your woman] Looked like it , [sir]935-sir , " confessed [Bolt]137-bolt . "[935-sir] So there must have been [somebody about]968-somebody about , " concluded [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent with assurance . [Bolt]137-bolt murmured a reluctant , "[968-somebody about] Must have been . " [He]137-bolt had expected to get into enormous trouble over this affair and was much relieved by [the captain]923-the captain 's quiet attitude . "[0-i] [I]0-i hope , [sir]935-sir , [you]935-sir approve of [my]0-i conduct in not attempting to look for [Symons]144-symons at once ? " "[935-sir] Yes . [You]935-sir acted prudently by not advancing [inland]970-inland , " said [the captain]923-the captain . "[935-sir] [I]0-i was afraid of spoiling [our]971-we chances to carry out [your]935-sir plan , [sir]935-sir , by disclosing [our]971-we presence on [shore]275-shore . And that could not have been avoided . Moreover , [we]971-we were only five in all and not properly armed . " "[137-bolt] The plan has gone down before [your]935-sir night - walker , [Mr. Bolt]137-bolt , " [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent declared dryly . "[137-bolt] But [we]971-we must try to find out what has become of [[our]971-we man]974-our man if it can be done without risking too much . " "[137-bolt] By landing a large party this very next night [we]971-we could surround [the house]2684-the house , " [Bolt]137-bolt suggested . "[971-we] If [we]971-we find [friends]2784-friends [there]266-there , well and good . If enemies , then [we]971-we could carry off some of [them]2784-friends on board for exchange perhaps . [I]0-i am almost sorry [I]0-i did not go back and kidnap [that wench]978-that wench - whoever [she]978-that wench was , " [he]0-i added recklessly . "[978-that wench] Ah ! If it had only been [a man]278-a man ! " "[278-a man] No doubt there was [a man not very far off]980-a man not very far off , " said [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent equably . "[980-a man not very far off] That will do , [Mr. Bolt]137-bolt . [You]137-bolt had better go and get some rest now . " [Bolt]137-bolt was glad to obey , for [he]137-bolt was tired and hungry after [his]137-bolt dismal failure . What vexed [him]137-bolt most was its absurdity . [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent , though [he]133-captain vincent too had passed a sleepless night , felt too restless to remain below . [He]133-captain vincent followed [[his]133-captain vincent officer]3037-his officer on [deck]3083-deck . By that time [the Amelia]138-the amelia had been towed half a mile or so away from [Cape Esterel]20-cape esterel . This change had brought [her]138-the amelia nearer to [the two watchers on [the hillside]3185-the hillside , who would have been plainly visible to [the people on [her]138-the amelia deck]3186-the people on her deck]3184-the two watchers on the hillside , who would have been plainly visible to the people on her deck , but for the head of the pine which concealed [their]3184-the two watchers on the hillside , who would have been plainly visible to the people on her deck movements . [Lieutenant Ral]136-peyrol , bestriding the rugged trunk as high as [he]136-peyrol could get , had [the whole of [the English ship]3188-the english ship 's deck]3187-the whole of the english ship 's deck open to the range of [his]136-peyrol pocket - glass which [he]136-peyrol used between the branches . [He]136-peyrol said to [Peyrol]136-peyrol suddenly : "[981-her] [[Her]981-her captain]2941-her captain has just come on [deck]3083-deck . " [Peyrol]136-peyrol , sitting at the foot of the tree , made no answer for a long while . A warm drowsiness lay over [the land]386-the land and seemed to press down [his]136-peyrol eyelids . But inwardly [the old rover]790-the old rover was intensely awake . Under the mask of [his]136-peyrol immobility , with half - shut eyes and idly clasped hands , [he]136-peyrol heard [the lieutenant , perched up there near the head of the tree]3191-the lieutenant , perched up there near the head of the tree , mutter counting something : "[981-her] One , two , three , " and then a loud "[981-her] Parbleu ! " after which [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant in [his]2881-the lieutenant trunk - bestriding attitude began to jerk [himself]2881-the lieutenant backwards . [Peyrol]136-peyrol got up out of [his]136-peyrol way , but could not restrain [himself]136-peyrol from asking : "[981-her] What 's the matter now ? " "[0-i] [I]0-i will tell [you]984-you what 's the matter , " said [the other excitedly]3193-the other excitedly . As soon as [he]0-i got [his]0-i footing [he]0-i walked up to [old Peyrol]136-peyrol and when quite close to [him]136-peyrol folded [his]0-i arms across [his]0-i chest . "[0-i] The first thing [I]0-i did was to count [the boats]3089-the boats in [the water]704-the water . There was not a single one left on board . And now [I]0-i just counted them again and found one more there . [That ship]987-that ship had [a boat]2704-a boat out last night . How [I]0-i missed seeing [her]2704-a boat pull out from under [the land]386-the land [I]0-i do n't know . [I]0-i was watching [the decks]990-the decks , [I]0-i suppose , and [she]2704-a boat seems to have gone straight up to the tow - rope . But [I]0-i was right . That [Englishman]43-the englishman had [a boat]2704-a boat out . " [He]0-i seized [Peyrol]136-peyrol by both shoulders suddenly . "[43-the englishman] [I]0-i believe [you]992-you knew it all the time . [You]992-you knew it , [I]0-i tell [you]992-you . " [Peyrol]136-peyrol , shaken violently by the shoulders , raised [his]136-peyrol eyes to look at the angry face within a few inches of [his]136-peyrol own . In [his]136-peyrol worn gaze there was no fear or shame , but a troubled perplexity and obvious concern . [He]136-peyrol remained passive , merely remonstrating softly : "[0-i] [Doucement]147-doucement . [Doucement]147-doucement . " [The lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant suddenly desisted with a final jerk which failed to stagger [old Peyrol]136-peyrol , who , directly [he]136-peyrol had been released , assumed an explanatory tone . "[147-doucement] For the ground is slippery here . If [I]0-i had lost [my]0-i footing [I]0-i would not have been able to prevent [myself]0-i from grabbing at [you]992-you , and [we]993-we would have gone down [that cliff]994-that cliff together ; which would have told [those Englishmen]995-those englishmen more than [twenty boats]996-twenty boats could have found out in as many nights . " [Secretly Lieutenant Ral]136-peyrol was daunted by [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's mildness . It could not be shaken . Even physically [he]136-peyrol had an impression of the utter futility of [his]136-peyrol effort , as though [he]136-peyrol had tried to shake a rock . [He]136-peyrol threw [himself]136-peyrol on the ground carelessly saying : "[995-those englishmen] As for instance ? " [Peyrol]136-peyrol lowered [himself]136-peyrol with a deliberation appropriate to [his]136-peyrol grey hairs . "[995-those englishmen] [You]992-you do n't suppose that out of [a hundred and twenty or so pairs of eyes on board]997-a hundred and twenty or so pairs of eyes on board [that ship]987-that ship there would n't be a dozen at least scanning [the shore]231-the shore . [Two men falling down a cliff]1000-two men falling down a cliff would have been a startling sight . [The English]115-the english would have been interested enough to send [a boat]2704-a boat [ashore]1002-ashore to go through [our]1003-our pockets , and whether dead or only half dead [we]1003-our would n't have been in a state to prevent them . It would n't matter so much as to [me]0-i , and [I]0-i do n't know what papers [you]992-you may have in [your]992-you pockets , but there are [your]992-you shoulder - straps , [your]992-you uniform coat . " "[0-i] [I]0-i carry no papers in [my]0-i pocket , and . . . " A sudden thought seemed to strike [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant , a thought so intense and far - fetched as to give [his]2881-the lieutenant mental effort a momentary aspect of vacancy . [He]2881-the lieutenant shook it off and went on in a changed tone : "[1004-themselves] The shoulder - straps would not have been much of a revelation by [themselves]1004-themselves . " "[1004-themselves] No . Not much . But enough to let [[her]1005-her captain]2941-her captain know that [he]2941-her captain had been watched . At [sea]228-sea [he]136-peyrol found another standard of values . In the course of some eight years , suppressing [his]136-peyrol faculties of love and hatred , [he]136-peyrol arrived at the rank of [an officer]242-an officer by sheer merit , and had accustomed [himself]136-peyrol to look at [men]423-men sceptically , without much scorn or much respect . [His]136-peyrol principles were purely professional and [he]136-peyrol had never formed a friendship in [his]136-peyrol life - more unfortunate in that respect than [old Peyrol]136-peyrol , who at least had known the bonds of [the lawless Brotherhood of [the Coast]10-the coast]1040-the lawless brotherhood of the coast . [He]136-peyrol was , of course , very self - contained . [Peyrol]136-peyrol , whom [he]136-peyrol had found unexpectedly settled on [the peninsula]452-the peninsula , was [the first human being to break through that schooled reserve which the precariousness of all things had forced on the orphan of the Revolution]1042-the first human being to break through that schooled reserve which the precariousness of all things had forced on the orphan of the revolution . [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's striking personality had aroused [Ral]136-peyrol 's interest , a mistrustful liking mixed with some contempt of a purely doctrinaire kind . It was clear that [the fellow]536-the fellow had been next thing to [a pirate]1044-a pirate at one time or another - a sort of past which could not commend itself to [a naval officer]1007-a naval officer . Still , [Peyrol]136-peyrol had broken through : and , presently , the peculiarities of [all those people at [the farm]2746-the farm]1046-all those people at the farm , [each individual one of [them]1046-all those people at the farm]1048-each individual one of them , had entered through the breach . What in [that man]495-that man impressed [Lieutenant Ral]136-peyrol was [the faculty of shrewd insight]1050-the faculty of shrewd insight . [Peyrol]136-peyrol remarked that [everybody]277-everybody no doubt was in [the kitchen]645-the kitchen waiting for [his]136-peyrol and [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant 's return . [He]136-peyrol [himself]136-peyrol was properly hungry . " And [you]2881-the lieutenant , [lieutenant]888-lieutenant ? "[2881-the lieutenant] [The lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant was not hungry . Well , whatever happened , [a man]278-a man had to eat . [He]136-peyrol , [Peyrol]136-peyrol , knew what it was to be altogether without food ; but even half - rations was a poor show , very poor show for [anybody who had to work or to fight]1093-anybody who had to work or to fight . For [himself]136-peyrol [he]136-peyrol could n't imagine any conjuncture that would prevent [him]136-peyrol having a meal as long as there was something to eat within reach . [His]136-peyrol unwonted garrulity provoked no response , but [Peyrol]136-peyrol continued to talk in that strain as though [his]136-peyrol thoughts were concentrated on food , while [his]136-peyrol eyes roved here and there and [his]136-peyrol ears were open for the slightest sound . When [they]1094-they arrived in front of [the house]2684-the house [Peyrol]136-peyrol stopped to glance anxiously down [the path]483-the path to [the coast]405-the coast , letting [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant enter [the caf]1099-the caf . [The Mediterranean]269-the mediterranean , in that part which could be seen from the door of [the caf]1099-the caf , was as empty of all sail as [a yet undiscovered sea]1102-a yet undiscovered sea . The dull tinkle of a cracked bell on the neck of some wandering cow was the only sound that reached [him]136-peyrol , accentuating the Sunday peace of [the farm]2746-the farm . Two goats were lying down on [the western slope of [the hill]694-the hill]1104-the western slope of the hill . It all had a very reassuring effect and the anxious expression on [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's face was passing away when suddenly one of the goats leaped to its feet . [He]150-michel did not care for another dog , and besides , who was there to give [him]150-michel a dog ? [He]150-michel was [the last of [men]423-men]1166-the last of men . [Somebody]876-somebody must be last . There was no place for [him]150-michel in [the life of [the village]497-the village]1169-the life of the village . [The miserable population of [Madrague]58-madrague]1180-the miserable population of madrague , [a tiny fishing hamlet facing towards [Toulon]1-toulon]1181-a tiny fishing hamlet facing towards toulon , had nothing to sell . [He]136-peyrol would have as soon bought a catamaran of three logs of wood tied together with rattans as [one of [their]1182-their boats]1183-one of their boats ; but lonely and prominent on [the beach]3107-the beach , lying on [her]1185-her side in weather - beaten melancholy , there was a two - masted tartane with [her]1185-her sun - whitened cordage hanging in festoons and [her]1185-her dry masts showing long cracks . [No man]502-no man was ever seen dozing under the shade of [her]1185-her hull on which the Mediterranean gulls made [themselves]1187-themselves very much at [home]2668-home . [She]1185-her looked a wreck thrown high up on [the land]386-the land by [a disdainful sea]1190-a disdainful sea . [Peyrol]136-peyrol , having surveyed [her]1185-her from a distance , saw that the rudder still hung in its place . [He]136-peyrol ran [his]136-peyrol eye along [her]1185-her body and said to [himself]136-peyrol that a craft with such lines would sail well . [She]1185-her was much bigger than anything [he]136-peyrol had thought of , but in [her]1185-her size , too , there was a fascination . At [his]136-peyrol back in silent wonder [a knot of [[fishermen]1195-fishermen 's wives]1196-fishermen 's wives , bareheaded and lean , with [a swarm of ragged children]1197-a swarm of ragged children clinging to [their]1194-a knot of fishermen 's wives , bareheaded and lean , with a swarm of ragged children clinging to their skirts skirts]1194-a knot of fishermen 's wives , bareheaded and lean , with a swarm of ragged children clinging to their skirts , watched [the first stranger [they]1194-a knot of fishermen 's wives , bareheaded and lean , with a swarm of ragged children clinging to their skirts had seen for years]1198-the first stranger they had seen for years . [Peyrol]136-peyrol borrowed a short ladder in [the hamlet]1199-the hamlet [he]136-peyrol knew better than to trust [his]136-peyrol weight to any of the ropes hanging over the side and carried it down to [the beach]3107-the beach followed at a respectful distance by [the staring women]1201-the staring women and [children]1202-children : a phenomenon and a wonder to [the natives]1203-the natives , as it had happened to [him]136-peyrol before on [more than one island in [distant seas]262-distant seas]1204-more than one island in distant seas . [He]136-peyrol clambered on board [the neglected tartane]1206-the neglected tartane and stood on the decked forepart , the centre of all eyes . [A gull]1207-a gull flew away with an angry scream . [The decked after - part]1210-the decked after - part had a small skylight and [a companion]913-a companion , and [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's eyes rested fascinated on an enormous padlock which secured [its]1206-the neglected tartane sliding door . It was as if there had been secrets or treasures inside - and yet most probably [it]1206-the neglected tartane was empty . [Peyrol]136-peyrol turned [his]136-peyrol head away and with the whole strength of [his]136-peyrol lungs shouted in the direction of [[the fishermen]1212-the fishermen 's wives]1213-the fishermen 's wives who had been joined by [two very old men]1214-two very old men and [a hunchbacked cripple swinging between two crutches]1215-a hunchbacked cripple swinging between two crutches : " Is there [anybody looking after this tartane]3326-anybody looking after this tartane , [a caretaker]3327-a caretaker ? "[1215-a hunchbacked cripple swinging between two crutches] At first the only answer was a movement of recoil . [Only the hunchback]152-only the hunchback held [his]152-only the hunchback ground and shouted back in an unexpectedly strong voice : " [You]136-peyrol are [the first man that has been on board her]3328-the first man that has been on board her for years . "[152-only the hunchback] [The wives of [the fishermen]1212-the fishermen]1216-the wives of the fishermen admired [his]136-peyrol boldness , for [Peyrol]136-peyrol indeed appeared to [them]1216-the wives of the fishermen [a very formidable being]1218-a very formidable being . " [I]136-peyrol might have guessed that , "[136-peyrol] thought [Peyrol]136-peyrol . " [She]1219-the disturbed gull is in a dreadful mess . "[136-peyrol] [The disturbed gull]1219-the disturbed gull had brought [some friends]1220-some friends as indignant as itself and [they]1220-some friends circled at different levels uttering wild cries over [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's head . [He]136-peyrol shouted again : " Who does [she]1219-the disturbed gull belong to ? "[136-peyrol] [The being on crutches]1221-the being on crutches lifted a finger towards the circling birds and answered in a deep tone : " [They]1220-some friends are the only ones [I]136-peyrol know . "[136-peyrol] Then , as [Peyrol]136-peyrol gazed down at [him]136-peyrol over the side , [he]136-peyrol went on : " [This craft]3329-this craft used to belong to [Escampobar]30-escampobar . [You]136-peyrol know [Escampobar]30-escampobar ? "[136-peyrol] " Yes , [I]136-peyrol know [Escampobar]30-escampobar , "[136-peyrol] yelled [Peyrol]136-peyrol , turning away and leaning against the mast in a pose which [he]136-peyrol did not change for a long time . [His]136-peyrol immobility tired out [the crowd]249-the crowd . [They]249-the crowd moved slowly in a body towards [their]249-the crowd hovels , the hunchback bringing up the rear with long swings between [his]136-peyrol crutches , and [Peyrol]136-peyrol remained alone with [the angry gulls]1223-the angry gulls . [He]136-peyrol lingered on board the tragic craft which had taken [[Arlette]121-arlette 's parents]3121-arlette 's parents to [their]3121-arlette 's parents death in the vengeful massacre of [Toulon]1-toulon and had brought the youthful [Arlette]121-arlette and [Citizen Scevola]123-scevola back to [Escampobar]30-escampobar where [old Catherine]127-catherine , left alone at that time , had waited for days for [somebody]876-somebody 's return . Days of anguish and prayer , while [she]127-catherine listened to the booming of guns about [Toulon]1-toulon and with an almost greater but different terror to the dead silence which ensued . [Peyrol]136-peyrol , enjoying the sensation of some sort of craft under [his]136-peyrol feet , indulged in no images of horror connected with that desolate tartane . It was late in the evening before [he]136-peyrol returned to [the farm]2746-the farm , so that [he]136-peyrol had to have [his]136-peyrol supper alone . [The women]1227-the women had retired , only the sans - culotte , smoking a short pipe out of doors , had followed [him]136-peyrol into [the kitchen]645-the kitchen and asked where [he]136-peyrol had been and whether [he]136-peyrol had lost [his]136-peyrol way . This question gave [Peyrol]136-peyrol an opening . [He]136-peyrol had been to [Madrague]58-madrague and had seen a very fine tartane lying perishing on [the beach]3107-the beach . " [They]3333-they told [me]136-peyrol down there that [she]3334-her belonged to [you]136-peyrol , [citoyen]2654-citoyen . "[136-peyrol] At this [the terrorist]1230-the terrorist only blinked . " What 's the matter ? Is n't [she]3334-her the craft [you]136-peyrol came here in ? Wo n't [you]136-peyrol sell [her]3334-her to [me]136-peyrol ? "[136-peyrol] [Peyrol]136-peyrol waited a little . " What objection can [you]136-peyrol have ? "[136-peyrol] It appeared that [the patriot]701-the patriot had no positive objections . [He]701-the patriot mumbled something about the tartane being very dirty . This caused [Peyrol]136-peyrol to look at [him]701-the patriot with intense astonishment . " [I]136-peyrol am ready to take [her]3334-her off [your]136-peyrol hands as [she]3334-her stands . "[136-peyrol] " [I]136-peyrol will be frank with [you]136-peyrol , [citoyen]2654-citoyen . [You]136-peyrol see , when [she]3334-her lay at [the quay]232-the quay in [Toulon]1-toulon [a lot of fugitive traitors]3338-a lot of fugitive traitors , [men]423-men and [women]2762-women , and [children]1202-children too , swarmed on board of [her]3334-her , and cut the ropes with a view of escaping , but [the avengers]3342-the avengers were not far behind and made short work of [them]3338-a lot of fugitive traitors . When [we]3343-we discovered [her]3334-her behind [the Arsenal]64-the arsenal , [I]136-peyrol and [another man]3344-another man , [we]3343-we had to throw a lot of bodies overboard , out of the hold and [the cabin]3345-the cabin . [You]3346-you will find [her]3334-her very dirty all over . [We]3343-we had no time to clear up . "[136-peyrol] [Peyrol]136-peyrol felt inclined to laugh . [He]136-peyrol had seen decks swimming in blood and had [himself]136-peyrol helped to throw dead bodies overboard after a fight ; but [he]136-peyrol eyed [the citizen]1232-the citizen with an unfriendly eye . [He]136-peyrol thought to [himself]136-peyrol : " [He]1232-the citizen had a hand in that massacre , no doubt , "[136-peyrol] but [he]136-peyrol made no audible remark . [He]136-peyrol only thought of the enormous padlock securing [that emptied charnel house]1233-that emptied charnel house at the stern . [The terrorist]1230-the terrorist insisted . " [We]3343-we really had not a moment to clean [her]3334-her up . "[1230-the terrorist] [Peyrol]136-peyrol waved [his]136-peyrol arm to cut short the explanation . Next day [he]136-peyrol returned to [the hamlet]1199-the hamlet and took up [[his]136-peyrol quarters]1238-his quarters [there]266-there for a time . The awe [he]136-peyrol had inspired wore off , though [no one]732-no one cared to come very near [the tartane]350-the tartane . [Peyrol]136-peyrol did not want any help . [He]136-peyrol wrenched off the enormous padlock [himself]136-peyrol with a bar of iron and let the light of day into [the little cabin]1242-the little cabin which did indeed bear the trace 's of the massacre in the stains of blood on [its]1242-the little cabin woodwork , but contained nothing else except a wisp of long hair and [a woman]2780-a woman 's earring , a cheap thing which [Peyrol]136-peyrol picked up and looked at for a long time . The associations of such finds were not foreign to [his]136-peyrol past . [He]136-peyrol could without very strong emotion figure to [himself]136-peyrol [the little place choked with corpses]1244-the little place choked with corpses . [He]136-peyrol sat down and looked about at the stains and splashes which had been untouched by sunlight for years . The cheap little earring lay before [him]136-peyrol on the rough - hewn table between the lockers , and [he]136-peyrol shook [his]136-peyrol head at it weightily . [He]136-peyrol , at any rate , had never been [a butcher]1245-a butcher . [Peyrol]136-peyrol unassisted did all the cleaning . Then [he]136-peyrol turned con amore to the fitting out of the tartane . The habits of activity still clung to [him]136-peyrol . [He]136-peyrol welcomed something to do ; this congenial task had all the air of preparation for a voyage , which was a pleasing dream , and it brought every evening the satisfaction of something achieved to that illusory end . [He]136-peyrol rove new gear , scraped the masts [himself]136-peyrol , did all the sweeping , scrubbing and painting single - handed , working steadily and hopefully as though [he]136-peyrol had been preparing [his]136-peyrol escape from [a desert island]451-a desert island ; and directly [he]136-peyrol had cleaned and renovated [the dark little hole of [a cabin [he]136-peyrol took to sleeping on board]1248-a cabin he took to sleeping on board]1247-the dark little hole of a cabin he took to sleeping on board . Once only [he]136-peyrol went up on a visit to [the farm]2746-the farm for a couple of days , as if to give [himself]136-peyrol a holiday . [He]136-peyrol passed them mostly in observing [Arlette]121-arlette . [She]121-arlette was perhaps [the first problematic human being [he]136-peyrol had ever been in contact with]1250-the first problematic human being he had ever been in contact with . [Peyrol]136-peyrol had no contempt for [women]2762-women . [He]136-peyrol had seen [them]2762-women love , suffer , endure , riot , and even fight for [their]2762-women own hand , very much like [men]423-men . Generally with [men]423-men and [women]2762-women [you]1255-you had to be on [your]1255-you guard , but in some ways [women]2762-women were more to be trusted . As a matter of fact , [[his]136-peyrol country]3059-his country - [women]2762-women were to [him]136-peyrol less known than any other kind . From [his]136-peyrol experience of many different races , however , [he]136-peyrol had a vague idea that [women]2762-women were very much alike everywhere . [This one]828-this one was [a lovable creature]1261-a lovable creature . [She]828-this one produced on [him]136-peyrol the effect of [a child]2774-a child , aroused a kind of intimate emotion which [he]136-peyrol had not known before to exist by itself in [a man]278-a man . [He]136-peyrol was startled by its detached character . " Is it that [I]136-peyrol am getting old ? "[136-peyrol] [he]136-peyrol asked [himself]136-peyrol suddenly one evening , as [he]136-peyrol sat on the bench against the wall looking straight before [him]136-peyrol , after [she]828-this one had crossed [his]136-peyrol line of sight . [He]136-peyrol felt [himself]136-peyrol an object of observation to [Catherine]127-catherine , whom [he]136-peyrol used to detect peeping at [him]136-peyrol round corners or through half - opened doors . "[1151-the old woman] Yes , [I]0-i was handsome , but who would have looked at [me]0-i if [I]0-i had wanted to be looked at ? " There were no signs of watchfulness and care in [her]608-his wife bearing now . " Moving calmly [her]608-his wife faded lips which [no lover or child]3366-no lover or child had ever kissed , [old Catherine]127-catherine told [Peyrol]136-peyrol of the days and nights of waiting , with the distant growl of the big guns in [her]608-his wife ears . [She]608-his wife used to sit outside on the bench longing for news , watching the flickers in the sky and listening to heavy bursts of gunfire coming over [the water]704-the water . Then came a night as if [the world]2656-the world were coming to an end . All the sky was lighted up , the earth shook to its foundations , and [she]608-his wife felt [the house]2684-the house rock , so that jumping up from the bench [she]608-his wife screamed with fear . That night [she]608-his wife never went to bed . Next morning [she]608-his wife saw [the sea]281-the sea covered with sails , while a black and yellow cloud of smoke hung over [Toulon]1-toulon . [A man coming up from [Madrague]58-madrague]3371-a man coming up from madrague told [her]608-his wife that [he]3371-a man coming up from madrague believed that [the whole town]3372-the whole town had been blown up . [She]608-his wife gave [him]136-peyrol a bottle of wine and [he]136-peyrol helped [her]608-his wife to feed the stock that evening . Nearly a week later [she]608-his wife was dozing by the fire when voices outside woke [her]608-his wife up , and [she]608-his wife beheld standing in the middle of [the salle]782-the salle , pale like a corpse out of a grave , with a blood - soaked blanket over [her]608-his wife shoulders and a red cap on [her]608-his wife head , [a ghastly looking young girl in whom [she]608-his wife suddenly recognized [[her]608-his wife niece]3379-her niece]3378-a ghastly looking young girl in whom she suddenly recognized her niece . "[1284-the child] [She]1284-the child remembered [her]1284-the child Aunt [Catherine]127-catherine . [I]0-i tore the horrid blanket off [her]1284-the child shoulders . [Her]1284-the child hair was clotted with blood and [her]1284-the child clothes all stained with it . [I]0-i took [her]1284-the child [upstairs]411-upstairs . When [I]0-i went [downstairs]772-downstairs [I]0-i found that good - for - nothing inside [the house]2684-the house . [He]1290-he was ranting up and down [the salle]782-the salle , vapouring and boasting till [I]0-i thought all this must be an awful dream . [My]0-i head was in a whirl . [He]1290-he laid claim to [her]1284-the child , and God knows what . [I]0-i seemed to understand things that made [my]0-i hair stir on [my]0-i head . " "[1290-he] And so [he]1290-he remained , " said [Peyrol]136-peyrol . "[1290-he] What would [you]1302-you have had [me]0-i to do ? " asked [Catherine]127-catherine steadily . "[1305-we] And this is all [I]0-i can tell [you]1309-you . " [Her]121-arlette voice faltered , [she]121-arlette sat down on the stool again and took [her]121-arlette chin in the palm of [her]121-arlette hand .
