That night [he]136-peyrol slept on board [the renovated tartane]3389-the renovated tartane and the rising sun found [him]136-peyrol at work about [the hull]3390-the hull . By that time [he]136-peyrol had ceased to be the object of awed contemplation to [the inhabitants of [the hamlet]1199-the hamlet]3391-the inhabitants of the hamlet who still , however , kept up a mistrustful attitude . [[His]136-peyrol only intermediary for communicating with [them]3391-the inhabitants of the hamlet]3393-his only intermediary for communicating with them was [the miserable cripple]3394-the miserable cripple . [He]3394-the miserable cripple was [[Peyrol]136-peyrol 's only company]3395-peyrol 's only company , in fact , during [his]136-peyrol period of work on [the tartane]350-the tartane . [He]136-peyrol had more activity , audacity , and intelligence , it seemed to [Peyrol]136-peyrol , than [all the rest of [the inhabitants]3050-the inhabitants]3397-all the rest of the inhabitants put together . Early in the morning [he]136-peyrol could be seen making [his]136-peyrol way on [his]136-peyrol crutches with a pendulum motion towards the hull on which [Peyrol]136-peyrol would have been already an hour or so at work . [Peyrol]136-peyrol then would throw [him]136-peyrol over a sound rope 's end and [the cripple]3399-the cripple , leaning [his]136-peyrol crutches against the side of the tartane , would pull [his]136-peyrol wretched little carcass , all withered below the waist , up the rope , hand over hand , with extreme ease . There , sitting on the small foredeck , with [his]136-peyrol back against the mast and [his]136-peyrol thin , twisted legs folded in front of [him]136-peyrol , [he]136-peyrol would keep [Peyrol]136-peyrol company , talking to [him]136-peyrol along the whole length of the tartane in a strained voice and sharing [his]136-peyrol midday meal , as of right , since it was [he]136-peyrol generally who brought the provisions slung round [his]136-peyrol neck in a quaint flat basket . Thus were the hours of labour shortened for [Peyrol]136-peyrol by shrewd remarks and bits of local gossip . How [the cripple]3399-the cripple got hold of it it was difficult to imagine , and [the rover]822-the rover had not enough knowledge of European superstitions to suspect [him]136-peyrol of flying through the night on a broomstick like [a sort of male witch]3402-a sort of male witch - for there was a manliness in that twisted scrap of humanity which struck [Peyrol]136-peyrol from the first . [His]136-peyrol very voice was manly and the character of [his]136-peyrol gossip was not feminine . [He]136-peyrol did indeed mention to [Peyrol]136-peyrol that [people]287-people used to take [him]136-peyrol about [the neighbourhood]3404-the neighbourhood in carts for the purpose of playing a fiddle at weddings and other festive occasions ; but this seemed hardly adequate , and even [he]136-peyrol [himself]136-peyrol confessed that there was not much of that sort of thing going on during the Revolution when [people]287-people did n't like to attract attention and everything was done in a hole - and - corner manner . There were [no priests]3406-no priests to officiate at weddings , and if there were no ceremonies how could there be rejoicings ? Of course [children]1202-children were born as before , but there were no christenings - and [people]287-people got to look funny somehow or other . [Their]287-people countenances got changed somehow ; [the very boys]3409-the very boys and [girls]3410-girls seemed to have something on [their]3409-the very boys minds . [Peyrol]136-peyrol , busy about one thing and another , listened without appearing to pay much attention to the story of the Revolution , as if to the tale of [an intelligent islander on the other side of [the world]2656-the world talking of bloody rites and amazing hopes of some religion unknown to the rest of [mankind]3413-mankind]3411-an intelligent islander on the other side of the world talking of bloody rites and amazing hopes of some religion unknown to the rest of mankind . But there was something biting in the speech of [that cripple]3414-that cripple which confused [his]136-peyrol thoughts a little . Sarcasm was a mystery which [he]136-peyrol could not understand . On one occasion [he]136-peyrol remarked to [[his]136-peyrol friend]3415-his friend the cripple as [they]3416-they sat together on the foredeck munching the bread and figs of [their]3416-they midday meal : "[0-i] There must have been something in it . But it does n't seem to have done much for [[you]1310-you people]1311-you people here . " "[1310-you] To be sure , " retorted [the scrap of man]3417-the scrap of man vivaciously , "[1310-you] it has n't straightened [my]0-i back or given [me]0-i a pair of legs like [yours]1310-you . " [Peyrol]136-peyrol , whose trousers were rolled up above the knee because [he]136-peyrol had been washing the hold , looked at [his]136-peyrol calves complacently . "[1310-you] [You]1310-you could hardly have expected that , " [he]136-peyrol remarked with simplicity . "[1310-you] Ah , but [you]1310-you do n't know what [people with properly made bodies]1312-people with properly made bodies expected or pretended to , " said [the cripple]3399-the cripple . "[1310-you] Everything was going to be changed . [Everybody]277-everybody was going to tie up [his]277-everybody dog with a string of sausages for the sake of principles . " [His]3399-the cripple long face which , in repose , had an expression of suffering peculiar to [cripples]3419-cripples , was lighted up by an enormous grin . "[277-everybody] [They]1314-they must feel jolly well sold by this time , " [he]136-peyrol added . "[1314-they] And of course that vexes [them]1314-they , but [I]0-i am not vexed . [I]0-i was never vexed with [[my]0-i father]1315-my father and [mother]1316-mother . While the poor things were alive [I]0-i never went hungry - not very hungry . [They]1314-they could n't have been very proud of [me]0-i . " [He]0-i paused and seemed to contemplate [himself]0-i mentally . "[1314-they] [I]0-i do n't know what [I]0-i would have done in [their]1314-they place . Something very different . But then , do n't [you]1317-you see , [I]0-i know what it means to be like [I]0-i am . Of course [they]1314-they could n't know , and [I]0-i do n't suppose [the poor people]1318-the poor people had very much sense . [A priest from [Almanarre]14-almanarre]1319-a priest from almanarre - [Almanarre]14-almanarre is [a sort of village]1320-a sort of village up there where there is [a church]2700-a church . . . . " [Peyrol]136-peyrol interrupted [him]0-i by remarking that [he]136-peyrol knew all about [Almanarre]14-almanarre . This , on [his]136-peyrol part , was a simple delusion because in reality [he]136-peyrol knew much less of [Almanarre]14-almanarre than of [Zanzibar]66-zanzibar or [any pirate village]3420-any pirate village from there up to [Cape Guardafui]67-cape guardafui . And [the cripple]3399-the cripple contemplated [him]136-peyrol with [his]3399-the cripple brown eyes which had an upward cast naturally . "[1322-you] [You]1322-you know . . . ! For [me]0-i , " [he]0-i went on , in a tone of quiet decision , "[1322-you] [you]1322-you are [a man fallen from the sky]1323-a man fallen from the sky . Well , [a priest from [Almanarre]14-almanarre]1319-a priest from almanarre came to bury [them]1325-them . [A fine man with a stern face]1326-a fine man with a stern face . [The finest man [I]0-i have seen from that time till [you]1322-you dropped on [us]1328-us here]1327-the finest man i have seen from that time till you dropped on us here . There was a story of [a girl]1329-a girl having fallen in love with [him]1326-a fine man with a stern face some years before . [I]0-i was old enough then to have heard something of it , but that 's neither here nor there . Moreover , [many people]598-many people would n't believe the tale . " [Peyrol]136-peyrol , without looking at [the cripple]3399-the cripple , tried to imagine what sort of [child]504-child [he]1326-a fine man with a stern face might have been - what sort of youth ? [The rover]822-the rover had seen staggering deformities , dreadful mutilations which were the cruel work of [man]3119-man ; but it was amongst [people with dusky skins]3426-people with dusky skins . And that made a great difference . But what [he]1326-a fine man with a stern face had heard and seen since [he]1326-a fine man with a stern face had come back to [[his]1326-a fine man with a stern face native land]3427-his native land , the tales , the facts , and also the faces , reached [his]1326-a fine man with a stern face sensibility with a particular force , because of that feeling that came to [him]1326-a fine man with a stern face so suddenly after a whole lifetime spent amongst [Indians]156-indians , [Malagashes]3428-malagashes , [Arabs]744-arabs , [blackamoors of all sorts]3430-blackamoors of all sorts , that [he]1326-a fine man with a stern face belonged there , to [this land]393-this land , and had escaped all those things by a mere hair 's breadth . [[His]1326-a fine man with a stern face companion]3432-his companion completed [his]1326-a fine man with a stern face significant silence , which seemed to have been occupied with thoughts very much like [his]3432-his companion own , by saying : "[598-many people] All this was in [the king]1297-the king 's time . [They]1332-they did n't cut off [his]1297-the king head till several years afterwards . It did n't make [my]0-i life any easier for [me]0-i , but since those [Republicans]124-the victorious republicans had deposed [God]153-god and flung [Him]1297-the king out of all [the churches]1333-the churches [I]0-i have forgiven [Him]1297-the king all [my]0-i troubles . " "[278-a man] Spoken like [a man]278-a man , " said [Peyrol]136-peyrol . Only the misshapen character of [the cripple]3399-the cripple 's back prevented [Peyrol]136-peyrol from giving [him]136-peyrol a hearty slap . [He]136-peyrol got up to begin [his]136-peyrol afternoon 's work . It was a bit of inside painting and from the foredeck [the cripple]3399-the cripple watched [him]136-peyrol at it with dreamy eyes and something ironic on [his]3399-the cripple lips . It was not till the sun had travelled over [Cape Cici]68-cape cici , which could be seen across [the water]704-the water like dark mist in the glare , that [he]136-peyrol opened [his]136-peyrol lips to ask : "[278-a man] And what do [you]0-i propose to do with this tartane , [citoyen]2654-citoyen ? " [Peyrol]136-peyrol answered simply that the tartane was fit to go anywhere now , the very moment [she]1336-her took [the water]704-the water . "[0-i] [You]0-i could go as far as [Genoa]50-genoa and [Naples]69-naples and even further , " suggested [the cripple]3399-the cripple . "[0-i] Much further , " said [Peyrol]136-peyrol . "[0-i] And [you]0-i have been fitting [her]1336-her out like this for a voyage ? " "[0-i] Certainly , " said [Peyrol]136-peyrol , using [his]136-peyrol brush steadily . "[0-i] Somehow [I]0-i fancy it will not be a long one . " [Peyrol]136-peyrol never checked the to - and - fro movement of [his]136-peyrol brush , but it was with an effort . The fact was that [he]136-peyrol had discovered in [himself]136-peyrol a distinct reluctance to go away from [the Escampobar Farm]609-the escampobar farm . [His]136-peyrol desire to have something of [his]136-peyrol own that could float was no longer associated with any desire to wander . [The cripple]3399-the cripple was right . The voyage of the renovated tartane would not take [her]1336-her very far . What was surprising was [the fellow]536-the fellow being so very positive about it . [He]136-peyrol seemed able to read [people]287-people 's thoughts . The dragging of the renovated tartane into [the water]704-the water was a great affair . [Everybody in [the hamlet]1199-the hamlet]3443-everybody in the hamlet , including [the women]1227-the women , did a full day 's work and there was never so much coin passed from hand to hand in [the hamlet]1199-the hamlet in all the days of [its]1199-the hamlet obscure history . Swinging between [his]136-peyrol crutches on [a low sand - ridge]3447-a low sand - ridge [the cripple]3399-the cripple surveyed [the whole of [the beach]3107-the beach]3449-the whole of the beach . It was [he]136-peyrol that had persuaded [the villagers]3451-the villagers to lend a hand and had arranged the terms for [their]3451-the villagers assistance . It was [he]136-peyrol also who through [a very miserable - looking pedlar the only one who frequented [the peninsula]452-the peninsula]3452-a very miserable - looking pedlar the only one who frequented the peninsula had got in touch with [some rich persons in [Frjus]12-frjus who had changed for [Peyrol]136-peyrol]3454-some rich persons in frjus who had changed for peyrol a few of [his]136-peyrol gold pieces for current money . [He]136-peyrol had expedited the course of the most exciting and interesting experience of [his]136-peyrol life , and now planted on the sand on [his]136-peyrol two sticks in the manner of a beacon [he]136-peyrol watched the last operation . The rover , as if about to launch [himself]136-peyrol upon [a track of a thousand miles]3455-a track of a thousand miles , walked up to shake hands with [him]136-peyrol and look once more at the soft eyes and the ironic smile . "[0-i] There is no denying it - [you]1337-you are [a man]278-a man . " "[278-a man] Do n't talk like this to [me]0-i , [citoyen]2654-citoyen , " said [the cripple]3399-the cripple in a trembling voice . Till then , suspended between [his]136-peyrol two sticks and with [his]136-peyrol shoulders as high as [his]136-peyrol ears , [he]136-peyrol had not looked towards the approaching [Peyrol]136-peyrol . "[278-a man] This is too much of a compliment ! " "[0-i] [I]0-i tell [you]1337-you , " insisted [the rover]822-the rover roughly , and as if the insignificance of mortal envelopes had presented itself to [him]136-peyrol for the first time at the end of [his]136-peyrol roving life , "[0-i] [I]0-i tell [you]1337-you that there is that in [you]1337-you which would make [a chum one]1340-a chum one would like to have alongside one in a tight place . " As [he]136-peyrol went away from [the cripple]3399-the cripple towards [the tartane]350-the tartane , while [the whole population of [the hamlet]1199-the hamlet disposed around [her]3399-the cripple]3460-the whole population of the hamlet disposed around her waited for [his]136-peyrol word , some on [land]2741-land and some waist - deep in the water holding ropes in [their]3460-the whole population of the hamlet disposed around her hands , [Peyrol]136-peyrol had a slight shudder at the thought : "[0-i] Suppose [I]0-i had been born like that . " Ever since [he]136-peyrol had put [his]136-peyrol foot on [[his]136-peyrol native land]3427-his native land such thoughts had haunted [him]136-peyrol . They would have been impossible anywhere else . [He]136-peyrol could not have been like [any blackamoor]3464-any blackamoor , good , bad , or indifferent , hale or crippled , [king]3465-king or slave ; but here , on [this Southern shore]3466-this southern shore that had called to [him]136-peyrol irresistibly as [he]136-peyrol had approached [the Straits of [Gibraltar]70-gibraltar]3467-the straits of gibraltar on what [he]136-peyrol had felt to be [his]136-peyrol last voyage , [any woman]3468-any woman , lean and old enough , might have been [[his]136-peyrol mother]335-his mother ; [he]136-peyrol might have been [any Frenchman of [them]3471-them all]3470-any frenchman of them all , even [one of those [he]136-peyrol pitied , even [one of those [he]136-peyrol despised]3473-one of those he despised]3472-one of those he pitied , even one of those he despised . [He]136-peyrol felt the grip of [his]136-peyrol origins from the crown of [his]136-peyrol head to the soles of [his]136-peyrol feet while [he]136-peyrol clambered on board [the tartane]350-the tartane as if for a long and distant voyage . As a matter of fact [he]136-peyrol knew very well that with a bit of luck it would be over in about an hour . When the tartane took the water the feeling of being afloat plucked at [his]136-peyrol very heart . [Some Madrague fishermen]3475-some madrague fishermen had been persuaded by [the cripple]3399-the cripple to help [old Peyrol]136-peyrol to sail [the tartane]350-the tartane round to [the cove below [the Escampobar Farm]609-the escampobar farm]3478-the cove below the escampobar farm . A glorious sun shone upon [that short passage]3480-that short passage and [the cove]3161-the cove [itself]3161-the cove was full of sparkling light when [they]3475-some madrague fishermen arrived . The few Escampobar goats wandering on [the hillside]3185-the hillside pretending to feed where no grass was visible to the naked eye never even raised [their]3475-some madrague fishermen heads . A gentle breeze drove the tartane , as fresh as paint could make [her]350-the tartane , opposite a narrow crack in [the cliff]3204-the cliff which gave admittance to a tiny basin , no bigger than [a village pond]3484-a village pond , concealed at [the foot of [the southern hill]3486-the southern hill]3485-the foot of the southern hill . It was there that [old Peyrol]136-peyrol , aided by [the Madrague men , who had [[their]3487-the madrague men , who had their boat with them boat with [them]3487-the madrague men , who had their boat with them]3488-their boat with them]3487-the madrague men , who had their boat with them , towed [[his]136-peyrol ship]273-his ship , [the first really that [he]136-peyrol ever owned]3490-the first really that he ever owned . Once in , [the tartane]350-the tartane nearly filled [the little basin]3492-the little basin , and [the fishermen]1212-the fishermen , getting into [[their]1212-the fishermen boat]3494-their boat , rowed away for [home]2668-home . [Peyrol]136-peyrol , by spending the afternoon in dragging ropes ashore and fastening them to various boulders and dwarf trees , moored [her]350-the tartane to [his]136-peyrol complete satisfaction . [She]350-the tartane was as safe from the tempests there as [a house ashore]3496-a house ashore . After [he]136-peyrol had made everything fast on board and had furled the sails neatly , a matter of some time for [one man]3497-one man , [Peyrol]136-peyrol contemplated [his]136-peyrol arrangements which savoured of rest much more than of wandering , and found them good . Though [he]136-peyrol never meant to abandon [[his]136-peyrol room]3498-his room at [the farmhouse]655-the farmhouse [he]136-peyrol felt that [[his]136-peyrol true [home]2668-home]3500-his true home was in [the tartane]350-the tartane , and [he]136-peyrol rejoiced at the idea that [it]2668-home was concealed from all eyes except perhaps the eyes of the goats when [their]3503-their arduous feeding took [them]3503-their on [the southern slope]3504-the southern slope . [He]136-peyrol lingered on board , [he]136-peyrol even threw open the sliding door of [the little cabin]1242-the little cabin , which now smelt of fresh paint , not of stale blood . Before [he]136-peyrol started for [the farm]2746-the farm the sun had travelled far beyond [Spain]63-spain and all the sky to the west was yellow , while on [the side of [Italy]71-italy]3507-the side of italy [it]3507-the side of italy presented a sombre canopy pierced here and there with the light of stars . [Catherine]127-catherine put a plate on the table , but [nobody]2665-nobody asked [him]136-peyrol any questions . [He]136-peyrol spent a lot of [his]136-peyrol time on board , going down early , coming up at midday "[0-i] pour manger la soupe , " and sleeping on board almost every night . [He]136-peyrol did not like to leave [the tartane]350-the tartane alone for so many hours . Often , having climbed a little way up to [the house]2684-the house , [he]136-peyrol would turn round for a last look at [her]127-catherine in the gathering dusk , and actually would go back again . After [Michel]150-michel had been enlisted for [a crew]3511-a crew and had taken [his]150-michel abode on board for good , [Peyrol]136-peyrol found it a much easier matter to spend [his]136-peyrol nights in [the lantern - like room at the top of [the farmhouse]655-the farmhouse]3512-the lantern - like room at the top of the farmhouse . Often waking up at night [he]136-peyrol would get up to look at the starry sky out of all [his]136-peyrol three windows in succession , and think : "[0-i] Now there is nothing in [the world]2656-the world to prevent [me]0-i getting out to [sea]228-sea in less than an hour . " As a matter of fact it was possible for [two men]3514-two men to manage the tartane . Thus [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's thought was comfortingly true in every way , for [he]136-peyrol loved to feel [himself]136-peyrol free , and [Michel]150-michel of [the lagoon]2706-the lagoon , after the death of [[his]150-michel depressed dog]3516-his depressed dog , had no tie on [earth]442-earth . It was a fine thought which somehow made it quite easy for [Peyrol]136-peyrol to go back to [his]136-peyrol four - poster and resume [his]136-peyrol slumbers . Perched sideways on the circular wall bordering [the well]3518-the well , in the full blaze of the midday sun , the rover of [the distant seas]3519-the distant seas and [the fisherman of [the lagoon]2706-the lagoon]1148-the fisherman of the lagoon , sharing between [them]3514-two men a most surprising secret , had the air of [two men]3514-two men conferring in the dark . The first word that [Peyrol]136-peyrol said was , "[0-i] Well ? " "[0-i] All quiet , " said [the other]506-the other . "[0-i] Have [you]1343-you fastened the cabin door properly ? " "[1343-you] [You]1343-you know what the fastenings are like . " [Peyrol]136-peyrol could not deny that . It was a sufficient answer . It shifted the responsibility on to [his]136-peyrol shoulders and all [his]136-peyrol life [he]136-peyrol had been accustomed to trust to the work of [his]136-peyrol own hands , in peace and in war . Yet [he]136-peyrol looked doubtfully at [Michel]150-michel before [he]136-peyrol remarked : "[1343-you] Yes , but [I]0-i know [the man]400-the man too . " There could be no greater contrast than those two faces : [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's clean , like a carving of stone , and only very little softened by time , and that of [the owner of the late dog]3524-the owner of the late dog , hirsute , with many silver threads , with something elusive in the features and the vagueness of expression of [a baby in arms]3525-a baby in arms . "[0-i] Yes , [I]0-i know [the man]400-the man , " repeated [Peyrol]136-peyrol . [Michel]150-michel 's mouth fell open at this , a small oval set a little crookedly in the innocent face . "[0-i] [He]400-the man will never wake , " [he]136-peyrol suggested timidly . The possession of a common and momentous secret drawing [men]423-men together , [Peyrol]136-peyrol condescended to explain . "[1346-you] [You]1346-you do n't know the thickness of [his]400-the man skull . [I]0-i do . " [He]136-peyrol spoke as though [he]136-peyrol had made it [himself]136-peyrol . [Michel]150-michel , who in the face of that positive statement had forgotten to shut [his]150-michel mouth , had nothing to say . "[0-i] [He]400-the man breathes all right ? " asked [Peyrol]136-peyrol . "[400-the man] Yes . After [I]0-i got out and locked the door [I]0-i listened for a bit and [I]0-i thought [I]0-i heard [him]400-the man snore . " [Peyrol]136-peyrol looked interested and also slightly anxious . "[400-the man] [I]0-i had to come up and show [myself]0-i this morning as if nothing had happened , " [he]0-i said . "[0-i] [The officer]293-the officer has been [here]2715-here for two days and [he]293-the officer might have taken it into [his]293-the officer head to go down to the tartane . [I]0-i have been on the stretch all the morning . A goat jumping up was enough to give [me]0-i a turn . Fancy [him]400-the man running up here with [his]400-the man broken head all bandaged up , with [you]1349-you after [him]400-the man . " This seemed to be too much for [Michel]150-michel . [He]150-michel said almost indignantly : "[400-the man] [The man]400-the man 's half killed . " "[400-the man] It takes a lot to even half kill [a Brother of the Coast]440-a brother of the coast . There are [men]423-men and [men]423-men . [You]1349-you , for instance , " [Peyrol]136-peyrol continued placidly , "[1349-you] [you]1349-you would have been altogether killed if it had been [your]1349-you head that got in the way . And there are animals , beasts twice [your]1349-you size , [regular monsters]1354-regular monsters , that may be killed with nothing more than just a tap on the nose . That 's well known . [I]0-i was really afraid [he]400-the man would overcome [you]1349-you in some way or other . . . . " "[400-the man] Come , [matre]1355-matre ! [One]2670-one is n't [a little child]1286-a little child , " protested [Michel]150-michel against this accumulation of improbabilities . [He]150-michel did it , however , only in a whisper and with childlike shyness . [Peyrol]136-peyrol folded [his]136-peyrol arms on [his]136-peyrol breast : "[2670-one] Go , finish [your]1349-you soup , " [he]136-peyrol commanded in a low voice , "[2670-one] and then go down to the tartane . [You]1349-you locked the cabin door properly , [you]1349-you said ? " "[1349-you] Yes , [I]0-i have , " protested [Michel]150-michel , staggered by this display of anxiety . "[400-the man] [He]400-the man could sooner burst the deck above [his]400-the man head , as [you]1349-you know . " "[400-the man] All the same , take a small spar and shore up that door against the heel of the mast . And then watch outside . Do n't [you]1349-you go in to [him]400-the man on any account . Stay on [deck]3083-deck and keep a lookout for [me]0-i . There is a tangle here that wo n't be easily cleared and [I]0-i must be very careful . [I]0-i will try to slip away and get down as soon as [I]0-i get rid of [that officer]291-that officer . " The conference in the sunshine being ended , [Peyrol]136-peyrol walked leisurely out of [the yard]553-the yard gate , and protruding [his]136-peyrol head beyond the corner of [the house]2684-the house , saw [Lieutenant Ral]136-peyrol sitting on the bench . This [he]136-peyrol had expected to see . But [he]136-peyrol had not expected to see [him]136-peyrol there alone . It was just like this : wherever [Arlette]121-arlette happened to be , there were worrying possibilities . But [she]121-arlette might have been helping [[her]121-arlette aunt]3529-her aunt in [the kitchen]645-the kitchen with [her]121-arlette sleeves rolled up on such white arms as [Peyrol]136-peyrol had never seen on [any woman]3468-any woman before . The way [she]121-arlette had taken to dressing [her]121-arlette hair in a plait with a broad black velvet ribbon and an Arlesian cap was very becoming . [She]121-arlette was wearing now [[her]121-arlette mother]2841-her mother 's clothes of which there were chestfuls , altered for [her]121-arlette of course . [The late mistress of [the Escampobar Farm]609-the escampobar farm]3533-the late mistress of the escampobar farm had been [an Arlesienne]3535-an arlesienne . Well - to - do , too . Yes , even for [women]2762-women 's clothes [the Escampobar natives]3537-the escampobar natives could do without intercourse with [the outer world]3538-the outer world . It was quite time that [this confounded lieutenant]3539-this confounded lieutenant went back to [Toulon]1-toulon . This was the third day . [His]136-peyrol short leave must be up . [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's attitude towards [naval officers]3540-naval officers had been always guarded and suspicious . [His]136-peyrol relations with [them]3540-naval officers had been very mixed . [They]3540-naval officers had been [[his]136-peyrol enemies]747-his enemies and [[his]136-peyrol superiors]3542-his superiors . [He]136-peyrol had been chased by [them]3540-naval officers . [He]136-peyrol had been trusted by [them]3540-naval officers . [The Revolution]155-the revolution had made a clean cut across the consistency of [his]136-peyrol wild life - [Brother of [the Coast]405-the coast]3543-brother of the coast and [gunner in [the national navy]3546-the national navy]3545-gunner in the national navy - and yet [he]136-peyrol was always [the same man]3547-the same man . It was like that , too , with [them]3540-naval officers . [Officers of the King]3548-officers of the king , [officers of [the Republic]261-the republic]3549-officers of the republic , it was only changing the skin . [All alike]3551-all alike looked askance at a free rover . [Even this one]3552-even this one could not forget [his]136-peyrol epaulettes when talking to [him]136-peyrol . Scorn and mistrust of epaulettes were rooted deeply in [old Peyrol]136-peyrol . Yet [he]136-peyrol did not absolutely hate [Lieutenant Ral]136-peyrol . Only [the fellow]536-the fellow 's coming to [the farm]2746-the farm was generally a curse and [his]536-the fellow presence at that particular moment a confounded nuisance and to a certain extent even a danger . "[0-i] [I]0-i have no mind to be hauled to [Toulon]1-toulon by the scruff of [my]0-i neck , " [Peyrol]136-peyrol said to [himself]136-peyrol . There was no trusting [those epaulette - wearers]3555-those epaulette - wearers . [Any one of [them]3555-those epaulette - wearers]3556-any one of them was capable of jumping on [[his]136-peyrol best friend]3557-his best friend on account of [some officer]3558-some officer - like notion or other . [Peyrol]136-peyrol , stepping round the corner , sat down by the side of [Lieutenant Ral]136-peyrol with the feeling somehow of coming to grips with [a slippery customer]3559-a slippery customer . [The lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant , as [he]2881-the lieutenant sat there , unaware of [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's survey of [[his]2881-the lieutenant person]372-his person , gave no notion of slipperiness . On the contrary , [he]2881-the lieutenant looked rather immovably established . Very much at [home]2668-home . Too much at [home]2668-home . Even after [Peyrol]136-peyrol sat down by [his]2881-the lieutenant side [he]136-peyrol continued to look immovable - or at least difficult to get rid of . In the still noonday heat the faint shrilling of cicadas was the only sound of life heard for quite a long time . Delicate , evanescent , cheerful , careless sort of life , yet not without passion . A sudden gloom seemed to be cast over the joy of the cicadas by [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant 's voice though the words were the most perfunctory possible . "[157-tiens] [Tiens]157-tiens ! Vous voil . " In the stress of the situation [Peyrol]136-peyrol at once asked [himself]136-peyrol : "[1360-he] Now why does [he]1360-he say that ? Where did [he]1360-he expect [me]0-i to be ? " [The lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant need not have spoken at all . [He]136-peyrol had known [him]2881-the lieutenant now for about two years off and on , and it had happened many times that [they]3566-they had sat side by side on that bench in a sort of "[1360-he] at arm 's length " equality without exchanging a single word . And why could [he]2881-the lieutenant not have kept quiet now ? [That naval officer]3567-that naval officer never spoke without an object , but what could one make of words like that ? " This time [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant really brought out a paper from [his]2881-the lieutenant pocket and saying , "[141-lord nelson] [I]0-i have copied the order for [you]1431-you to see , " handed it to [the rover]822-the rover , who took it from [him]790-the old rover with a doubtful air . The order ran like this : "[0-i] [You]1431-you will make up a packet of dispatches and pretended private letters as if from [officers]602-officers , containing a clear statement besides hints calculated to convince [the enemy]627-the enemy that the destination of the fleet now fitting in [Toulon]1-toulon is for [Egypt]73-egypt and generally for [the East]3-the east . " [The Prfet Maritime]160-the prfet maritime had called [Ral]136-peyrol , had shown [him]136-peyrol the paragraph of the letter from [Paris]53-paris , had turned the page over and laid [his]136-peyrol finger on the signature , "[161-bonaparte] [Bonaparte]161-bonaparte . When [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant turned [his]2881-the lieutenant back on [him]136-peyrol [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's pointing arm fell down by [his]136-peyrol side ; but [he]136-peyrol watched [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant out of sight before [he]136-peyrol turned too and moved in a contrary direction . On losing sight of [the perplexed lieutenant]1480-the perplexed lieutenant , [Peyrol]136-peyrol discovered that [his]136-peyrol own mind was a perfect blank . [He]136-peyrol started to get down to [his]136-peyrol tartane after one side - long look at the face of [the house]2684-the house which contained quite a different problem . Let that wait . [His]136-peyrol head feeling strangely empty , [he]136-peyrol felt the pressing necessity of furnishing it with some thought without loss of time . [He]136-peyrol scrambled down steep places , caught at bushes , stepped from stone to stone , with the assurance of long practice , with mechanical precision and without for a moment relaxing [his]136-peyrol efforts to capture some definite scheme which [he]136-peyrol could put into [his]136-peyrol head . To [his]136-peyrol right [the cove]3161-the cove lay full of pale light , while the rest of [the Mediterranean]59-the mediterranean extended beyond [it]3161-the cove in a dark , unruffled blue . [Peyrol]136-peyrol was making for the little basin where [his]136-peyrol tartane had been hidden for years , like a jewel in a casket meant only for the secret rejoicing of [his]136-peyrol eye , of no more practical use than a miser 's hoard - and as precious ! Coming upon a hollow in the ground where grew a few bushes and even a few blades of grass , [Peyrol]136-peyrol sat down to rest . In that position [his]136-peyrol visible world was limited to [a stony slope]1483-a stony slope , a few boulders , the bush against which [he]136-peyrol leaned and the vista of [a piece of empty sea - horizon]1484-a piece of empty sea - horizon . [He]136-peyrol perceived that [he]136-peyrol detested [that lieutenant]1485-that lieutenant much more when [he]136-peyrol did n't see [him]136-peyrol . There was something in [the fellow]536-the fellow . Well , at any rate [he]136-peyrol had got rid of [him]536-the fellow for say eight or ten hours . An uneasiness came over [the old rover]790-the old rover , a sense of the endangered stability of things , which was anything but welcome . [He]136-peyrol wondered at it , and the thought " [I]136-peyrol am growing old , "[136-peyrol] intruded on [him]136-peyrol again . And yet [he]136-peyrol was aware of [his]136-peyrol sturdy body . [He]136-peyrol could still creep stealthily like [an Indian]1488-an indian and with [his]136-peyrol trusty cudgel knock [a man]278-a man over with a certain aim at the back of [his]278-a man head , and with force enough to fell [him]278-a man like a bullock . [He]136-peyrol had done that thing no further back than two o'clock the night before , not twelve hours ago , as easy as easy and without an undue sense of exertion . This fact cheered [him]136-peyrol up . But still [he]136-peyrol could not find an idea for [his]136-peyrol head . Not what [one]2670-one could call a real idea . It would n't come . It was no use sitting there . [He]136-peyrol got up and after a few strides came to a stony ridge from which [he]136-peyrol could see the two white blunt mastheads of [[his]136-peyrol tartane]3650-his tartane . [Her]3650-his tartane hull was hidden from [him]136-peyrol by the formation of [the shore]231-the shore , in which the most prominent feature was [a big flat piece of rock]1493-a big flat piece of rock . That was the spot on which not twelve hours before [Peyrol]136-peyrol , unable to rest in [his]136-peyrol bed and coming to seek sleep in [his]136-peyrol tartane , had seen by moonlight a man standing above [[his]136-peyrol vessel]1494-his vessel and looking down at [her]3650-his tartane , a characteristic forked black shape that certainly had no business to be there . [Peyrol]136-peyrol , by a sudden and logical deduction , had said to [himself]136-peyrol . " Landed from [an English boat]3708-an english boat . "[136-peyrol] Why , how , wherefore , [he]136-peyrol did not stay to consider . [He]136-peyrol acted at once like [a man accustomed for many years to meet emergencies of the most unexpected kind]1495-a man accustomed for many years to meet emergencies of the most unexpected kind . [The dark figure , lost in a sort of attentive amazement]1496-the dark figure , lost in a sort of attentive amazement , heard nothing , suspected nothing . The impact of the thick end of the cudgel came down on its head like a thunderbolt from the blue . The sides of the little basin echoed the crash . But [he]136-peyrol could not have heard it . The force of the blow flung [the senseless body]1497-the senseless body over the edge of [the flat rock]1498-the flat rock and down headlong into the open hold of the tartane , which received it with the sound of a muffled drum . [Peyrol]136-peyrol could not have done the job better at the age of twenty . No . Not so well . There was swiftness , mature judgment - and the sound of the muffled drum was followed by a perfect silence , without a sigh , without a moan . [Peyrol]136-peyrol ran round [a little promontory]1499-a little promontory to where [the shore]231-the shore shelved down to the level of [the tartanes rail]1501-the tartanes rail and got on board . And still the silence remained perfect in the cold moonlight and amongst the deep shadows of [the rocks]1502-the rocks . It remained perfect because [Michel]150-michel , who always slept under the half - deck forward , being wakened by the thump which had made the whole tartane tremble , had lost the power of speech . With [his]150-michel head just protruding from under the half - deck , arrested on all fours and shivering violently like a dog that had been washed with hot water , [he]150-michel was kept from advancing further by [his]150-michel terror of this bewitched corpse that had come on board flying through the air . [He]150-michel would not have touched it for anything . The " [You]150-michel there , [Michel]150-michel , "[166-the evil one] pronounced in an undertone , acted like a moral tonic . This then was not the doing of [the Evil One]166-the evil one ; it was no sorcery ! And even if it had been , now that [Peyrol]136-peyrol was there , [Michel]150-michel had lost all fear . [He]150-michel ventured not a single question while [he]150-michel helped [Peyrol]136-peyrol to turn over the limp body . [Its]136-peyrol face was covered with blood from the cut on the forehead which [it]136-peyrol had got by striking the sharp edge of the keelson . What accounted for the head not being completely smashed and for no limbs being broken was the fact that on its way through the air [the victim of undue curiosity had come in contact with and had snapped like a carrot one of the foremast shrouds]1503-the victim of undue curiosity had come in contact with and had snapped like a carrot one of the foremast shrouds . Raising [his]150-michel eves casually [Peyrol]136-peyrol noticed the broken rope , and at once put [his]150-michel hand on [the man]400-the man 's breast . " [His]400-the man heart beats yet , "[136-peyrol] [he]136-peyrol murmured . " Go and light the cabin lamp , [Michel]150-michel . "[136-peyrol] " [You]150-michel going to take that thing into [the cabin]3345-the cabin ? "[150-michel] " Yes , "[136-peyrol] said [Peyrol]136-peyrol . " [The cabin]3345-the cabin is used to that kind of thing , "[136-peyrol] and suddenly [he]136-peyrol felt very bitter . " It has been a death - trap for [better people]3711-better people than [this fellow]2692-this fellow , whoever [he]2692-this fellow is . "[136-peyrol] While [Michel]150-michel was away executing that order [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's eyes roamed all over [the shores of [the basin]1506-the basin]1505-the shores of the basin , for [he]136-peyrol could not divest [himself]136-peyrol of the idea that there must be [more Englishmen]1507-more englishmen dodging about . That [one of [the corvette]1509-the corvette 's boats]1508-one of the corvette 's boats was still in [the cove]3161-the cove [he]136-peyrol had not the slightest doubt . As to the motive of [her]1508-one of the corvette 's boats coming , it was incomprehensible . Only that senseless form lying at [his]136-peyrol feet could perhaps have told [him]136-peyrol : but [Peyrol]136-peyrol had little hope that it would ever speak again . If [[his]136-peyrol friends]1511-his friends started to look for [[their]1511-his friends shipmate]1512-their shipmate there was just a bare chance that [they]1511-his friends would not discover the existence of [the basin]1506-the basin . [Peyrol]136-peyrol stooped and felt the body all over . [He]136-peyrol found no weapon of any kind on it . There was only a common clasp - knife on a lanyard round its neck . That soul of obedience , [Michel]150-michel , returning from aft , was directed to throw a couple of bucketfuls of salt water upon the bloody head with its face upturned to the moon . The lowering of the body down into [the cabin]3345-the cabin was a matter of some little difficulty . It was heavy . [They]1511-his friends laid it full length on a locker and after [Michel]150-michel with a strange tidiness had arranged [its]150-michel arms along its sides it looked incredibly rigid . The dripping head with soaked hair was like the head of [a drowned man with a gaping pink gash on the forehead]1515-a drowned man with a gaping pink gash on the forehead . " Go on [deck]3083-deck to keep a lookout , "[136-peyrol] said [Peyrol]136-peyrol . " [We]1511-his friends may have to fight yet before the night 's out . "[136-peyrol] After [Michel]150-michel left [him]136-peyrol [Peyrol]136-peyrol began by flinging off [his]136-peyrol jacket and , without a pause , dragging [his]136-peyrol shirt off over [his]136-peyrol head . It was a very fine shirt . [The Brothers of [the Coast]10-the coast]2677-the brothers of the coast in [their]2677-the brothers of the coast hours of ease were by no means [a ragged crowd]1517-a ragged crowd , and [Peyrol]136-peyrol [the gunner]3261-the gunner had preserved a taste for fine linen . [He]136-peyrol tore the shirt into long strips , sat down on the locker and took the wet head on [his]136-peyrol knees . [He]136-peyrol bandaged it with some skill , working as calmly as though [he]136-peyrol had been practising on a dummy . Then [the experienced Peyrol]136-peyrol sought the lifeless hand and felt the pulse . The spirit had not fled yet . [The rover , stripped to the waist]1519-the rover , stripped to the waist , [his]1519-the rover , stripped to the waist powerful arms folded on the grizzled pelt of [his]1519-the rover , stripped to the waist bare breast , sat gazing down at the inert face in [his]1519-the rover , stripped to the waist lap with the eyes closed peacefully under the white band covering the forehead . [He]136-peyrol contemplated the heavy jaw combined oddly with a certain roundness of cheek , the noticeably broad nose with a sharp tip and a faint dent across the bridge , either natural or the result of some old injury . A face of brown clay , roughly modelled , with a lot of black eyelashes stuck on the closed lids and looking artificially youthful on that physiognomy forty years old or more . And [Peyrol]136-peyrol thought of [his]136-peyrol youth . Not [his]136-peyrol own youth ; that [he]136-peyrol was never anxious to recapture . It was of [that man]495-that man 's youth that [he]136-peyrol thought , of how that face had looked twenty years ago . Suddenly [he]136-peyrol shifted [his]136-peyrol position , and putting [his]136-peyrol lips to the ear of that inanimate head , yelled with all the force of [his]136-peyrol lungs : " Hullo ! Hullo ! "[136-peyrol] was the answer from a distance , and presently [Michel]150-michel put [his]150-michel head into [the cabin]3345-the cabin with an anxious grin and a gleam in the round eyes . As [Michel]150-michel was convinced that [the man]400-the man would never walk again in [his]150-michel life , [he]150-michel received those instructions without particular emotion . The dawn had broken some time before [Peyrol]136-peyrol , on [his]136-peyrol way up to [Escampobar]30-escampobar , happened to look round and had the luck to actually see with [his]136-peyrol own eyes [the English man - of - war]1526-the english man - of - war 's boat pulling out of [the cove]3161-the cove . This confirmed [his]136-peyrol surmises but did not enlighten [him]136-peyrol a bit as to the causes . [She]127-catherine moved aside and would have let [him]136-peyrol pass without remark , if [Peyrol]136-peyrol [himself]136-peyrol had not asked in a whisper : " Anything new ? "[127-catherine] [Peyrol]136-peyrol stole silently up to [[his]136-peyrol bedroom]1530-his bedroom , from which [he]136-peyrol descended an hour later as though [he]136-peyrol had spent all the night in [his]136-peyrol bed up there . It was this nocturnal adventure which had affected the character of [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's forenoon talk with [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant . What with one thing and another [he]136-peyrol found it very trying . Now that [he]136-peyrol had got rid of [Ral]136-peyrol for several hours , [the rover]822-the rover had to turn [his]136-peyrol attention to [that other invader of the strained , questionable , and ominous in its origins , peace of [the Escampobar Farm]76-escampobar farm]1533-that other invader of the strained , questionable , and ominous in its origins , peace of the escampobar farm . As [he]136-peyrol sat on [the flat rock]1498-the flat rock with [his]136-peyrol eyes fixed idly on the few drops of blood betraying [his]136-peyrol last night 's work to [the high heaven]1535-the high heaven , and trying to get hold of something definite that [he]136-peyrol could think about , [Peyrol]136-peyrol became aware of a faint thundering noise . Faint as it was it filled the whole basin . [He]136-peyrol soon guessed its nature , and [his]136-peyrol face lost its perplexity . [He]136-peyrol picked up [his]136-peyrol cudgel , got on [his]136-peyrol feet briskly , muttering to [himself]136-peyrol . " [He]150-michel 's anything but dead , "[136-peyrol] and hurried on board [the tartane]350-the tartane . On [the after - deck]1537-the after - deck [Michel]150-michel was keeping a lookout . [He]150-michel had carried out the orders [he]150-michel had received by [the well]3518-the well . Besides being secured by the very obvious padlock , [the cabin]3345-the cabin door was shored up by a spar which made it stand as firm as a rock . The thundering noise seemed to issue from its immovable substance magically . It ceased for a moment , and a sort of distracted continuous growling could be heard . Then the thundering began again . [Michel]150-michel reported : " This is the third time [he]150-michel starts this game . "[150-michel] " Not much strength in this , "[136-peyrol] remarked [Peyrol]136-peyrol gravely . "[136-peyrol] [[Peyrol]136-peyrol 's prisoner]1551-peyrol 's prisoner did look somewhat as though [he]1551-peyrol 's prisoner had got [his]1551-peyrol 's prisoner head broken in a drunken brawl . But to [Peyrol]136-peyrol [his]136-peyrol appearance was not repulsive . [The rover]822-the rover preserved a tender memory of [[his]136-peyrol freebooter]433-his freebooter 's life with its lawless spirit and its spacious scene of action , before the change in the state of affairs in [the Indian Ocean]1554-the indian ocean , the astounding rumours from [the outer world]3538-the outer world , made [him]136-peyrol reflect on its precarious character . It was true that [he]136-peyrol had deserted the French flag when quite [a youngster]1556-a youngster ; but at that time that flag was white ; and now it was a flag of three colours . [He]136-peyrol had known the practice of liberty , equality and fraternity as understood in the haunts open or secret of [the Brotherhood of [the Coast]10-the coast]2673-the brotherhood of the coast . So the change , if one could believe what [people]287-people talked about , could not be very great . [The rover]822-the rover had also [his]136-peyrol own positive notions as to what these three words were worth . Liberty - to hold [your]1560-your own in [the world]2656-the world if [you]1560-your could . Equality - yes ! But [no body of]1562-no body of [men]423-men ever accomplished anything without [a chief]3307-a chief . All this was worth what it was worth . [He]136-peyrol regarded [fraternity]1565-fraternity somewhat differently . [Of course]1566-of course [brothers]749-brothers would quarrel amongst [themselves]749-brothers ; it was during a fierce quarrel that flamed up suddenly in [a company of [Brothers]749-brothers]748-a company of brothers that [he]136-peyrol had received the most dangerous wound of [his]136-peyrol life . But for that [Peyrol]136-peyrol nursed no grudge against [anybody]1371-anybody . In [his]136-peyrol view the claim of [the Brotherhood]170-the brotherhood was a claim for help against [the outside world]1571-the outside world . And here [he]136-peyrol was sitting opposite [a Brother]1271-a brother whose head [he]136-peyrol had broken on sufficient grounds . There [he]136-peyrol was across the table looking dishevelled and dazed , uncomprehending and aggrieved , and that head of [his]136-peyrol proved as hard as ages ago when the nickname of [Testa Dura]171-testa dura had been given to [him]136-peyrol by [a Brother of Italian origin on some occasion or other]1573-a brother of italian origin on some occasion or other , some butting match no doubt ; just as [he]136-peyrol , [Peyrol]136-peyrol [himself]136-peyrol , was known for a time on both sides of [the Mozambique Channel]16-the mozambique channel as [Poigne - de - Fer]78-poigne - de - fer , after an incident when in the presence of [the Brothers]1574-the brothers [he]136-peyrol played at arm 's length with the windpipe of [an obstreperous negro sorcerer with an enormous girth of chest]1575-an obstreperous negro sorcerer with an enormous girth of chest . While [he]136-peyrol had been closeted with [[his]136-peyrol prisoner]1543-his prisoner the sky had got covered with a thin layer of cloud , in one of those swift changes of weather that are not unusual in [the Mediterranean]59-the mediterranean . This grey vapour , drifting high up , close against the disc of the sun , seemed to enlarge the space behind its veil , add to the vastness of a shadowless world no longer hard and brilliant but all softened in the contours of [its]1637-its masses and in the faint line of the horizon , as if ready to dissolve in the immensity of [the Infinite]81-the infinite . Familiar and indifferent to [his]136-peyrol eyes , material and shadowy , the extent of [the changeable sea]1638-the changeable sea had gone pale under the pale sun in a mysterious and emotional response . [He]136-peyrol came to [himself]136-peyrol with a start . What sort of occupation was this , " [cr nom de nom]173-cr nom de nom , staring at a silly bench with [no one on it]3791-no one on it ? There was a little wind in [the Passe]47-the passe , while the dull silver of the open had a darkling rim of rippled water far away to [the cast]3803-the cast in that quarter where , far or near , but mostly out of sight , [the British Fleet]83-the british fleet kept its endless watch . Not a shadow of a spar or gleam of sail on the horizon betrayed its presence ; but [Peyrol]136-peyrol would not have been surprised to see a crowd of [ships]377-ships surge up , people the horizon with hostile life , come in running , and dot [the sea]281-the sea with [their]824-the buildings ordered groups all about [Cape Cici]68-cape cici , parading [their]824-the buildings damned impudence . A fear for [his]136-peyrol tartane clutched [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's heart till [he]136-peyrol remembered that [the Englishman]1614-the englishman did not know of [her]902-that corvette existence . [Peyrol]136-peyrol actually laughed at [his]136-peyrol momentary scare . Moreover , it was evident that [the Englishman]1614-the englishman did not mean to parade in front of [the peninsula]452-the peninsula . [He]1614-the englishman did not mean to be impudent . [The sloop]3823-the sloop 's yards were swung right round and [she]3823-the sloop came again to the wind but now heading to the northward back from where [she]3823-the sloop came . [Peyrol]136-peyrol saw at once that [the Englishman]1614-the englishman meant to pass to windward of [Cape Esterel]20-cape esterel , probably with the intention of anchoring for the night off [the long white beach]3825-the long white beach which in a regular curve closes [the roadstead of [Hyres]22-hyres]3826-the roadstead of hyres on that side . [Peyrol]136-peyrol pictured [her]3823-the sloop to [himself]136-peyrol , on the clouded night , not so very dark since the fall moon was but a day old , lying at anchor within hail of [the low shore]3827-the low shore , with [her]3823-the sloop sails furled and looking profoundly asleep , but with the watch on deck lying by the guns . [He]136-peyrol gnashed [his]136-peyrol teeth . It had come to this at last , that [the captain of the Amelia]3828-the captain of the amelia could do nothing with [[his]3828-the captain of the amelia ship]273-his ship without putting [Peyrol]136-peyrol into a rage . Oh , for [forty Brothers]3830-forty brothers , or [sixty , picked ones]3831-sixty , picked ones , [he]136-peyrol thought , to teach [the fellow]536-the fellow what it might cost [him]136-peyrol taking liberties along [the French coast]3833-the french coast ! [Ships]377-ships had been carried by surprise before , on nights when there was just light enough to see the whites of each other 's eyes in a close tussle . And what would be [the crew of [that Englishman]3607-that englishman]3835-the crew of that englishman ? Something between [ninety and a hundred altogether]3837-ninety and a hundred altogether , [boys]3838-boys and [landsman]3839-landsman included . ... But in [his]136-peyrol heart of hearts [that seaman of cosmopolitan associations]3841-that seaman of cosmopolitan associations knew very well that no forty or sixty , not [any given hundred Brothers of [the Coast]405-the coast]3842-any given hundred brothers of the coast would have been enough to capture [that corvette]902-that corvette making [herself]902-that corvette at [home]2668-home within ten miles of where [he]136-peyrol had first opened [his]136-peyrol eyes to [the world]2656-the world . [He]136-peyrol shook [his]136-peyrol head dismally at the leaning pine , [[his]136-peyrol only companion]3847-his only companion . The disinherited soul of that rover ranging for so many years [a lawless ocean with [the coasts of [two continents]3850-two continents for a raiding ground]3849-the coasts of two continents for a raiding ground , had come back to [its]3848-a lawless ocean with the coasts of two continents for a raiding ground , had come back to its crag , circling like a sea - bird in the dusk and longing for a great sea victory for its people crag , circling like a sea - bird in the dusk and longing for a great sea victory for [[its]3848-a lawless ocean with the coasts of two continents for a raiding ground , had come back to its crag , circling like a sea - bird in the dusk and longing for a great sea victory for its people people]3851-its people]3848-a lawless ocean with the coasts of two continents for a raiding ground , had come back to its crag , circling like a sea - bird in the dusk and longing for a great sea victory for its people : [that inland multitude of which [Peyrol]136-peyrol]3852-that inland multitude of which peyrol knew nothing except [the few individuals on [that peninsula]3854-that peninsula cut off from [the rest of [the land]386-the land by the dead water of [a salt lagoon]3857-a salt lagoon]3855-the rest of the land by the dead water of a salt lagoon]3853-the few individuals on that peninsula cut off from the rest of the land by the dead water of a salt lagoon ; and where only a strain of manliness in [a miserable cripple and an unaccountable charm of a half - crazed woman]3858-a miserable cripple and an unaccountable charm of a half - crazed woman had found response in [his]136-peyrol heart . This scheme of false dispatches was but a detail in a plan for a great , a destructive victory . just a detail , but not a trifle all the same . Nothing connected with the deception of [an admiral]3680-an admiral could be called trifling . And such [an admiral]3680-an admiral too . It was , [Peyrol]136-peyrol felt vaguely , a scheme that only [a confounded landsman]3861-a confounded landsman would invent . It behoved [the sailors]3862-the sailors , however , to make a workable thing of it . It would have to be worked through [that corvette]902-that corvette . And here [Peyrol]136-peyrol was brought up by the question that all [his]136-peyrol life had not been able to settle for [him]136-peyrol - and that was whether [the English]115-the english were really very stupid or very acute . That difficulty had presented itself with every fresh case . [The old rover]790-the old rover had enough genius in [him]790-the old rover to have arrived at a general conclusion that if [they]3862-the sailors were to be deceived at all it could not be done very well by words but rather by deeds ; not by mere wriggling , but by deep craft concealed under some sort of straightforward action . That conviction , however , did not take [him]136-peyrol forward in this case , which was one in which much thinking would be necessary . [The Amelia]138-the amelia had disappeared behind [Cape Esterel]20-cape esterel , and [Peyrol]136-peyrol wondered with a certain anxiety whether this meant that [the Englishman]1614-the englishman had given up [[his]1614-the englishman man]250-his man for good . "[1663-he] If [he]1663-he has , " said [Peyrol]136-peyrol to [himself]136-peyrol , "[1663-he] [I]0-i am bound to see [him]1663-he pass out again from beyond [Cape Esterel]20-cape esterel before it gets dark . " If , however , [he]136-peyrol did not see [the ship]2931-the ship again within the next hour or two , then [she]2931-the ship would be anchored off [the beach]3107-the beach , to wait for the night before making some attempt to discover what had become of [[her]2931-the ship man]3869-her man . After coming to this conclusion [Peyrol]136-peyrol began deliberately to charge [his]136-peyrol pipe . Had [he]136-peyrol spared a moment for a glance inland [he]136-peyrol might have caught a whisk of a black skirt , the gleam of a white fichu - Arlette running down the faint track leading from [Escampobar]30-escampobar to [the village]497-the village in [the hollow]3875-the hollow ; [the same track in fact up which [Citizen Scevola]123-scevola , while indulging in the strange freak to visit [the church]835-the church]3876-the same track in fact up which citizen scevola , while indulging in the strange freak to visit the church , had been chased by [the incensed faithful]3878-the incensed faithful . Then , throwing [his]136-peyrol arm affectionately over the trunk of the pine , [he]136-peyrol had settled [himself]136-peyrol to watch . Far below [him]136-peyrol [the roadstead]3879-the roadstead , with [its]3879-the roadstead play of grey and bright gleams , looked like a plaque of mother - of - pearl in a frame of [yellow rocks and dark green ravines set off inland by the masses of the hills]3880-yellow rocks and dark green ravines set off inland by the masses of the hills displaying the tint of the finest purple ; while above [his]136-peyrol head the sun , behind a cloud - veil , hung like a silver disc . That afternoon , after waiting in vain for [Lieutenant Ral]136-peyrol to appear outside in the usual way , [Arlette]121-arlette , [the mistress of [Escampobar]30-escampobar]3881-the mistress of escampobar , had gone unwillingly into [the kitchen]645-the kitchen where [Catherine]127-catherine sat upright in a heavy capacious wooden armchair , the back of which rose above the top of [her]127-catherine white muslin cap . Even in [her]127-catherine old age , even in [her]127-catherine hours of ease , [Catherine]127-catherine preserved [the upright carriage of [the family that had held [Escampobar]30-escampobar for so many generations]3884-the family that had held escampobar for so many generations]3883-the upright carriage of the family that had held escampobar for so many generations . It would have been easy to believe that , like [some characters famous in [the world]2656-the world]3885-some characters famous in the world , [Catherine]127-catherine would have wished to die standing up and with unbowed shoulders . With [her]127-catherine sense of hearing undecayed [she]127-catherine detected the light footsteps in the salle long before [Arlette]121-arlette entered [the kitchen]645-the kitchen . [That woman , who had faced alone and unaided except for [[her]3888-that woman , who had faced alone and unaided except for her brother 's comprehending silence the anguish of passion in a forbidden love , and of terrors comparable to those of the judgment day brother]3380-her brother 's comprehending silence the anguish of passion in a forbidden love , and of terrors comparable to those of the judgment Day]3888-that woman , who had faced alone and unaided except for her brother 's comprehending silence the anguish of passion in a forbidden love , and of terrors comparable to those of the judgment day , neither turned [her]3888-that woman , who had faced alone and unaided except for her brother 's comprehending silence the anguish of passion in a forbidden love , and of terrors comparable to those of the judgment day face , quiet without serenity , nor [her]3888-that woman , who had faced alone and unaided except for her brother 's comprehending silence the anguish of passion in a forbidden love , and of terrors comparable to those of the judgment day eyes , fearless but without fire , in the direction of [[her]3888-that woman , who had faced alone and unaided except for her brother 's comprehending silence the anguish of passion in a forbidden love , and of terrors comparable to those of the judgment day niece]3379-her niece . [Arlette]121-arlette glanced on all sides , even at the walls , even at the mound of ashes under the big overmantel , nursing in its heart a spark of fire , before [she]121-arlette sat down and leaned [her]121-arlette elbow on the table . "[1664-you] [You]1664-you wander about like a soul in pain , " said [[her]1664-you aunt]3529-her aunt , sitting by the hearth like [an old queen on [her]3529-her aunt throne]3892-an old queen on her throne . [Arlette]121-arlette rested [her]121-arlette head on [her]121-arlette half - closed hand , and [her]121-arlette eyes , losing their steadiness , began to tremble amongst cruel visions . [She]121-arlette got up suddenly and caressed the thin , half - averted , withered cheek with the tips of [her]121-arlette fingers , and in a low voice , with that marvellous cadence that plucked at one 's heart - strings , [she]121-arlette said coaxingly : "[0-i] Those were dreams , were n't they ? " In [her]121-arlette immobilitv [the old woman]1151-the old woman called with all the might of [her]121-arlette will for the presence of [Peyrol]136-peyrol . [She]121-arlette had never been able to shake off a superstitious fear of that niece restored to [her]121-arlette from the terrors of a Judgment Day in which [the world]2656-the world had been given over to [the devils]3895-the devils . [She]121-arlette was always afraid that [this girl , wandering about with restless eyes]3896-this girl , wandering about with restless eyes and a dim smile on [her]1151-the old woman silent lips , would suddenly say something atrocious , unfit to be heard , calling for vengeance from [heaven]3897-heaven , unless [Peyrol]136-peyrol were by . [That stranger]3898-that stranger come from "[0-i] par dela les mers " was out of it altogether , cared probably for [no one in [the world]2656-the world]3899-no one in the world but had struck [her]121-arlette imagination by [his]136-peyrol massive aspect , [his]136-peyrol deliberation suggesting a mighty force like the reposeful attitude of a lion . [Arlette]121-arlette desisted from caressing the irresponsive cheek , exclaimed petulantly : "[0-i] [I]0-i am awake now ! " and went out of [the kitchen]645-the kitchen without having asked [[her]121-arlette aunt]3529-her aunt the question [she]121-arlette had meant to ask , which was whether [she]121-arlette knew what had become of [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant . [Her]121-arlette heart had failed [her]121-arlette . [She]121-arlette let [herself]121-arlette drop on the bench outside the door of [the salle]782-the salle . " Even [Peyrol]136-peyrol , so different from [all mankind]3905-all mankind , who from the first moment when [he]136-peyrol stood before [her]121-arlette had the power to soothe [her]121-arlette aimless unrest , even [Peyrol]136-peyrol would now sit for hours with [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant on the bench , gazing into the air and keeping [him]136-peyrol in talk about things without sense , as if on purpose to prevent [him]136-peyrol from thinking of [her]121-arlette . Well , [he]136-peyrol could not do that . But the enormous change implied in the fact that every day had a to - morrow now , and that [all the people around [her]121-arlette]3907-all the people around her had ceased to be mere phantoms for [her]121-arlette wandering glances to glide over without concern , made [her]121-arlette feel the need of support from [somebody]876-somebody , from somewhere . [She]121-arlette could have cried aloud for it . [She]121-arlette sprang up and walked along the whole front of [the farm building]3909-the farm building . At the end of the wall enclosing [the orchard]3910-the orchard [she]121-arlette called out in a modulated undertone : "[174-eugne] [Eugne]174-eugne , " not because [she]121-arlette hoped that [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant was anywhere within earshot , but for the pleasure of hearing the sound of the name uttered for once above a whisper . [She]121-arlette turned about and at the end of the wall on [the yard side]3912-the yard side [she]121-arlette repeated [her]121-arlette call , drinking in the sound that came from [her]121-arlette lips , "[174-eugne] [Eugne]174-eugne , [Eugne]174-eugne , " with a sort of half - exulting despair . It was in such dizzy moments that [she]121-arlette wanted a steadying support . But all was still . [She]121-arlette heard no friendly murmur , not even a sigh . Above [her]121-arlette head under the thin grey sky a big mulberry tree stirred no leaf . Step by step , as if unconsciously , [she]121-arlette began to move down [the track]450-the track . At the end of [fifty yards]3914-fifty yards [she]121-arlette opened the inland view , the roofs of [the village]497-the village between [the green tops of [the platanes]3917-the platanes]3916-the green tops of the platanes overshadowing [the fountain]3918-the fountain , and just beyond the flat blue - grey level of [the salt lagoon]1163-the salt lagoon , smooth and dull like a slab of lead . [He]3926-the abb was not exactly feared , but [some of [the oldest inhabitants who remembered [the previous incumbent]3939-the previous incumbent]3938-the oldest inhabitants who remembered the previous incumbent , an old man who died in [the garden]3940-the garden after having been dragged out of bed by [some patriots anxious to take [him]3926-the abb to prison in [Hyres]22-hyres]3941-some patriots anxious to take him to prison in hyres]3937-some of the oldest inhabitants who remembered the previous incumbent , an old man who died in the garden after having been dragged out of bed by some patriots anxious to take him to prison in hyres , jerked [their]3937-some of the oldest inhabitants who remembered the previous incumbent , an old man who died in the garden after having been dragged out of bed by some patriots anxious to take him to prison in hyres heads sideways in a knowing manner when [[their]3937-some of the oldest inhabitants who remembered the previous incumbent , an old man who died in the garden after having been dragged out of bed by some patriots anxious to take him to prison in hyres cur]3942-their cur was mentioned . [The abb]3926-the abb , though persuaded that any amount of moral turpitude was possible in [a godless country]3955-a godless country , had not accepted all that tale literally .
