" and [the priest]852-the priest remained mute for a moment . "[1678-that rabble] What do [they]1678-that rabble say ? In [[my]0-i father]1315-my father 's time [they]1678-that rabble would n't have dared to say anything . The only thing [I]0-i saw of [them]1678-that rabble for years and years was when [they]1678-that rabble were yelping like curs on the heels of [Scevola]123-scevola . " The absence of scorn in [her]1673-the old woman in the kitchen tone was perfectly annihilating . Gentle sounds flowed from [her]1673-the old woman in the kitchen lips and a disturbing charm from [her]1673-the old woman in the kitchen strange equanimity . [The abb]3926-the abb frowned heavily at these fascinations , which seemed to have in [them]1678-that rabble something diabolic . "[1678-that rabble] [They]1678-that rabble are [simple souls , neglected , fallen back into darkness]1680-simple souls , neglected , fallen back into darkness . It is n't [their]1678-that rabble fault . [They]1678-that rabble have natural feelings of humanity which were outraged . [I]0-i saved [him]123-scevola from [their]1678-that rabble indignation . There are things that must be left to divine justice . " [He]3926-the abb was exasperated by the unconsciousness of that fair face . "[1681-that man whose name you have just pronounced and which i have heard coupled with the epithet of ` blood - drinker '] [That man whose name [you]0-i have just pronounced and which [I]0-i have heard coupled with the epithet of ` [blood - drinker ']1682-blood - drinker ']1681-that man whose name you have just pronounced and which i have heard coupled with the epithet of ` blood - drinker ' is regarded as [the master of [Escampobar Farm]76-escampobar farm]1683-the master of escampobar farm . [He]1681-that man whose name you have just pronounced and which i have heard coupled with the epithet of ` blood - drinker ' has been living [there]266-there for years . How is that ? " "[1681-that man whose name you have just pronounced and which i have heard coupled with the epithet of ` blood - drinker '] Yes , it is a long time ago since [he]1681-that man whose name you have just pronounced and which i have heard coupled with the epithet of ` blood - drinker ' brought [me]0-i back to [the house]2684-the house . Years ago . [Catherine]127-catherine let [him]1681-that man whose name you have just pronounced and which i have heard coupled with the epithet of ` blood - drinker ' stay . " "[127-catherine] Who is [Catherine]127-catherine ? " [the abb]3926-the abb asked harshly . "[127-catherine] [She]127-catherine is [[[my]0-i father]1315-my father 's sister who was left at [home]2668-home to wait . [She]127-catherine had given up all hope of seeing any of [us]1689-us again , when one morning [Scevola]123-scevola came with [me]0-i to the door]1687-my father 's sister who was left at home to wait . she had given up all hope of seeing any of us again , when one morning scevola came with me to the door . Then [she]127-catherine let [him]1681-that man whose name you have just pronounced and which i have heard coupled with the epithet of ` blood - drinker ' stay . [He]1681-that man whose name you have just pronounced and which i have heard coupled with the epithet of ` blood - drinker ' is [a poor creature]1690-a poor creature . What else could [Catherine]127-catherine have done ? And what is it to [us]1689-us up there how [the people in [the village]497-the village]1691-the people in the village regard [him]1681-that man whose name you have just pronounced and which i have heard coupled with the epithet of ` blood - drinker ' ? " [She]127-catherine dropped [her]127-catherine eyes and seemed to fall into deep thought , then added , "[1691-the people in the village] It was only later that [I]0-i discovered that [he]1681-that man whose name you have just pronounced and which i have heard coupled with the epithet of ` blood - drinker ' was [a poor creature , even quite lately]1693-a poor creature , even quite lately . [They]1691-the people in the village call [him]1681-that man whose name you have just pronounced and which i have heard coupled with the epithet of ` blood - drinker ' [blood - drinker]1694-blood - drinker , do [they]1691-the people in the village ? What of that ? All the time [he]1681-that man whose name you have just pronounced and which i have heard coupled with the epithet of ` blood - drinker ' was afraid of [his]1681-that man whose name you have just pronounced and which i have heard coupled with the epithet of ` blood - drinker ' own shadow . " [She]127-catherine ceased but did not raise [her]127-catherine eyes . "[1681-that man whose name you have just pronounced and which i have heard coupled with the epithet of ` blood - drinker '] [You]0-i are no longer [a child]2774-a child , " began [the abb]3926-the abb in a severe voice , frowning at [her]127-catherine downcast eyes , and [he]0-i heard a murmur : "[0-i] Not very long . " [He]0-i disregarded it and continued : "[0-i] [I]0-i ask [you]0-i , is this all that [you]0-i have to tell [me]0-i about [that man]495-that man ? [I]0-i hope that at least [you]0-i are [no hypocrite]1697-no hypocrite . " "[0-i] Monsieur l'Abb , " [she]127-catherine said , raising [her]127-catherine eyes fearlessly , "[0-i] what more am [I]0-i to tell [you]0-i about [him]495-that man ? [I]0-i can tell [you]0-i things that will make [your]0-i hair stand on end , but it would n't be about [him]495-that man . " For all answer [the abb]3926-the abb made a weary gesture and turned away to walk up and down [the room]413-the room . [His]3926-the abb face expressed neither curiosity nor pity , but a sort of repugnance which [he]3926-the abb made an effort to overcome . [He]3926-the abb dropped into a deep and shabby old armchair , the only object of luxury in [the room]413-the room , and pointed to a wooden straight - backed stool . [Arlette]121-arlette sat down on it and began to speak . [The abb]3926-the abb listened , but looking far away ; [his]3926-the abb big bony hands rested on the arms of the chair . After the first words [he]3926-the abb interrupted [her]121-arlette : "[0-i] This is [your]0-i own story [you]0-i are telling [me]0-i . " "[0-i] Yes , " said [Arlette]121-arlette . "[0-i] Is it necessary that [I]0-i should know ? " "[1698-monsieur] Yes , [Monsieur]1698-monsieur l'Abb . " "[1698-monsieur] But why ? " [He]3926-the abb bent [his]3926-the abb head a little , without , however , ceasing to look far away . [Her]121-arlette voice now was very low . Suddenly [the abb]3926-the abb threw [himself]3926-the abb back . "[0-i] [You]0-i want to tell [me]0-i [your]0-i story because [you]0-i have fallen in love with [a man]278-a man ? " "[0-i] No , because that has brought [me]0-i back to [myself]0-i . Nothing else could have done it . " [He]3926-the abb turned [his]3926-the abb head to look at [her]121-arlette grimly , but [he]3926-the abb said nothing and looked away again . [He]3926-the abb listened . At the beginning [he]3926-the abb muttered once or twice , "[0-i] Yes , [I]0-i have heard that , " and then kept silent , not looking at [her]121-arlette at all . Once [he]3926-the abb interrupted [her]121-arlette by a question : "[0-i] [You]0-i were confirmed before [the convent]1700-the convent was forcibly entered and [the nuns]1701-the nuns dispersed ? " "[1702-two of those ladies] Yes , " [she]121-arlette said , "[1702-two of those ladies] a year before that or more . " "[1702-two of those ladies] And then [two of [those ladies]1703-those ladies]1702-two of those ladies took [you]0-i with [them]1702-two of those ladies towards [Toulon]1-toulon . " "[1703-those ladies] Yes , [the other girls]1704-the other girls had [their]1704-the other girls relations near by . [They]1704-the other girls took [me]0-i with [them]1704-the other girls thinking to communicate with [[my]0-i parents]1705-my parents , but it was difficult . Then [the English]115-the english came and [[my]0-i parents]1705-my parents sailed over to try and get some news of [me]0-i . It was safe for [[my]0-i father]1315-my father to be in [Toulon]1-toulon then . Perhaps [you]1315-my father think that [he]1315-my father was [a traitor to [[his]1315-my father country]3059-his country]1708-a traitor to his country ? " [she]3982-she asked , and waited with parted lips . With an impassible face [the abb]3926-the abb murmured : "[1315-my father] [He]1315-my father was [a good Royalist]1710-a good royalist , " in a tone of bitter fatalism , which seemed to absolve [that man]495-that man and [all the other men of whose actions and errors [he]1315-my father had ever heard]3985-all the other men of whose actions and errors he had ever heard . For a long time , [Arlette]121-arlette continued , [[her]121-arlette father]2840-her father could not discover [the house where [the nuns]1701-the nuns had taken refuge]3987-the house where the nuns had taken refuge . [He]2840-her father only obtained some information on the very day before [the English]544-the english evacuated [Toulon]1-toulon . Late in the day [he]2840-her father appeared before [her]121-arlette and took [her]121-arlette away . [The town]225-the town was full of [retreating foreign troops]3991-retreating foreign troops . [[Her]121-arlette father]2840-her father left [her]121-arlette with [[her]121-arlette mother]2841-her mother and went out again to make preparations for sailing [home]2668-home that very night ; but [the tartane]350-the tartane was no longer in [the place where [he]2840-her father had left [her]121-arlette lying]3996-the place where he had left her lying . [The two Madrague men that [he]2840-her father had for [a crew]3511-a crew]3997-the two madrague men that he had for a crew had disappeared also . Thus [the family]3999-the family was trapped in [that town]4000-that town full of tumult and confusion . [Ships]377-ships and [houses]417-houses were bursting into flames . Appalling explosions of gunpowder shook [the earth]723-the earth . [She]121-arlette spent that night on [her]121-arlette knees with [her]121-arlette face hidden in [[her]121-arlette mother]2841-her mother 's lap , while [[her]121-arlette father]2840-her father kept watch by the barricaded door with a pistol in each hand . In the morning [the house]2684-the house was filled with savage yells . [People]287-people were heard rushing up the stairs , and the door was burst in . [She]121-arlette jumped up at the crash and flung [herself]121-arlette down on [her]121-arlette knees in a corner with [her]121-arlette face to the wall . There was a murderous uproar , [she]121-arlette heard two shots fired , then [somebody]876-somebody seized [her]121-arlette by the arm and pulled [her]121-arlette up to [her]121-arlette feet . It was [Scevola]123-scevola . [He]123-scevola dragged [her]121-arlette to the door . The bodies of [[her]121-arlette father]2840-her father and [mother]1316-mother were lying across the doorway . [The room]413-the room was full of gunpowder smoke . [She]121-arlette wanted to fling [herself]121-arlette on the bodies and cling to [them]287-people , but [Scevola]123-scevola took [her]121-arlette under the arms and lifted [her]121-arlette over [them]287-people . [He]123-scevola seized [her]121-arlette hand and made [her]121-arlette run with [him]123-scevola , or rather dragged [her]121-arlette [downstairs]772-downstairs . Outside on [the pavement]4013-the pavement [some dreadful men]4014-some dreadful men and [many fierce women with knives]4015-many fierce women with knives joined [them]1711-them . [They]1711-them ran along [the streets]276-the streets brandishing pikes and sabres , pursuing [other groups of [unarmed people , who fled round corners with loud shrieks]4018-unarmed people , who fled round corners with loud shrieks]4017-other groups of unarmed people , who fled round corners with loud shrieks . "[1315-my father] [I]0-i ran in the midst of [them]1711-them , [Monsieur l'Abb]1712-monsieur l'abb , " [Arlette]121-arlette went on in a breathless murmur . "[0-i] Whenever [I]0-i saw any water [I]0-i wanted to throw [myself]0-i into it , but [I]0-i was surrounded on all sides , [I]0-i was jostled and pushed and most of the time [Scevola]123-scevola held [my]0-i hand very tight . When [they]1711-them stopped at [a wine shop]1713-a wine shop , [they]1711-them would offer [me]0-i some wine . [My]0-i tongue stuck to the roof of [my]0-i mouth and [I]0-i drank . The wine , the pavements , the arms and faces , everything was red . [I]0-i had red splashes all over [me]0-i . [I]0-i had to run with [them]1711-them all day , and all the time [I]0-i felt as if [I]0-i were falling down , and down , and down . [The houses]522-the houses were nodding at [me]0-i . The sun would go out at times . And suddenly [I]0-i heard [myself]0-i yelling exactly like [the others]3246-the others . Do [you]123-scevola understand , [Monsieur I'Abb]177-monsieur i'abb ? The very same words ! " The eyes of [the priest]852-the priest in [their]852-the priest deep orbits glided towards [her]4020-her and then resumed [their]852-the priest far - away fixity . Between [his]0-i fatalism and [his]0-i faith [he]0-i was not very far from the belief of [Satan]178-satan taking possession of [rebellious mankind]4021-rebellious mankind , exposing the nakedness of hearts like flint and of the homicidal souls of the Revolution . "[0-i] [I]0-i have heard something of that , " [he]0-i whispered stealthily . [She]4020-her affirmed with quiet earnestness : "[0-i] Yet at that time [I]0-i resisted with all [my]0-i might . " That night [Scevola]123-scevola put [her]4020-her under the care of [a woman called [Perose]179-perose]4022-a woman called perose . [She]4020-her was young and pretty and was [a native of [Arles]87-arles]4023-a native of arles , [[[her]4020-her mother]2841-her mother 's country]4025-her mother 's country . [She]4020-her kept [an inn]490-an inn . [That woman]1461-that woman locked [her]4020-her up in [[her]4020-her own room]4028-her own room , which was next to [the room where [the patriots]2737-the patriots kept on shouting , singing and making speeches far into the night]4029-the room where the patriots kept on shouting , singing and making speeches far into the night . Several times [the woman]561-the woman would look in for a moment , make a hopeless gesture at [her]4020-her with both arms , and vanish again . Later , on many other nights when [all the band]4032-all the band lay asleep on benches and on the floor , [Perose]179-perose would steal into [the room]413-the room , fall on [her]179-perose knees by the bed on which [Arlette]121-arlette sat upright , open - eyed , and raving silently to [herself]179-perose , embrace [her]179-perose feet and cry [herself]179-perose to sleep . But in the morning [she]179-perose would jump up briskly and say : "[0-i] Come . The great affair is to keep [our]1716-our life in [our]1716-our bodies . Come along to help in the work of justice " ; and [they]4032-all the band would join [the band that was making ready for another day of traitor hunting]4034-the band that was making ready for another day of traitor hunting . But after a time [the victims]4035-the victims , of which [the streets]276-the streets were full at first , had to be sought for in [back - yards]4037-back - yards , ferreted out of [their]4035-the victims hiding - places , dragged up out of [the cellars]4038-the cellars , or down from [the garrets of [the houses]522-the houses]4039-the garrets of the houses , which would be entered by [the band]4041-the band with howls of death and vengeance . "[1717-monsieur] Then , [Monsieur]1717-monsieur l'Abb , " said [Arlette]121-arlette , "[1717-monsieur] [I]0-i let [myself]0-i go at last . [I]0-i could resist no longer . [I]0-i said to [myself]0-i . ` If it is so then it must be right . But most of the time [I]0-i was like [a person half asleep]1718-a person half asleep and dreaming things that it is impossible to believe . About that time , [I]0-i do n't know why , [the woman [Perose]179-perose]1719-the woman perose hinted to [me]0-i that [Scevola]123-scevola was [a poor creature]1690-a poor creature . Next night while [all the band]4032-all the band lay fast asleep in [the big room]1722-the big room [Perose]179-perose and [Scevola]123-scevola helped [me]0-i out of the window into [the street]309-the street and led [me]0-i to [the quay behind [the arsenal]224-the arsenal]1724-the quay behind the arsenal . [Scevola]123-scevola had found [our]1726-our tartane lying at the pontoon and [one of [the Madrague men]1728-the madrague men]1727-one of the madrague men with [her]179-perose . [The other]506-the other had disappeared . [Perose]179-perose fell on [my]0-i neck and cried a little . [She]179-perose gave [me]0-i a kiss and said : " [My]179-perose time will come soon . [You]0-i , [Scevola]123-scevola , do n't [you]0-i show [yourself]0-i in [Toulon]1-toulon , because [nobody]2665-nobody believes in [you]0-i any more . Adieu , [Arlette]121-arlette . Vive la Nation ! "[179-perose] and [she]179-perose vanished in the night . [I]0-i waited on [the pontoon]1730-the pontoon shivering in [my]0-i torn clothes , listening to [Scevola]123-scevola and [the man throwing dead bodies]1731-the man throwing dead bodies overboard out of the tartane . Splash , splash , splash . And suddenly [I]0-i felt [I]0-i must run away , but [they]1732-they were after [me]0-i in a moment , dragged [me]0-i back and threw [me]0-i down into [that cabin]1733-that cabin which smelt of blood . But when [I]0-i got back to [the farm]2746-the farm all feeling had left [me]0-i . [I]0-i did not feel [myself]0-i exist . [I]0-i saw things round [me]0-i here and there , but [I]0-i could n't look at anything for long . Something was gone out of [me]0-i . 1 know now that it was not [my]0-i heart , but then [I]0-i did n't mind what it was . [I]0-i felt light and empty , and a little cold all the time , but [I]0-i could smile at [people]287-people . Nothing could matter . Nothing could mean anything . [I]0-i cared for [no one]732-no one . [I]0-i wanted nothing . [I]0-i was n't alive at all , [Monsieur l'Abb]1737-monsieur l'abb . [People]287-people seemed to see [me]0-i and would talk to [me]0-i , and it seemed funny - till one day [I]0-i felt [my]0-i heart beat . " "[287-people] Why precisely did [you]1737-monsieur l'abb come to [me]0-i with this tale ? " asked [the abb]3926-the abb in a low voice . "[1737-monsieur l'abb] Because [you]1737-monsieur l'abb are [a priest]2731-a priest . Have [you]1737-monsieur l'abb forgotten that [I]0-i have been brought up in [a convent]1740-a convent ? [I]0-i have not forgotten how to pray . But [I]0-i am afraid of [the world]2656-the world now . What must [I]0-i do ? " "[0-i] Repent ! " thundered [the abb]3926-the abb , getting up . [He]3926-the abb saw [her]1737-monsieur l'abb candid gaze uplifted and lowered [his]3926-the abb voice forcibly . "[1742-you] [You]1742-you must look with fearless sincerity into the darkness of [your]1742-you soul . Remember whence the only true help can come . [Those whom [God]153-god has visited by a trial such as [yours]1742-you]1743-those whom god has visited by a trial such as yours can not be held guiltless of [their]1743-those whom god has visited by a trial such as yours enormities . Withdraw from [the world]2656-the world . Descend within [yourself]1742-you and abandon the vain thoughts of what [people]287-people call happiness . Be an example to [yourself]1742-you of the sinfulness of [our]1746-our nature and of the weakness of [our]1746-our humanity . [You]1742-you may have been possessed . What do [I]0-i know ? Perhaps it was permitted in order to lead [your]1742-you soul to saintliness through a life of seclusion and prayer . To that it would be [my]0-i duty to help [you]1742-you . Meantime [you]1742-you must pray to be given strength for a complete renunciation . " [Arlette]121-arlette , lowering [her]121-arlette eyes slowly , appealed to [the abb]3926-the abb as a symbolic figure of spiritual mystery . "[180-monsieur le cur] What can be [God]153-god 's designs on [this creature]1747-this creature ? " [he]180-monsieur le cur asked [himself]180-monsieur le cur . "[180-monsieur le cur] [Monsieur le Cur]180-monsieur le cur , " [she]121-arlette said quietly , "[180-monsieur le cur] [I]0-i felt the need to pray to - day for the first time in many years . When [I]0-i left [home]2668-home it was only to go to [[your]180-monsieur le cur church]1749-your church . " "[180-monsieur le cur] [The church]835-the church stands open to the worst of [sinners]1751-sinners , " said [the abb]3926-the abb . "[0-i] [I]0-i know . But [I]0-i would have had to pass before [all those villagers]1752-all those villagers : and [you]0-i , abb , know well what [they]1752-all those villagers are capable of . " "[0-i] Perhaps , " murmured [the abb]3926-the abb , "[0-i] it would be better not to put [their]1752-all those villagers charity to the test . " "[0-i] [I]0-i must pray before [I]0-i go back again . [I]0-i thought [you]0-i would let [me]0-i come in through [the sacristy]1753-the sacristy . " "[0-i] It would be inhuman to refuse [your]0-i request , " [he]3926-the abb said , rousing [himself]3926-the abb and taking down a key that hung on the wall . [He]3926-the abb put on [his]3926-the abb broad - brimmed hat and without a word led the way through the wicket gate and along the path which [he]3926-the abb always used [himself]3926-the abb and which was out of sight of [[the village]497-the village fountain]488-the village fountain . After [they]4050-they had entered [the damp and dilapidated sacristy]4051-the damp and dilapidated sacristy [he]3926-the abb locked the door behind [them]4050-they and only then opened another , a smaller one , leading into [the church]835-the church . When [he]3926-the abb stood aside , [Arlette]121-arlette became aware of the chilly odour as of freshly turned - up earth mingled with a faint scent of incense . In the deep dusk of [the nave]4053-the nave a single little flame glimmered before an image of [the virgin]4054-the virgin . [The abb]3926-the abb whispered as [she]121-arlette passed on : "[0-i] There before the great altar abase [yourself]0-i and pray for grace and strength and mercy in this world full of crimes against [God]153-god and [men]423-men . " [She]121-arlette did not look at [him]3926-the abb . Through the thin soles of [her]121-arlette shoes [she]121-arlette could feel the chill of the flagstones . [The abb]3926-the abb left the door ajar , sat down on a rush - bottomed chair , [the only one in [the sacristy]1753-the sacristy]4057-the only one in the sacristy , folded [his]3926-the abb arms and let [his]3926-the abb chin fall on [his]3926-the abb breast . [He]3926-the abb seemed to be sleeping profoundly , but at the end of half an hour [he]3926-the abb got up and , going to the doorway , stood looking at [the kneeling figure sunk low on the altar steps]4059-the kneeling figure sunk low on the altar steps . [Arlette]121-arlette 's face was buried in [her]121-arlette hands in a passion of piety and prayer . [The abb]3926-the abb waited patiently for a good many minutes more , before [he]3926-the abb raised [his]3926-the abb voice in a grave murmur which filled [the whole dark place]4061-the whole dark place . "[0-i] It is time for [you]1755-you to leave . [I]0-i am going to ring for vespers . " The view of [her]121-arlette complete absorption before the Most High had touched [him]3926-the abb . [He]3926-the abb stepped back into [the sacristy]1753-the sacristy and after a time heard the faintest possible swish of the black silk skirt of [the Escampobar daughter in [her]121-arlette Arlesian costume]4063-the escampobar daughter in her arlesian costume . [She]121-arlette entered [the sacristy]1753-the sacristy lightly with shining eyes , and [the abb]3926-the abb looked at [her]121-arlette with some emotion . "[0-i] [You]1755-you have prayed well , [[my]0-i daughter]1756-my daughter , " [he]0-i said . "[1755-you] No forgiveness will be refused to [you]1755-you , for [you]1755-you have suffered much . Put [your]1755-you trust in the grace of [God]153-god . " [She]121-arlette raised [her]121-arlette head and stayed [her]121-arlette footsteps for a moment . In the dark little place [he]0-i could see the gleam of [her]121-arlette eyes swimming in tears . "[153-god] Yes , [Monsieur l'Abb]1757-monsieur l'abb , " [she]121-arlette said in [her]121-arlette clear seductive voice . "[153-god] [I]0-i have prayed and [I]0-i feel answered . [I]0-i entreated [the merciful God]153-god to keep the heart of [the man]400-the man [I]0-i love always true to [me]0-i or else to let [me]0-i die before [I]0-i set [my]0-i eyes on [him]400-the man again . " [The abb]3926-the abb paled under [his]3926-the abb tan of [a village priest]4067-a village priest and leaned [his]3926-the abb shoulders against the wall without a word . After leaving [the church]835-the church by the sacristy door [Arlette]121-arlette never looked back . [The abb]3926-the abb saw [her]121-arlette flit past [the presbytery]3923-the presbytery , and [the building]297-the building hid [her]121-arlette from [his]3926-the abb sight . [He]3926-the abb did not accuse [her]121-arlette of duplicity . [He]3926-the abb had deceived [himself]3926-the abb . [A heathen]4072-a heathen . White as [her]121-arlette skin was , the blackness of [her]121-arlette hair and of [her]121-arlette eyes , the dusky red of [her]121-arlette lips , suggested a strain of Saracen blood . [He]3926-the abb gave [her]121-arlette up without a sigh . [Arlette]121-arlette walked rapidly towards [Escampobar]30-escampobar as if [she]121-arlette could not get [there]266-there soon enough ; but as [she]121-arlette neared [the first enclosed field]4074-the first enclosed field [her]121-arlette steps became slower and after hesitating awhile [she]121-arlette sat down between two olive trees , near a wall bordered by a growth of thin grass at the foot . "[0-i] And if [I]0-i have been possessed , " [she]121-arlette argued to [herself]121-arlette , "[3926-the abb] as [the abb]3926-the abb said , what is it to [me]0-i as [I]0-i am now ? That evil spirit cast [my]0-i true self out of [my]0-i body and then cast away the body too . For years [I]0-i have been living empty . There has been no meaning in anything . " But now [her]121-arlette true self had returned matured in its mysterious exile , hopeful and eager for love . [She]121-arlette was certain that it had never been far away from that outcast body which [Catherine]127-catherine had told [her]121-arlette lately was fit for [no man]502-no man 's arms . That was all [that old woman]4076-that old woman knew about it , thought [Arlette]121-arlette , not in scorn but rather in pity . [She]121-arlette knew better , [she]121-arlette had gone to [heaven]3897-heaven for truth in that long prostration with its ardent prayers and its moment of ecstasy before an unlighted altar . [She]121-arlette knew its meaning well , and also the meaning of another - of a terrestrial revelation which had come to [her]121-arlette that day at noon while [she]121-arlette waited on [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant . [Everybody else]4079-everybody else was in [the kitchen]645-the kitchen ; [she]121-arlette and [Ral]136-peyrol were as much alone together as had ever happened to [them]4081-them in [their]4081-them lives . That day [she]121-arlette could not deny [herself]121-arlette the delight to be near [him]136-peyrol , to watch [him]136-peyrol covertly , to hear [him]136-peyrol perhaps utter a few words , to experience that strange satisfying consciousness of [her]121-arlette own existence which nothing but [Ral]136-peyrol 's presence could give [her]121-arlette ; a sort of unimpassioned but all - absorbing bliss , warmth , courage , confidence ! . . . [She]121-arlette backed away from [Ral]136-peyrol 's table , seated [herself]121-arlette facing [him]136-peyrol and cast down [her]121-arlette eyes . There was a great stillness in [the salle]782-the salle except for the murmur of the voices in [the kitchen]645-the kitchen . [She]121-arlette had at first stolen a glance or two and then peeping again through [her]121-arlette eyelashes , as it were , [she]121-arlette saw [his]136-peyrol eyes rest on [her]121-arlette with a peculiar meaning . This had never happened before . [She]121-arlette jumped up , thinking that [he]136-peyrol wanted something , and while [she]121-arlette stood in front of [him]136-peyrol with [her]121-arlette hand resting on the table [he]136-peyrol stooped suddenly , pressed it to the table with [his]136-peyrol lips and began kissing it passionately without a sound , endlessly . . . . More startled than surprised at first , then infinitely happy , [she]121-arlette was beginning to breathe quickly , when [he]136-peyrol left off and threw [himself]136-peyrol back in the chair . [She]121-arlette walked away from the table and sat down again to gaze at [him]136-peyrol openly , steadily , without a smile . But [he]136-peyrol was not looking at [her]121-arlette . [His]136-peyrol passionate lips were set hard now and [his]136-peyrol face had an expression of stern despair . No word passed between [them]4084-them . Brusquely [he]136-peyrol got up with averted eyes and went outside , leaving the food before [him]136-peyrol unfinished . In the usual course of things , on any other day , [she]121-arlette would have got up and followed [him]136-peyrol , for [she]121-arlette had always yielded to the fascination that had first roused [her]121-arlette faculties . [She]121-arlette would have gone out just to pass in front of [him]136-peyrol once or twice . But this time [she]121-arlette had not obeyed what was stronger than fascination , something within [herself]121-arlette which at the same time prompted and restrained [her]121-arlette . [She]121-arlette only raised [her]121-arlette arm and looked at [her]121-arlette hand . It was true . It had happened . [He]136-peyrol had kissed it . Formerly [she]121-arlette cared not how gloomy [he]136-peyrol was as long as [he]136-peyrol remained somewhere where [she]121-arlette could look at [him]136-peyrol - which [she]121-arlette would do at every opportunity with an open and unbridled innocence . But now [she]121-arlette knew better than to do that . [She]121-arlette had got up , had passed through [the kitchen]645-the kitchen , meeting without embarrassment [Catherine]127-catherine 's inquisitive glance , and had gone [upstairs]411-upstairs . When [she]121-arlette came down after a time , [he]136-peyrol was nowhere to be seen , and [everybody else]4079-everybody else too seemed to have gone into hiding ; [Michel]150-michel , [Peyrol]136-peyrol , [Scevola]123-scevola . . . But if [she]121-arlette had met [Scevola]123-scevola [she]121-arlette would not have spoken to [him]123-scevola . It was now a very long time since [she]121-arlette had volunteered a conversation with [Scevola]123-scevola . [She]121-arlette guessed , however , that [Scevola]123-scevola had simply gone to lie down in [[his]123-scevola lair]4088-his lair , [a narrow shabby room lighted by one glazed little window high up in the end wall]4089-a narrow shabby room lighted by one glazed little window high up in the end wall . [Catherine]127-catherine had put [him]136-peyrol in [there]266-there on the very day [he]136-peyrol had brought [[her]127-catherine niece]3379-her niece [home]2668-home and [he]136-peyrol had retained it for [his]136-peyrol own ever since . [She]121-arlette could even picture [him]136-peyrol to [herself]121-arlette in there stretched on [his]136-peyrol pallet . [She]121-arlette was capable of that now . Formerly , for years after [her]121-arlette return , [people that were out of [her]121-arlette sight]4093-people that were out of her sight were out of [her]121-arlette mind also . Had [they]4093-people that were out of her sight run away and left [her]121-arlette [she]121-arlette would not have thought of [them]4093-people that were out of her sight at all . [She]121-arlette would have wandered in and out of [the empty house]4094-the empty house and round [the empty fields]4095-the empty fields without giving [anybody]1371-anybody a thought . [Peyrol]136-peyrol was [the first human being [she]121-arlette had noticed for years]4097-the first human being she had noticed for years . [Peyrol]136-peyrol , since [he]136-peyrol had come , had always existed for [her]121-arlette . And as a matter of fact the rover was generally very much in evidence about [the farm]2746-the farm . That afternoon , however , even [Peyrol]136-peyrol was not to be seen . [Her]121-arlette uneasiness began to grow , but [she]121-arlette felt a strange reluctance to go into [the kitchen]645-the kitchen where [she]121-arlette knew [[her]121-arlette aunt]3529-her aunt would be sitting in the armchair like [a presiding genius of [the house]2684-the house]4101-a presiding genius of the house taking its rest , and unreadable in [her]3529-her aunt immobility . And yet [she]121-arlette felt [she]121-arlette must talk about [Ral]136-peyrol to [somebody]876-somebody . This was how the idea of going down to [the church]835-the church had come to [her]121-arlette . [She]121-arlette would talk of [him]136-peyrol to [the priest]852-the priest and to [God]153-god . The force of old associations asserted itself . [She]121-arlette had been taught to believe that [one]2670-one could tell everything to [a priest]2731-a priest , and that [the omnipotent God who know everything could be prayed to]4108-the omnipotent god who know everything could be prayed to , asked for grace , for strength , for mercy , for protection , for pity . [She]121-arlette had done it and felt [she]121-arlette had been heard . [Her]121-arlette heart had quietened down while [she]121-arlette rested under the wall . Pulling out a long stalk of grass [she]121-arlette twined it round [her]121-arlette fingers absently . The veil of cloud had thickened over [her]121-arlette head , early dusk had descended upon [the earth]723-the earth , and [she]121-arlette had not found out what had become of [Ral]136-peyrol . [She]121-arlette jumped to [her]121-arlette feet wildly . But directly [she]121-arlette had done that [she]121-arlette felt the need of self - control . It was with [her]121-arlette usual light step that [she]121-arlette approached the front of [the house]2684-the house and for the first time in [her]121-arlette life perceived how barren and sombre it looked when [Ral]136-peyrol was not about . [She]121-arlette slipped in quietly through the door of [the main building]4111-the main building and ran [upstairs]411-upstairs . It was dark on [the landing]4113-the landing . [She]121-arlette passed by the door leading into [the room occupied by [[her]121-arlette aunt]3529-her aunt and [herself]121-arlette]4114-the room occupied by her aunt and herself . It had been [[her]121-arlette father]2840-her father and [[mother]1316-mother 's bedroom]4118-mother 's bedroom . [The other big room]4119-the other big room was [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant 's during [his]2881-the lieutenant visits to [Escampobar]30-escampobar . Without even a rustle of [her]121-arlette dress , like a shadow , [she]121-arlette glided along [the passage]1156-the passage , turned the handle without noise and went in . After shutting the door behind [her]121-arlette [she]121-arlette listened . There was no sound in [the house]2684-the house . [Scevola]123-scevola was either already down in [the yard]553-the yard or still lying open - eyed on [his]123-scevola tumbled pallet in raging sulks about something . [She]121-arlette had once accidentally caught , [him]123-scevola at it , down on [his]123-scevola face , one eye and cheek of which were buried in the pillow , the other eye glaring savagely , and had been scared away by a thick mutter : "[3926-the abb] Keep off . Do n't approach [me]0-i . " And all this had meant nothing to [her]121-arlette then . Having ascertained that the inside of [the house]2684-the house was as still as [the grave]4125-the grave , [Arlette]121-arlette walked across to the window , which when [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant was occupying [the room]413-the room stood always open and with the shutter pushed right back against the wall . [It]4128-it was of course uncurtained , and as [she]121-arlette came near to [it]4128-it [Arlette]121-arlette caught sight of [Peyrol]136-peyrol coming down [the hill]694-the hill on [his]136-peyrol return from the lookout . [His]136-peyrol white head gleamed like silver against the slope of the ground and by and by passed out of [her]121-arlette sight , while [her]121-arlette ear caught the sound of [his]136-peyrol footsteps below the window . [They]4130-they passed into [the house]2684-the house , but [she]121-arlette did not hear [him]136-peyrol come [upstairs]411-upstairs . [He]136-peyrol had gone into [the kitchen]645-the kitchen . To [Catherine]127-catherine . [They]4130-they would talk about [her]127-catherine and [Eugne]174-eugne . But what would [they]4130-they say ? [She]121-arlette was so new to life that everything appeared dangerous : talk , attitudes , glances . [She]121-arlette felt frightened at the mere idea of silence between those two . It was possible . Suppose [they]4130-they did n't say anything to [each other]2919-each other . That would be awful . Yet [she]121-arlette remained calm like [a sensible person , who knows that rushing about in excitement]4135-a sensible person , who knows that rushing about in excitement is not the way to meet unknown dangers . [She]121-arlette swept [her]121-arlette eyes over [the room]413-the room and saw [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant 's valise in a corner . That was really what [she]121-arlette had wanted to see . [He]136-peyrol was n't gone then . But it did n't tell [her]121-arlette , though [she]121-arlette opened it , what had become of [him]136-peyrol . As to [his]136-peyrol return , [she]121-arlette had no doubt whatever about that . [He]136-peyrol had always returned . [She]121-arlette noticed particularly a large packet sewn up in sail - cloth and with three large red seals on the seam . It did n't , however , arrest [her]121-arlette thoughts . Those were still hovering about [Catherine]127-catherine and [Peyrol]136-peyrol [downstairs]772-downstairs . How changed they were . Had [they]4139-they ever thought that [she]121-arlette was mad ? [She]121-arlette became indignant . "[3926-the abb] How could [I]0-i have prevented that ? " [she]121-arlette asked [herself]121-arlette with despair . [She]121-arlette sat down on the edge of the bed in [her]121-arlette usual attitude , [her]121-arlette feet crossed , [her]121-arlette hands lying in [her]121-arlette lap . [She]121-arlette felt on one of them the impress off [Ral]136-peyrol 's lips , soothing , reassuring like every certitude , but [she]121-arlette was aware of a still remaining confusion in [her]121-arlette mind , an indefinite weariness like the strain of an imperfect vision trying to discern shifting outlines , floating shapes , incomprehensible signs . [She]121-arlette could not resist the temptation of resting [her]121-arlette tired body , just for a little while . [She]121-arlette lay down on the very edge of the bed , the kissed hand tucked under [her]121-arlette cheek . The faculty of thinking abandoned [her]121-arlette altogether , but [she]121-arlette remained open - eyed , wide awake . In that position , without hearing the slightest sound , [she]121-arlette saw the door handle move down as far as it would go , perfectly noiseless , as though the lock had been oiled not long before . [Her]121-arlette impulse was to leap right out into the middle of [the room]413-the room , but [she]121-arlette restrained [herself]121-arlette and only swung [herself]121-arlette into a sitting posture . The bed had not creaked . [She]121-arlette lowered [her]121-arlette feet gently to the ground , and by the time when holding [her]121-arlette breath [she]121-arlette put [her]121-arlette ear against the door , the handle had come back into position . [She]121-arlette had detected no sound outside . Not the faintest . Nothing . It never occurred to [her]121-arlette to doubt [her]121-arlette own eyes , but the whole thing had been so noiseless that it could not have disturbed the lightest sleeper . [She]121-arlette was sure that had [she]121-arlette been lying on [her]121-arlette other side , that is with [her]121-arlette back to the door , [she]121-arlette would have known nothing . It was some time before [she]121-arlette walked away from the door and sat on a chair which stood near a heavy and much - carved table , an heirloom more appropriate to a chteau than to [a farmhouse]4141-a farmhouse . The dust of many months covered [its]413-the room smooth oval surface of dark , finely grained wood . "[0-i] It must have been [Scevola]123-scevola , " thought [Arlette]121-arlette . It could have been [no one else]4142-no one else . What could [he]123-scevola have wanted ? [She]121-arlette gave [herself]121-arlette up to thought , but really [she]121-arlette did not care . [The absent Ral]136-peyrol occupied all [her]121-arlette mind . With an unconscious slowness [her]121-arlette finger traced in the dust on the table the initials E A and achieved a circle round them . Then [she]121-arlette jumped up , unlocked the door and went [downstairs]772-downstairs . In [the kitchen]645-the kitchen , as [she]121-arlette fully expected , [she]121-arlette found [Scevola]123-scevola with [the others]3246-the others . Directly [she]121-arlette appeared [he]123-scevola got up and ran [upstairs]411-upstairs , but returned almost immediately looking as if [he]123-scevola had seen a ghost , and when [Peyrol]136-peyrol asked [him]123-scevola some insignificant question [his]123-scevola lips and even [his]123-scevola chin trembled before [he]123-scevola could command [his]123-scevola voice . [He]123-scevola avoided looking [anybody]1371-anybody in the face . [The others]3246-the others too seemed shy of meeting [each other]2919-each other 's eyes , and the evening meal of [the Escampobar]30-escampobar seemed haunted by [the absent lieutenant]4150-the absent lieutenant . [Peyrol]136-peyrol , besides , had [[his]136-peyrol prisoner]1543-his prisoner to think of . [His]136-peyrol existence presented a most interesting problem , and the proceedings of [the English ship]3188-the english ship were another , closely connected with it and full of dangerous possibilities . [Catherine]127-catherine 's black and ungleaming eyes seemed to have sunk deeper in their sockets , but [her]127-catherine face wore its habitual severe aloofness of expression . Suddenly [Scevola]123-scevola spoke as if in answer to some thought of [his]123-scevola own . "[123-scevola] What has lost [us]1760-us was moderation . " [Peyrol]136-peyrol swallowed the piece of bread and butter which [he]136-peyrol had been masticating slowly , and asked : "[1761-you] What are [you]1761-you alluding to , citoyen ? [[We]1760-us patriots]1763-we patriots held [our]1760-us hand too soon . [All the children of [the ci - devants]616-the ci - devants]1764-all the children of the ci - devants and all [the children of traitors]1766-the children of traitors should have been killed together with [[their]1764-all the children of the ci - devants fathers]1767-their fathers and [mothers]1768-mothers . [He]123-scevola heard that [patriots]2790-patriots were being hunted down , here and there , and [he]123-scevola was growing quieter every day . [You]136-peyrol roused [the child]1284-the child wonderfully . "[127-catherine] " And did that please [Scevola]123-scevola too ? "[127-catherine] " Before [you]136-peyrol came [she]1779-her never spoke to [anybody]1371-anybody unless first spoken to . [She]1779-her did n't seem to care where [she]1779-her was . At the same time , "[127-catherine] added [Catherine]127-catherine after a pause , ' [she]1779-her did n't care what happened to [her]1779-her either . Oh , [I]0-i have had some heavy hours thinking it all over , in the daytime doing [my]0-i work , and at night while [I]0-i lay awake , listening to [her]1779-her breathing . And [I]0-i growing older all the time , and , who knows , with [my]0-i last hour ready to strike . So [one]2670-one must have a sign ? What sort of sign would it be ? " "[1824-even those to whom it is made] How is [anybody]1371-anybody to know ? " [Peyrol]136-peyrol folded [his]136-peyrol arms on [his]136-peyrol breast and dropped [his]136-peyrol head . Melancholy was a sentiment to which [he]136-peyrol was [a stranger]4178-a stranger ; for what has melancholy to do with the life of [a sea - rover]4179-a sea - rover , [a Brother of [the Coast]10-the coast]440-a brother of the coast , [a simple , venturesome , precarious life , full of risks and leaving no time for introspection]4181-a simple , venturesome , precarious life , full of risks and leaving no time for introspection or for that momentary self - forgetfulness which is called gaiety . Sombre fury , fierce merriment , [he]136-peyrol had known in passing gusts , coming from outside ; but never this intimate inward sense of the vanity of all things , that doubt of the power within [himself]136-peyrol . "[0-i] [I]0-i wonder what the sign for [me]0-i will be , " [he]136-peyrol thought ; and concluded with self - contempt that for [him]136-peyrol there would be no sign , that [he]136-peyrol would have to die in [[his]136-peyrol bed]4182-his bed like an old yard dog in [[his]136-peyrol kennel]4183-his kennel . Having reached that depth of despondency , there was nothing more before [him]136-peyrol but a black gulf into which [his]136-peyrol consciousness sank like a stone . The silence which had lasted perhaps a minute after [Catherine]127-catherine had finished speaking was traversed suddenly by a clear high voice saying : "[0-i] What are [you]1830-her two plotting here ? " [Arlette]121-arlette stood in the doorway of [the salle]782-the salle . The gleam of light in the whites of [her]127-catherine eyes set off [her]127-catherine black and penetrating glance . The surprise was complete . The profile of [Catherine]127-catherine , who was standing by the table , became if possible harder ; a sharp carving of [an old prophetess of some desert tribe]4185-an old prophetess of some desert tribe . [Arlette]121-arlette made three steps forward . In [Peyrol]136-peyrol even extreme astonishment was deliberate . [He]136-peyrol had been famous for never looking as though [he]136-peyrol had been caught unprepared . [Age]183-age had accentuated that trait of [a born leader]4186-a born leader . [He]136-peyrol only slipped off the edge of the table and said in [his]136-peyrol deep voice : "[1830-her] Why , [patronne]1831-patronne ! [We]1830-her have n't said a word to [each other]2919-each other for ever so long . " [Arlette]121-arlette moved nearer still . "[0-i] [I]0-i know , " [she]121-arlette cried . "[0-i] It was horrible . [I]0-i have been watching [[you]1830-her two]1833-you two . [Scevola]123-scevola came and dumped [himself]123-scevola on the bench close to [me]0-i . [He]123-scevola began to talk to [me]0-i , and so [I]0-i went away . [That man]495-that man bores [me]0-i . And here [I]0-i find [[you]1830-her people]1311-you people saying nothing . It 's insupportable . What has come to [you]1830-her both ? Say , [you]1830-her , [Papa Peyrol]184-papa peyrol - do n't [you]1830-her like [me]0-i any more ? " [Her]1830-her voice filled [the kitchen]645-the kitchen . [Peyrol]184-papa peyrol went to the salle door and shut it . While coming back [he]0-i was staggered by the brilliance of life within [her]1830-her that seemed to pale the flames of the lamp . [He]0-i said half in jest : "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't know whether [I]0-i did n't like [you]1830-her better when [you]1830-her were quieter . " "[1830-her] And [you]1830-her would like best to see [me]0-i still quieter in [my]0-i grave . " [She]1830-her dazzled [him]0-i . Vitality streamed out of [her]1830-her eyes , [her]1830-her lips , [[her]1830-her whole person]4188-her whole person , enveloped [her]1830-her like a halo and . . . yes , truly , the faintest possible flush had appeared on [her]1830-her cheeks , played on them faintly rosy like the light of a distant flame on the snow . [She]1830-her raised [her]1830-her arms up in the air and let [her]1830-her hands fall from on high on [Peyrol]184-papa peyrol 's shoulders , captured [his]0-i desperately dodging eyes with [her]1830-her black and compelling glance , put out all [her]1830-her instinctive seduction - while [he]0-i felt a growing fierceness in the grip of [her]1830-her fingers . "[1830-her] No ! [I]0-i ca n't hold it in ! [Monsieur Peyrol]128-peyrol , [Papa Peyrol]184-papa peyrol , [old gunner]1836-old gunner , [you]0-i horrid sea - wolf , be [an angel]1837-an angel and tell [me]0-i where [he]128-peyrol is . " [The rover]822-the rover , whom only that morning the powerful grasp of [Lieutenant Ral]136-peyrol found as unshakable as a rock , felt all [his]0-i strength vanish under the hands of [that woman]1461-that woman . [He]0-i said thickly : "[128-peyrol] [He]128-peyrol has gone to [Toulon]1-toulon . [He]128-peyrol had to go . " "[128-peyrol] What for ? Speak the truth to [me]0-i ! " [she]1461-that woman repeated . "[128-peyrol] What service ? " [Her]1461-that woman voice sank and the words "[128-peyrol] Oh , yes ! [His]128-peyrol service " were hardly heard by [Peyrol]136-peyrol , who as soon as [her]1461-that woman hands had left [his]136-peyrol shoulders felt [his]136-peyrol strength returning to [him]136-peyrol and the yielding earth grow firm again under [his]136-peyrol feet . Right in front of [him]136-peyrol [Arlette]121-arlette , silent , with [her]1461-that woman arms hanging down before [her]1461-that woman with entwined fingers , seemed stunned because [Lieutenant Ral]136-peyrol was not free from all earthly connections , like [a visiting angel from heaven depending only on God to whom [she]1461-that woman had prayed]4191-a visiting angel from heaven depending only on god to whom she had prayed . [She]1461-that woman had to share [him]136-peyrol with some service that could order [him]136-peyrol about . "[136-peyrol] [Peyrol]136-peyrol , " [she]1461-that woman cried low , "[136-peyrol] do n't break [my]0-i heart , [my]0-i new heart , that has just begun to beat . Feel how it beats . Who could bear it ? " [She]1461-that woman seized [the rover]822-the rover 's thick hairy paw and pressed it hard against [her]1461-that woman breast . "[1831-patronne] Tell [me]0-i when [he]136-peyrol will be back . " "[1831-patronne] Listen , [patronne]1831-patronne , [you]1831-patronne had better go [upstairs]411-upstairs , " began [Peyrol]136-peyrol with a great effort and snatching [his]136-peyrol captured hand away . [He]136-peyrol staggered backwards a little while [Arlette]121-arlette shouted at [him]136-peyrol : "[136-peyrol] [You]136-peyrol ca n't order [me]0-i about as [you]136-peyrol used to do . " In all the changes from entreaty to anger [she]121-arlette never struck a false note , so that [her]121-arlette emotional outburst had the heart - moving power of inspired art . [She]121-arlette turned round with a tempestuous swish to [Catherine]127-catherine who had neither stirred nor emitted a sound : "[136-peyrol] Nothing [you]1841-you two can do will make any difference now . " The next moment [she]121-arlette was facing [Peyrol]136-peyrol again . "[136-peyrol] [You]136-peyrol frighten [me]0-i with [your]136-peyrol white hairs . Come ! . . . am [I]0-i to go on [my]0-i knees to [you]136-peyrol ? . . . There ! " [The rover]822-the rover caught [her]121-arlette under the elbows , swung [her]121-arlette up clear of the ground , and set [her]121-arlette down on [her]121-arlette feet as if [she]121-arlette had been [a child]2774-a child . Directly [he]136-peyrol had let [her]121-arlette go , [she]121-arlette stamped [her]121-arlette foot at [him]136-peyrol . "[136-peyrol] Are [you]136-peyrol stupid ? " [she]121-arlette cried . "[136-peyrol] Do n't [you]136-peyrol understand that something has happened to - day ? " Through all this scene [Peyrol]136-peyrol had kept [his]136-peyrol head as creditably as could have been expected , in the manner of [a seaman caught by a white squall in the tropics]4195-a seaman caught by a white squall in the tropics . But at those words a dozen thoughts tried to rush together through [his]136-peyrol mind , in chase of that startling declaration . Something had happened ! Where ? How ? Whom to ? What thing ? It could n't be anything between [her]121-arlette and [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant . [He]136-peyrol had , it seemed to [him]136-peyrol , never lost sight of [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant from the first hour when [they]4198-they met in the morning till [he]136-peyrol had sent [him]2881-the lieutenant off to [Toulon]1-toulon by an actual push on the shoulder ; except while [he]136-peyrol was having [his]136-peyrol dinner in [the next room]4199-the next room with the door open , and for the few minutes spent in talking with [Michel]150-michel in [the yard]553-the yard . But that was only a very few minutes , and directly afterwards the first sight of [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant sitting gloomily on the bench like a lonely crow did not suggest either elation or excitement or any emotion connected with [a woman]2780-a woman . In the face of these difficulties [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's mind became suddenly a blank . "[136-peyrol] [Voyons]185-voyons , [patronne]1831-patronne , " [he]136-peyrol began , unable to think of anything else to say . "[1831-patronne] What 's all this fuss about ? [I]0-i expect [him]1843-him to be back [here]2715-here about midnight . " [He]136-peyrol was extremely relieved to notice that [she]1831-patronne believed [him]136-peyrol . It was the truth . For indeed [he]136-peyrol did not know what [he]136-peyrol could have invented on the spur of the moment that would get [her]1831-patronne out of the way and induce [her]1831-patronne to go to bed . [She]1831-patronne treated [him]136-peyrol to a sinister frown and a terribly menacing , "[0-i] If [you]0-i have lied . . . Oh ! " [He]136-peyrol produced an indulgent smile . "[1831-patronne] Compose [yourself]1831-patronne . [He]1843-him will be here soon after midnight . [You]1831-patronne may go to sleep with an easy mind . " [She]1831-patronne turned [her]1831-patronne back on [him]136-peyrol contemptuously , and said curtly , "[1831-patronne] Come along , [aunt]1845-aunt , " and went to the door leading to [the passage]1156-the passage . There [she]1831-patronne turned for a moment with [her]1831-patronne hand on the door handle . "[1845-aunt] [You]0-i are changed . [I]0-i ca n't trust either of [you]0-i . [You]0-i are not [the same people]3008-the same people . " [She]1831-patronne went out . Only then did [Catherine]127-catherine detach [her]1831-patronne gaze from the wall to meet [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's eyes . "[1847-she] Did [you]0-i hear what [she]1847-she said ? [We]1848-we ! Changed ! It is [she]1847-she [herself]1847-she . . . " [Peyrol]136-peyrol nodded twice and there was a long pause , during which even the flames of the lamp did not stir . "[1847-she] Go after [her]1847-she , [Mademoiselle Catherine]127-catherine , " [he]136-peyrol said at last with a shade of sympathy in [his]136-peyrol tone . [She]1847-she did not move . "[127-catherine] Allons - du courage , " [he]136-peyrol urged [her]1847-she deferentially as it were . "[127-catherine] Try to put [her]1847-she to sleep . " Upright and deliberate , [Catherine]127-catherine left [the kitchen]645-the kitchen , and in the passage outside found [Arlette]121-arlette waiting for [her]127-catherine with a lighted candle in [her]121-arlette hand . [Her]127-catherine heart was filled with sudden desolation by the beauty of that young face enhaloed in the patch of light , with the profound darkness as of a dungeon for a background . At once [[her]127-catherine niece]3379-her niece led the way [upstairs]411-upstairs muttering savagely through [her]3379-her niece pretty teeth : "[1849-he] [He]1849-he thinks [I]0-i could go to sleep . [Old imbecile]1850-old imbecile ! " [Peyrol]136-peyrol did not take [his]136-peyrol eyes off [Catherine]127-catherine 's straight back till the door had closed after [her]127-catherine . Only then [he]136-peyrol relieved [himself]136-peyrol by letting the air escape through [his]136-peyrol pursed lips and rolling [his]136-peyrol eyes freely about . [He]136-peyrol picked up the lamp by the ring on the top of the central rod and went into [the salle]782-the salle , closing behind [him]136-peyrol the door of [the dark kitchen]4208-the dark kitchen . [He]136-peyrol stood the lamp on the very table on which [Lieutenant Ral]136-peyrol had had [his]136-peyrol midday meal . A small white cloth was still spread on it and there was [his]1852-he chair askew as [he]1852-he had pushed it back when [he]1852-he got up . Another of the many chairs in [the salle]782-the salle was turned round conspicuously to face the table . These things made [Peyrol]136-peyrol remark to [himself]136-peyrol bitterly : "[1851-she] [She]1851-she sat and stared at [him]1852-he as if [he]1852-he had been gilt all over , with three heads and seven arms on [his]1852-he body " - a comparison reminiscent of certain idols [he]136-peyrol had seen in [an Indian temple]4210-an indian temple . Though not an iconoclast , [Peyrol]136-peyrol felt positively sick at the recollection , and hastened to step outside . The great cloud had broken up and the mighty fragments were moving to the westward in stately flight before the rising moon . [Scevola]123-scevola , who had been lying extended full length on the bench , swung [himself]123-scevola up suddenly , very upright . "[1851-she] Had a little nap in the open ? " asked [Peyrol]136-peyrol , letting [his]136-peyrol eyes roam through the luminous space under the departing rearguard of the clouds jostling [each other]2919-each other up there . "[1851-she] [I]0-i did not sleep , " said [the sans - culotte]571-the sans - culotte . "[0-i] [I]0-i have n't closed [my]0-i eyes - not for one moment . " "[0-i] That must be because [you]0-i were n't sleepy , " suggested the deliberate [Peyrol]136-peyrol , whose thoughts were far away with [the English ship]3188-the english ship . [His]136-peyrol mental eye contemplated [her]571-the sans - culotte black image against [the white beach of [the Salins]24-the salins]4214-the white beach of the salins describing a sparkling curve under the moon , and meantime [he]136-peyrol went on slowly : "[0-i] For it could not have been noise that kept [you]0-i awake . " On the level of [Escampobar]30-escampobar the shadows lay long on the ground while the side of [the lookout hill]4215-the lookout hill remained yet black but edged with an increasing brightness . And the amenity of the stillness was such that if softened for a moment [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's hard inward attitude towards [all mankind]3905-all mankind , including even [the captain of [the English ship]3188-the english ship]4217-the captain of the english ship . [The old rover]790-the old rover savoured a moment of serenity in the midst of [his]790-the old rover cares . "[1851-she] This is [an accursed spot]1853-an accursed spot , " declared [Scevola]123-scevola suddenly . [Peyrol]136-peyrol , without turning [his]136-peyrol head , looked at [him]123-scevola sideways . Though [he]136-peyrol had sprung up from [his]136-peyrol reclining posture smartly enough , [the citizen]1232-the citizen had gone slack all over and was sitting all in a heap . [His]136-peyrol shoulders were hunched up , [his]136-peyrol hands reposed on [his]136-peyrol knees . With [his]136-peyrol staring eyes [he]136-peyrol resembled [a sick child in the moonlight]4221-a sick child in the moonlight . "[1851-she] It 's the very spot for hatching treacheries . One feels steeped in them up to the neck . " [He]136-peyrol shuddered and yawned a long irresistible nervous yawn with the gleam of unexpected long canines in a retracted , gaping mouth giving away the restless panther lurking in [the man]400-the man . "[2654-citoyen] Oh , yes , there 's treachery about right enough . [You]1854-you could n't conceive that , [citoyen]2654-citoyen ? " "[1854-you] Of course [I]0-i could n't , " assented [Peyrol]136-peyrol with serene contempt . "[0-i] What is this treachery that [you]1854-you are concocting ? " [he]136-peyrol added carelessly , in a social way , while enjoying the charm of a moonlit evening . [Scevola]123-scevola , who did not expect that turn , managed , however , to produce a rattling sort of laugh almost at once . "[1854-you] That 's a good one . Ha ! ha ! ha ! . . . [Me]0-i ! . . . concocting ! . . . Why [me]0-i ? " "[0-i] Well , " said [Peyrol]136-peyrol carelessly , "[0-i] there are not many of [us]1856-us to carry out treacheries about [here]2715-here . [The women]1227-the women are gone [upstairs]411-upstairs ; [Michel]150-michel is down at [the tartane]350-the tartane . There 's [me]0-i , and [you]1854-you would not dare suspect [me]0-i of treachery . Well , there remains only [you]1854-you . " [Scevola]123-scevola roused [himself]123-scevola . "[1854-you] This is not much of a jest , " [he]123-scevola said . "[1854-you] [I]0-i have been [a treason - hunter]1861-a treason - hunter . [I]0-i . . . " [He]123-scevola checked that strain . [He]123-scevola was full of purely emotional suspicions . [Peyrol]136-peyrol was talking like this only to annoy [him]123-scevola and to get [him]123-scevola out of the way ; but in the particular state of [his]123-scevola feelings [Scevola]123-scevola was acutely aware of every syllable of these offensive remarks . "[0-i] Aha , " [he]123-scevola thought to [himself]123-scevola , "[0-i] [he]0-i does n't mention [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant . " This omission seemed to the patriot of immense importance . If [Peyrol]136-peyrol had not mentioned [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant it was because [those two]4224-those two had been plotting some treachery together , all the afternoon on board [that tartane]4225-that tartane . That 's why nothing had been seen of [them]4224-those two for the best part of the day . As a matter of fact , [Scevola]123-scevola too had observed [Peyrol]136-peyrol returning to [the farm]2746-the farm in the evening , only [he]123-scevola had observed [him]136-peyrol from another window than [Arlette]121-arlette . This was a few minutes before [his]123-scevola attempt to open [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant 's door , in order to find out whether [Ral]136-peyrol was in [[his]123-scevola room]3498-his room . [He]123-scevola had tiptoed away , uncertain , and going into [the kitchen]645-the kitchen had found only [Catherine]127-catherine and [Peyrol]136-peyrol there . [Directly Arlette]121-arlette joined [them]4224-those two a sudden inspiration made [him]123-scevola run [upstairs]411-upstairs and try the door again . It was open now ! A clear proof that it was [Arlette]121-arlette who had been locked up in [there]266-there . The discovery that [she]121-arlette made [herself]121-arlette at [home]2668-home like this in [[the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant 's room]1647-the lieutenant 's room gave [Scevola]123-scevola such a sickening shock that [he]123-scevola thought [he]123-scevola would die of it . It was beyond doubt now that [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant had been conspiring with [Peyrol]136-peyrol down on board [that tartane]4225-that tartane ; for what else could [they]4224-those two have been doing [there]266-there ? "[0-i] But why had not [Ral]136-peyrol come up in the evening with [Peyrol]136-peyrol ? " [Scevola]123-scevola asked [himself]123-scevola , sitting on the bench with [his]123-scevola hands clasped between [his]123-scevola knees . . . . It 's [their]4224-those two cunning , "[1863-he] [he]1863-he concluded suddenly . " [Conspirators]4238-conspirators always avoid being seen together . Ha ! "[1863-he] It was as if [somebody]876-somebody had let off a lot of fireworks in [his]1863-he brain . [He]1863-he was illuminated , dazzled , confused , with a hissing in [his]1863-he cars and showers of sparks before alone . [Peyrol]136-peyrol had vanished . [Scevola]123-scevola seemed to remember that [he]123-scevola had heard [somebody]876-somebody pronounce the word " good - night "[876-somebody] and the door of [the salle]782-the salle slam . And sure enough the door of [the salle]782-the salle was shut now . A dim light shone in the window that was next to [it]782-the salle . [Peyrol]136-peyrol had extinguished three of the lamp flames and was now reclining on one of the long tables with that faculty of accommodating [himself]136-peyrol to a plank an old sea - dog never loses . [He]136-peyrol had decided to remain below simply to be handy , and [he]136-peyrol did n't lie down on one of the benches along the wall because they were too narrow . [He]136-peyrol left one wick burning , so that [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant should know where to look for [him]136-peyrol , and [he]136-peyrol was tired enough to think that [he]136-peyrol would snatch a couple of hours ' sleep before [Ral]136-peyrol could return from [Toulon]1-toulon . [He]136-peyrol settled [himself]136-peyrol with one arm under [his]136-peyrol head as if [he]136-peyrol were on the deck of [a privateer]1869-a privateer , and it never occurred to [him]136-peyrol that [Scevola]123-scevola was looking through the panes ; but they were so small and dusty that [the patriot]701-the patriot could see nothing . [His]136-peyrol movement had been purely instinctive . [He]136-peyrol was n't even aware that [he]136-peyrol had looked in . [He]136-peyrol went away from there , walked to the end of [the building]297-the building , spun round and walked back again to the other end ; and it was as if [he]136-peyrol had been afraid of going beyond the wall against which [he]136-peyrol reeled sometimes . " Conspiracy , conspiracy , "[136-peyrol] [he]136-peyrol thought . [He]136-peyrol was now absolutely certain that [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant was still hiding in that tartane , and was only waiting till all was quiet to sneak back to [[his]136-peyrol room]3498-his room in which [Scevola]123-scevola had proof positive that [Arlette]121-arlette was in the habit of making [herself]121-arlette at [home]2668-home . To rob [him]136-peyrol of [his]136-peyrol right to [Arlette]121-arlette was part of the conspiracy no doubt . " Have [I]136-peyrol been [a slave to [those two women]4240-those two women]4239-a slave to those two women , have [I]136-peyrol waited all those years , only to see [that corrupt creature]4241-that corrupt creature go off infamously with [a ci - devant]4242-a ci - devant , with [a conspiring aristocrat]4243-a conspiring aristocrat ? "[136-peyrol] [He]136-peyrol became giddy with virtuous fury . There was enough evidence there for any revolutionary tribunal to cut all [their]1875-they heads off . Tribunal ! There was [no tribunal]1876-no tribunal ! No revolutionary justice ! [No patriots]1877-no patriots ! [He]136-peyrol hit [his]136-peyrol shoulder against the wall in [his]136-peyrol distress with such force that [he]136-peyrol rebounded . [This world]1878-this world was [no place for [patriots]2790-patriots]1879-no place for patriots . " If [I]136-peyrol had betrayed [myself]136-peyrol in [the kitchen]645-the kitchen [they]1875-they would have murdered [me]136-peyrol in there . "[136-peyrol] As it was [he]136-peyrol thought that [he]136-peyrol had said too much . Too much . " [Prudence]187-prudence ! Caution ! "[136-peyrol] [he]136-peyrol repeated to [himself]136-peyrol , gesticulating with both arms . Suddenly [he]136-peyrol stumbled and there was an amazing metallic clatter made by something that fell at [his]136-peyrol feet . " [They]1875-they are trying to kill [me]136-peyrol now , "[136-peyrol] [he]136-peyrol thought , shaking with fright . [He]136-peyrol gave [himself]136-peyrol up for dead . Profound silence reigned all round . Nothing more happened . [He]136-peyrol stooped fearfully to look and recognized [his]136-peyrol own stable fork lying on the ground . [He]136-peyrol remembered [he]136-peyrol had left it at noon leaning against the wall . [His]136-peyrol own foot had made it fall . [He]136-peyrol threw [himself]136-peyrol upon it greedily . " Here 's what [I]136-peyrol need , "[136-peyrol] [he]136-peyrol muttered feverishly . " [I]136-peyrol suppose that by now [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant would think [I]136-peyrol am gone to bed . "[136-peyrol] [He]136-peyrol flattened [himself]136-peyrol upright against the wall with the fork held along [his]136-peyrol body like a grounded musket . The moon clearing [the hill - top]1881-the hill - top flooded suddenly the front of [the house]2684-the house with its cold light , but [he]136-peyrol did n't know it ; [he]136-peyrol imagined [himself]136-peyrol still to be ambushed in the shadow and remained motionless , glaring at the path leading towards [the cove]3161-the cove . [His]136-peyrol teeth chattered with savage impatience . [He]136-peyrol was so plainly visible in [his]136-peyrol death - like rigidity that [Michel]150-michel , coming up out of [the ravine]480-the ravine , stopped dead short , believing [him]136-peyrol [an apparition not belonging to [this earth]1172-this earth]1885-an apparition not belonging to this earth . [Scevola]123-scevola , on [his]123-scevola side , noticed the moving shadow cast by [a man]278-a man - [that man]495-that man ! - and charged forward without reflection , the prongs of the fork lowered like a bayonet . [He]123-scevola did n't shout . [He]123-scevola came straight on , growling like a dog , and lunged headlong with [his]123-scevola weapon . [Michel]150-michel , [a primitive , untroubled by anything so uncertain as intelligence]1889-a primitive , untroubled by anything so uncertain as intelligence , executed an instantaneous sideways leap with the precision of a wild animal ; but [he]150-michel was enough of [a man]278-a man to become afterwards paralyzed with astonishment . The impetus of the rush carried [Scevola]123-scevola several yards down [the hill]694-the hill , before [he]123-scevola could turn round and assume an offensive attitude . Then [the two adversaries]1892-the two adversaries recognized [each other]2919-each other . [The terrorist]1230-the terrorist exclaimed : " [Michel]150-michel ? "[1230-the terrorist] and [Michel]150-michel hastened to pick up a large stone from the ground . " Hey , [you]150-michel , [Scevola]123-scevola , "[150-michel] [he]150-michel cried , not very loud but very threatening . " What are these tricks ? . . . " [I]123-scevola did n't recognize [you]150-michel , "[123-scevola] [he]123-scevola said . " That 's a story . Who did [you]150-michel think [I]123-scevola was ? Not the other ! [I]123-scevola have n't got a bandaged head , have [I]123-scevola ? "[123-scevola] [Scevola]123-scevola began to scramble up . " What 's this ? "[123-scevola] [he]123-scevola asked . " [People]287-people have been saying for years that [you]150-michel are [a kind of lunatic]4248-a kind of lunatic , "[150-michel] [Michel]150-michel criticized fearlessly , because the other 's discomfiture was evident enough to put heart into [the timid hare]1896-the timid hare . "[150-michel] " [I]123-scevola was only going to put this fork away , "[123-scevola] [Scevola]123-scevola burst out volubly . " [I]123-scevola had left it leaning against the wall , and as [I.]123-scevola was passing along [I]123-scevola suddenly saw it , so [I]123-scevola thought [I]123-scevola would put it in [the stable]4251-the stable before [I]123-scevola went to bed . "[150-michel] mumbled [Michel]150-michel , who began to doubt the evidence of [his]150-michel senses . " [You]150-michel go about mooning like [a fool]4252-a fool and imagine a lot of silly things , [[you]150-michel great , stupid imbecile]4253-you great , stupid imbecile . "[150-michel] [Michel]150-michel , accustomed to do what [he]150-michel was told , opened [his]150-michel fingers slowly , not quite convinced but thinking there might be something in it . [Scevola]123-scevola , perceiving [his]150-michel advantage , scolded on : " [You]150-michel are dangerous . [You]150-michel ought to have [your]150-michel feet and hands tied every full moon . What did [you]150-michel say about a head just now ? What head ? "[123-scevola] " [I]123-scevola said that [I]123-scevola did n't have a broken head . "[123-scevola] " Was that all ? "[123-scevola] said [Scevola]123-scevola . [He]123-scevola was asking [himself]123-scevola what on [earth]442-earth could have happened down there during the afternoon to cause a broken head . Clearly , it must have been either a fight or an accident , but in any case [he]123-scevola considered that it was for [him]123-scevola a favourable circumstance , for obviously [a man with a bandaged head]1898-a man with a bandaged head is at a disadvantage . [He]123-scevola was inclined to think it must have been some silly accident , and [he]123-scevola regretted profoundly that [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant had not killed [himself]2881-the lieutenant outright . [He]123-scevola turned sourly to [Michel]150-michel . " Now [you]150-michel may go into [the shed]2769-the shed . And do n't try any of [your]150-michel tricks with [me]123-scevola any more , because next time [you]150-michel pick up a stone [I]123-scevola will shoot [you]150-michel like a dog . "[123-scevola] [He]123-scevola began to move towards the yard gate which stood always open , throwing over [his]123-scevola shoulder an order to [Michel]150-michel : " Go into [the salle]782-the salle . [Somebody]876-somebody has left a light in there . [They]876-somebody all seem to have gone crazy to - day . Take the lamp into [the kitchen]645-the kitchen and put it out and see that the door into [the yard]553-the yard is shut . [I]123-scevola am going to bed . "[123-scevola] [He]123-scevola passed through the gateway , but [he]123-scevola did not penetrate into [the yard]553-the yard very far . [He]123-scevola stopped to watch [Michel]150-michel obeying the order . [Scevola]123-scevola , advancing [his]123-scevola head cautiously beyond the pillar of the gate , waited till [he]123-scevola had seen [Michel]150-michel open the door of [the salle]782-the salle and then bounded out again across [the level space]1902-the level space and down [the ravine path]1903-the ravine path . It was a matter of less than a minute . [His]150-michel fork was still on [his]150-michel shoulder . [His]150-michel only desire was not to be interfered with , and for the rest [he]150-michel did not care what [they]1904-they all did , what [they]1904-they would think and how [they]1904-they would behave . The fixed idea had taken complete possession of [him]150-michel . [He]150-michel had no plan , but [he]150-michel had a principle on which to act ; and that was to get at [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant unawares , and if [the fellow]536-the fellow died without knowing what hand had struck [him]150-michel , so much the better . [Scevola]123-scevola was going to act in the cause of virtue and justice . It was not to be a matter of personal contest at all . Meantime , [Michel]150-michel , having gone into [the salle]782-the salle , had discovered [Peyrol]136-peyrol fast asleep on a table . Though [his]150-michel reverence for [Peyrol]136-peyrol was unbounded , [his]150-michel simplicity was such that [he]150-michel shook [[his]150-michel master]508-his master by the shoulder as [he]150-michel would have done [any common mortal]1909-any common mortal . [The rover]822-the rover passed from a state of inertia into a sitting posture so quickly that [Michel]150-michel stepped back a pace and waited to be addressed . But as [Peyrol]136-peyrol only stared at [him]150-michel , [Michel]150-michel took the initiative in a concise phrase : " [He]136-peyrol 's at it ! "[150-michel] [Peyrol]136-peyrol did not seem completely awake : " What is it [you]136-peyrol mean ? "[136-peyrol] [he]136-peyrol asked . " [He]136-peyrol is making motions to escape . "[136-peyrol] [Peyrol]136-peyrol was wide awake now . [He]136-peyrol even swung [his]136-peyrol feet off the table . " Is [he]136-peyrol ? Have n't [you]136-peyrol locked [the cabin]3345-the cabin door ? "[136-peyrol] [Michel]150-michel , very frightened , explained that [he]150-michel had never been told to do that . " No ? "[136-peyrol] remarked [Peyrol]136-peyrol placidly . " [I]136-peyrol must have forgotten . "[136-peyrol] But [Michel]150-michel remained agitated and murmured : " [He]136-peyrol is escaping . "[150-michel] " That 's all right , "[136-peyrol] said [Peyrol]136-peyrol . " What are [you]150-michel fussing about ? How far can [he]136-peyrol escape , do [you]150-michel think ? "[136-peyrol] A slow grin appeared on [Michel]150-michel 's face . " If [he]136-peyrol tries to scramble over the top of the rocks , [he]136-peyrol will get a broken neck in a very short time , "[150-michel] [he]150-michel said . " And [he]136-peyrol certainly wo n't get very far , that 's a fact . "[150-michel] " Well - [you]150-michel see , "[136-peyrol] said [Peyrol]136-peyrol . " And [he]136-peyrol does n't seem strong either . [He]136-peyrol crawled out of [the cabin]3345-the cabin door and got as far as the little water cask and [he]136-peyrol dipped and dipped into it . [I]150-michel cleared out ashore directly [I]150-michel heard [him]136-peyrol move , "[150-michel] [he]150-michel went on in a tone of intense self - approval . " [I]150-michel hid [myself]150-michel behind a rock and watched [him]136-peyrol . ; ; "[150-michel] Quite right , " observed [Peyrol]136-peyrol . After that word of commendation , [Michel]150-michel 's face wore a constant grin . "[150-michel] [He]150-michel sat on [the after - deck]1537-the after - deck , " [he]0-i went on as if relating an immense joke , "[150-michel] with [his]150-michel feet dangling down the hold , and may the devil take [me]0-i if [I]0-i do n't think [he]150-michel had a nap with [his]150-michel back against the cask . [He]150-michel was nodding and catching [himself]150-michel up , with that big white head of [his]150-michel . " [Peyrol]136-peyrol extinguished the lamp and , going out , closed the door without the slightest noise . The intelligence about [Scevola]123-scevola being on the move did not please [him]136-peyrol very much , but [he]136-peyrol reflected that probably [the sans - culotte]571-the sans - culotte had fallen asleep again and after waking up was on [his]123-scevola way to bed when [Michel]150-michel caught sight of [him]123-scevola . Having thus , so to speak , guarded [his]136-peyrol base , [Peyrol]136-peyrol proceeded down [the ravine]480-the ravine with a very deliberate caution .
