[He]136-peyrol did n't know what [[his]136-peyrol prisoner]1543-his prisoner had done or was doing and [he]136-peyrol did not want to blunder into the way of [his]136-peyrol escape . The day - old moon was high enough to have shortened the shadows almost to nothing and all the rocks were inundated by a yellow sheen , while the bushes by contrast looked very black . [Peyrol]136-peyrol reflected that [he]1921-he was not very well concealed . The continued silence impressed [him]136-peyrol in the end . "[188-debout] [He]1921-he has got away , " [he]136-peyrol thought . Yet [he]136-peyrol was not sure . [Nobody]2665-nobody could be sure . [He]136-peyrol reckoned it was about an hour since [Michel]150-michel had left the tartane ; time enough for [a man , even on all fours]4275-a man , even on all fours , to crawl down to [the shore of [the cove]3161-the cove]4276-the shore of the cove . [Peyrol]136-peyrol wished [he]136-peyrol had not hit so hard . [His]136-peyrol object could have been attained with half the force . On the other hand all the proceedings of [[his]136-peyrol prisoner]1543-his prisoner , as reported by [Michel]150-michel , seemed quite rational . Naturally [the fellow]536-the fellow was badly shaken . [Peyrol]136-peyrol felt as though [he]136-peyrol wanted to go on board and give [him]536-the fellow some encouragement , and even active assistance . The report of a gun from [seaward]4280-seaward cut [his]136-peyrol breath short as [he]136-peyrol lay there meditating . Within a minute there was a second report , sending another wave of deep sound among [the crags and hills of [the peninsula]452-the peninsula]4281-the crags and hills of the peninsula . The ensuing silence was so profound that it seemed to extend to the very inside of [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's head , and lull all [his]136-peyrol thoughts for a moment . But [he]136-peyrol had understood . [He]136-peyrol said to [himself]136-peyrol that after this [[his]136-peyrol prisoner]1543-his prisoner , if [he]1543-his prisoner had life enough left in [him]1543-his prisoner to stir a limb , would rather die than not try to make [his]1543-his prisoner way to [the seashore]1177-the seashore . [The ship]2931-the ship was calling to [[her]2931-the ship man]3869-her man . In fact those two guns had proceeded from [the Amelia]138-the amelia . After passing beyond [Cape Esterel]20-cape esterel , [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent dropped an anchor under foot off [the beach]3107-the beach just as [Peyrol]136-peyrol had surmised [he]133-captain vincent would do . From about six o'clock till nine [the Amelia]3078-the amelia lay there with [her]3078-the amelia unfurled sails hanging in the gear . Then [he]133-captain vincent went below , and presently word was passed on [deck]3083-deck that [the captain]923-the captain wanted [Mr. Bolt]137-bolt . When [[the master]2770-the master 's mate]3057-the master 's mate appeared in [[his]923-the captain cabin]241-his cabin , [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent motioned [him]3057-the master 's mate to a chair . "[1921-he] [I]0-i do n't think [I]0-i ought to have listened to [you]1922-you , " [he]0-i said . "[1922-you] Still , the idea was fascinating , but how it would strike [other people]1923-other people it is hard to say . The losing of [[our]1924-we man]974-our man is the worst feature . [I]0-i have an idea that [we]1924-we might recover [him]974-our man . [He]974-our man may have been captured by [the peasants]1307-the peasants or have met with an accident . It 's unbearable to think of [him]974-our man lying at the foot of some rock with a broken leg . [I]0-i have ordered the first and second cutters to be manned , and [I]0-i propose that [you]1922-you should take command of [them]1927-them , enter [the cove]3161-the cove and , if necessary , advance a little inland to investigate . "[137-bolt] Like this , [Bolt]137-bolt , " explained [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent , "[137-bolt] [Symons]144-symons will guess that [we]1924-we are looking for [him]144-symons ; and if [he]144-symons is hiding anywhere near [the shore]231-the shore [he]144-symons will be sure to come down where [he]144-symons can be seen by [you]1922-you . " The motive force of a fixed idea is very great . In the case of [Scevola]123-scevola it was great enough to launch [him]144-symons down [the slope]3155-the slope and to rob [him]144-symons for the moment of all caution . [He]144-symons bounded amongst the boulders , using the handle of the stable fork for a staff . [He]144-symons paid no regard to the nature of the ground , till [he]144-symons got a fall and found [himself]144-symons sprawling on [his]144-symons face , while the stable fork went clattering down until it was stopped by a bush . It was this circumstance which saved [[Peyrol]136-peyrol 's prisoner]1551-peyrol 's prisoner from being caught unawares . Since [he]144-symons had got out of [the little cabin]1242-the little cabin , simply because after coming to [himself]144-symons [he]144-symons had perceived [it]1242-the little cabin was open , [Symons]144-symons had been greatly refreshed by long drinks of cold water and by [his]144-symons little nap in the fresh air . Every moment [he]144-symons was feeling in better command of [his]144-symons limbs . As to the command of [his]144-symons thoughts , that was coming to [him]144-symons too rather quickly . The advantage of having a very thick skull became evident in the fact that as soon as [he]144-symons had dragged [himself]144-symons out of [that cabin]1733-that cabin [he]144-symons knew where [he]144-symons was . The next thing [he]144-symons did was to look at the moon , to judge of the passage of time . Then [he]144-symons gave way to an immense surprise at the fact of being alone aboard [the tartane]350-the tartane . As [he]144-symons sat with [his]144-symons legs dangling into the open hold [he]144-symons tried to guess how it came about that [the cabin]3345-the cabin had been left unlocked and unguarded . [He]144-symons went on thinking about this unexpected situation . What could have become of [that white - headed villain]4309-that white - headed villain ? Was [he]144-symons dodging about somewhere watching for a chance to give [him]144-symons another tap on the head ? [Symons]144-symons felt suddenly very unsafe sitting there on [the after - deck]1537-the after - deck in the full light of the moon . Instinct rather than reason suggested to [him]144-symons that [he]144-symons ought to get down into [the dark hold]4311-the dark hold . It seemed a great undertaking at first , but once [he]144-symons started [he]144-symons accomplished it with the greatest ease , though [he]144-symons could not avoid knocking down a small spar which was leaning up against [the deck]351-the deck . It preceded [him]144-symons into [the hold]347-the hold with a loud crash which gave [poor Symons]144-symons an attack of palpitation of the heart . [He]144-symons sat on the keelson of [the tartane]350-the tartane and gasped , but after a while reflected that all this did not matter . [His]144-symons head felt very big , [his]144-symons neck was very painful and one shoulder was certainly very stiff . [He]144-symons could never stand up against [that old ruffian]4315-that old ruffian . But what had become of [him]144-symons ? Why ! [He]144-symons had gone to fetch [the soldiers]3301-the soldiers ! After that conclusion [Symons]144-symons became more composed . [He]144-symons began to try to remember things . When [he]144-symons had last seen [that old fellow]4317-that old fellow it was daylight , and now - [Symons]144-symons looked up at the moon again - it must be near six bells in the first watch . No doubt [the old scoundrel]4318-the old scoundrel was sitting in [a wine shop]1713-a wine shop drinking with [the soldiers]3301-the soldiers . [They]3301-the soldiers would be here soon enough ! The idea of being [a prisoner of war]4321-a prisoner of war made [his]144-symons heart sink a little . [[His]144-symons ship]273-his ship appeared to [him]144-symons invested with an extraordinary number of lovable features which included [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent and [the first lieutenant]4323-the first lieutenant . [He]144-symons would have been glad to shake hands even with [the corporal]4324-the corporal , [a surly and malicious marine acting as master - at - arms of [the ship]2931-the ship]4325-a surly and malicious marine acting as master - at - arms of the ship . "[144-symons] [I]0-i wonder where [she]1933-she is now , " [he]144-symons thought dismally , feeling [his]144-symons distaste for captivity grow with the increase of [his]144-symons strength . It was at this moment that [he]144-symons heard the noise of [Scevola]123-scevola 's fall . It was pretty close ; but afterwards [he]144-symons heard no voices and footsteps heralding the approach of a body of [men]423-men . If this was [the old ruffian]4328-the old ruffian coming back , then [he]4328-the old ruffian was coming back alone . At once [Symons]144-symons started on all fours for the fore - end of [the tartane]350-the tartane . [He]144-symons had an idea that ensconced under [the fore - deck]4330-the fore - deck [he]144-symons would be in a better position to parley with [the enemy]627-the enemy and that perhaps [he]144-symons could find there a handspike or some piece of iron to defend [himself]144-symons with . just as [he]144-symons had settled [himself]144-symons in [his]144-symons hiding - place [Scevola]123-scevola stepped from [the shore]231-the shore on to [the after - deck]1537-the after - deck . At the very first glance [Symons]144-symons perceived that [this one]828-this one was very unlike [the man [he]144-symons expected to see]4335-the man he expected to see . [He]144-symons felt rather disappointed . As [Scevola]123-scevola stood still in full moonlight [Symons]144-symons congratulated [himself]144-symons on having taken up a position under [the fore - deck]4330-the fore - deck . [That fellow , who had a beard]4337-that fellow , who had a beard , was like a sparrow in body compared with the other ; but [he]123-scevola was armed dangerously with something that looked to [Symons]144-symons like either a trident or fishgrains on a staff . "[0-i] A devil of a weapon that , " [he]144-symons thought , appalled . And what on earth did [that beggar]4338-that beggar want on board ? What could [he]123-scevola be after ? [The new - comer]4339-the new - comer acted strangely at first . [He]123-scevola stood stock - still , craning [his]123-scevola neck here and there , peering along the whole length of the tartane , then crossing [the deck]351-the deck [he]123-scevola repeated all those performances on the other side . "[1934-he] [He]1934-he has noticed that [the cabin]3345-the cabin door is open . [He]1934-he 's trying to see where [I]0-i 've got to . " For a moment [he]144-symons debated within [himself]144-symons whether it would n't be better to make a dash for it and scramble [ashore]1002-ashore ; but in the end [he]144-symons mistrusted [his]144-symons strength . "[1934-he] [He]1934-he would run [me]0-i down for sure , " [he]0-i concluded . "[1934-he] And [he]1934-he means no good , that 's certain . [No man]502-no man would go about at night with a confounded thing like that if [he]1934-he did n't mean to do for [somebody]876-somebody . " [Scevola]123-scevola , after keeping perfectly still , straining [his]123-scevola ears for any sound from below where [he]123-scevola supposed [Lieutenant Ral]136-peyrol to be , stooped down to [the cabin scuttle]4342-the cabin scuttle and called in a low voice : "[1934-he] Are [you]0-i there , [lieutenant]888-lieutenant ? " [Symons]144-symons saw these motions and could not imagine [their]4343-their purport . [That excellent able seaman of proved courage in many cutting - out expeditions]4344-that excellent able seaman of proved courage in many cutting - out expeditions broke into a slight perspiration . In the light of the moon the prongs of the fork polished by much use shone like silver , and the whole aspect of [the stranger]4345-the stranger was weird and dangerous in the extreme . Whom could [that man]495-that man be after but [him]495-that man , [himself]495-that man ? [Scevola]123-scevola , receiving no answer , remained in a stooping position . [He]123-scevola could not detect the slightest sound of breathing down there . [He]123-scevola remained in this position so long that [Symons]144-symons became quite interested . "[1939-he] [He]1939-he must think [I]0-i am still down there , " [he]0-i whispered to [himself]0-i . The next proceeding was quite astonishing . [The man]400-the man , taking up a position on one side of the cuddy scuttle and holding [his]400-the man horrid weapon as one would a boarding pike , uttered a terrific whoop and went on yelling in French with such volubility that [he]400-the man quite frightened [Symons]144-symons . Suddenly [he]400-the man left off , moved away from the scuttle and looked at a loss what to do next . [Anybody who could have seen]4348-anybody who could have seen then [Symons]144-symons protruded head with [his]400-the man face turned aft would have seen on it an expression of horror , "[0-i] The cunning beast , " [he]0-i thought . "[0-i] If [I]0-i had been down there , with the row [he]1939-he made [I]0-i would have surely rushed on [deck]3083-deck and then [he]1939-he would have had [me]0-i . " [Symons]144-symons experienced the feeling of a very narrow escape ; yet it brought not much relief . It was simply a matter of time . [The fellow]536-the fellow 's homicidal purpose was evident . [He]536-the fellow was bound before long to come forward . [Symons]144-symons saw [him]536-the fellow move , and thought , "[1939-he] Now [he]1939-he 's coming , " and prepared [himself]144-symons for a dash . "[1939-he] If [I]0-i can dodge past those blamed prongs [I]0-i might be able to take [him]1939-he by the throat , " [he]0-i reflected , without , however , feeling much confidence in [himself]0-i . But to [his]0-i great relief [Scevola]123-scevola 's purpose was simply to conceal the fork in the hold in such a manner that the handle of it just reached the edge of the after - deck . In that position it was of course invisible to anybody coming from [the shore]231-the shore . [Scevola]123-scevola had made up [his]123-scevola mind that [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant was out of the tartane . [He]123-scevola had wandered away along [the shore]231-the shore and would probably be back in a moment . Meantime it had occurred to [him]123-scevola to see if [he]123-scevola could discover anything compromising in [the cabin]3345-the cabin . [He]123-scevola did not take the fork down with [him]123-scevola because in that confined space it would have been useless and rather a source of embarrassment than otherwise , should [the returning lieutenant]4354-the returning lieutenant find [him]123-scevola [there]266-there . [He]123-scevola cast a circular glance around [the basin]1506-the basin and then prepared to go down . Every movement of [his]123-scevola was watched by [Symons]144-symons . [He]144-symons guessed [Scevola]123-scevola 's purpose by [his]144-symons movements and said to [himself]144-symons : "[0-i] Here 's [my]0-i only chance , and not a second to be lost either . " [Directly Scevola]189-scevola turned [his]123-scevola back on the forepart of [the tartane]350-the tartane in order to go down [the little cabin ladder]4358-the little cabin ladder , [Symons]144-symons crawled out from [his]144-symons concealment . [He]144-symons ran along the hold on all fours for fear the other should turn [his]144-symons head round before disappearing below , but directly [he]144-symons judged that [the man]400-the man had touched bottom , [he]144-symons stood on [his]144-symons feet and catching hold of the main rigging swung [himself]144-symons on the after - deck and , as it were in the same movement , flung [himself]144-symons on the doors of [the cabin]3345-the cabin which came together with a crash . How [he]144-symons could secure them [he]144-symons had not thought , but as a matter of fact [he]144-symons saw the padlock hanging on a staple on one side ; the key was in it , and it was a matter of a fraction of a second to secure the doors effectually . Almost simultaneously with the crash of the cabin door there was a shrill exclamation of surprise down there , and just as [Symons]144-symons had turned the key [the man [he]144-symons had trapped]4361-the man he had trapped made an effort to break out . That , however , did not disturb [Symons]144-symons . [He]144-symons knew the strength of that door . [His]144-symons first action was to get possession of [the stable fork]4362-the stable fork . At once [he]144-symons felt [himself]144-symons a match for [any single man or even two men]4363-any single man or even two men unless [they]4363-any single man or even two men had fire - arms . [He]144-symons had no hope , however , of being able to resist [the soldiers]3301-the soldiers and really had no intention of doing so . [He]144-symons expected to see [them]3301-the soldiers appear at any moment led by [that confounded marinero]4365-that confounded marinero . As to what [the farmer man]4366-the farmer man had come for on board [the tartane]350-the tartane [he]144-symons had not the slightest doubt about it . Not being troubled by too much imagination , it seemed to [him]144-symons obvious that it was to kill [an Englishman]2854-an englishman and for nothing else . "[0-i] Well , [I]0-i am jiggered , " [he]144-symons exclaimed mentally . "[0-i] [The damned savage]1941-the damned savage ! [I]0-i have n't done anything to [him]1941-the damned savage . [They]1942-they must be a murderous lot hereabouts . " [He]144-symons looked anxiously up [the slope]3155-the slope . [He]144-symons would have welcomed the arrival of [soldiers]1618-soldiers . [He]144-symons wanted more than ever to be made [a proper prisoner]4371-a proper prisoner , but a profound stillness reigned on [the shore]231-the shore and a most absolute silence down below in [the cabin]3345-the cabin . Absolute . No word , no movement . The silence of the grave . "[1942-they] [He]1941-the damned savage 's scared to death , " thought [Symons]144-symons , hitting in [his]144-symons simplicity on the exact truth . "[1941-the damned savage] It would serve [him]1941-the damned savage jolly well right if [I]0-i went down there and ran [him]1941-the damned savage through with that thing . [I]0-i would do it for a shilling , too . " [He]144-symons was getting angry . It occurred to [him]144-symons also that there was some wine down there too . [He]144-symons discovered [he]144-symons was very thirsty and [he]144-symons felt rather faint . [He]144-symons sat down on the little skylight to think the matter over while awaiting [the soldiers]3301-the soldiers . [He]144-symons even gave a friendly thought to [Peyrol]136-peyrol [himself]144-symons . [He]144-symons was quite aware that [he]144-symons could have gone ashore and hidden [himself]144-symons for a time , but that meant in the end being hunted among [the rocks]1502-the rocks and , certainly , captured ; with the additional risk of getting a musket ball through [his]144-symons body . The first gun of [the Amelia]138-the amelia lifted [him]144-symons to [his]144-symons feet as though [he]144-symons had been snatched up by the hair of [his]144-symons head . [He]144-symons intended to give a resounding cheer , but produced only a feeble gurgle in [his]144-symons throat . [[His]144-symons ship]273-his ship was talking to [him]144-symons . [They]273-his ship had n't given [him]144-symons up . At the second report [he]144-symons scrambled [ashore]1002-ashore with the agility of a cat - in fact , with so much agility that [he]144-symons had a fit of giddiness . After it passed off [he]144-symons returned deliberately to the tartane to get hold of the stable fork . Then trembling with emotion , [he]144-symons staggered off quietly and resolutely with the only purpose of getting down to [the seashore]1177-the seashore . [He]144-symons knew that as long as [he]144-symons kept downhill [he]144-symons would be all right . The ground in this part being a smooth rocky surface and [Symons]144-symons being barefooted , [he]144-symons passed at no great distance from [Peyrol]136-peyrol without being heard . When [he]144-symons got on [rough ground]4379-rough ground [he]144-symons used [the stable fork]4362-the stable fork for a staff . Slowly as [he]144-symons moved [he]144-symons was not really strong enough to be sure - footed . Ten minutes later or so [Peyrol]136-peyrol , lying ensconced behind a bush , beard the noise of a rolling stone far away in [the direction of [the cove]3161-the cove]4381-the direction of the cove . Instantly [the patient Peyrol]4383-the patient peyrol got on [his]144-symons feet and started towards [the cove]3161-the cove [himself]144-symons . Perhaps [he]144-symons would have smiled if the importance and gravity of the affair in which [he]144-symons was engaged had not given all [his]144-symons thoughts a serious cast . Pursuing a higher path than the one followed by [Symons]144-symons , [he]144-symons had presently the satisfaction of seeing [the fugitive]4385-the fugitive , made very noticeable by the white bandages about [his]144-symons head , engaged in the last part of the steep descent . [No nurse]4386-no nurse could have watched with more anxiety the adventure of [a little boy]4387-a little boy than [Peyrol]136-peyrol the progress of [[his]136-peyrol former prisoner]4388-his former prisoner . [He]136-peyrol was very glad to perceive that [he]136-peyrol had had the sense to take what looked like the tartane 's boathook to help [himself]136-peyrol with . As [Symons]144-symons ' figure sank lower and lower in [his]136-peyrol descent [Peyrol]136-peyrol moved on , step by step , till at last [he]136-peyrol saw [him]144-symons from above sitting down on [the seashore]1177-the seashore , looking very forlorn and lonely , with [his]144-symons bandaged head between [his]144-symons hands . Instantly [Peyrol]136-peyrol sat down too , protected by a projecting rock . And it is safe to say that with that there came a complete cessation of all sound and movement on [the lonely head of [the peninsula]452-the peninsula]4390-the lonely head of the peninsula for a full half hour . [Peyrol]136-peyrol was not in doubt as to what was going to happen . [He]136-peyrol was as certain that [[the corvette]1509-the corvette 's boat or [boats]3095-boats]4393-the corvette 's boat or boats were now on the way to [the cove]3161-the cove as though [he]136-peyrol had seen [them]4393-the corvette 's boat or boats leave [the side of [the Amelia]138-the amelia]4396-the side of the amelia . But [he]136-peyrol began to get a little impatient . [He]136-peyrol wanted to see the end of this episode . Most of the time [he]136-peyrol was watching [Symons]144-symons . "[0-i] Sacre tte dure , " [he]136-peyrol thought . "[1943-he] [He]1943-he has gone to sleep . " Indeed [Symons]144-symons immobility was so complete that [he]1943-he might have been dead from [his]1943-he exertions : only [Peyrol]136-peyrol had a conviction that [[his]136-peyrol once youthful chum]4397-his once youthful chum was not the sort of person that dies easily . [The part of [the cove]3161-the cove [he]136-peyrol had reached]4398-the part of the cove he had reached was all right for [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's purpose . [Peyrol]136-peyrol shuddered . Suddenly [he]136-peyrol made out [a boat]2704-a boat just clear of [the eastern point of [the cove]3161-the cove]4403-the eastern point of the cove . [Mr. Bolt]137-bolt had been hugging [the coast]405-the coast and progressing very slowly , according to [his]137-bolt instructions , till [he]137-bolt had reached the edge of the point 's shadow where it lay ragged and black on [the moonlit water]4406-the moonlit water . The midnight meeting of [Lieutenant Ral]136-peyrol and [Peyrol]136-peyrol was perfectly silent . [This naval officer]4445-this naval officer was not [a man [he]136-peyrol could trust ; to whom [he]136-peyrol could , for instance , tell the story of [[his]136-peyrol prisoner]1543-his prisoner and what [he]136-peyrol had done with [him]1543-his prisoner]4446-a man he could trust ; to whom he could , for instance , tell the story of his prisoner and what he had done with him . [He]150-michel was going . . . . [He]150-michel has n't gone to sleep in [the stable]4251-the stable , perchance ? [He]150-michel does sometimes , [you]0-i know . " "[150-michel] [I]0-i know . [I]0-i looked . [He]150-michel is n't [there]266-there , " said [Michel]150-michel , very awake and round - eyed . [Peyrol]136-peyrol started towards [the cove]3161-the cove . After three or four steps [he]136-peyrol turned round and found [Michel]150-michel motionless where [he]136-peyrol had left [him]150-michel . "[150-michel] Come on , " [he]136-peyrol cried , "[150-michel] [we]1981-their will have to fit the tartane for [sea]228-sea directly the day breaks . " Standing in [[the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant 's room]1647-the lieutenant 's room just clear of the open window , [Arlette]121-arlette listened to [their]1981-their voices and to the sound of [their]1981-their footsteps diminishing down the slope . Before [they]1981-their had quite died out [she]121-arlette became aware of a light tread approaching the door of [the room]413-the room . [Lieutenant Ral]136-peyrol had spoken the truth . While in [Toulon]1-toulon [he]136-peyrol had more than once said to [himself]136-peyrol that [he]136-peyrol could never go back to [that fatal farmhouse]4477-that fatal farmhouse . [His]136-peyrol mental state was quite pitiable . Honour , decency , every principle forbade [him]136-peyrol to trifle with the feelings of [a poor creature]1690-a poor creature with [her]1690-a poor creature mind darkened by a very terrifying , atrocious and , as it were , guilty experience . And suddenly [he]136-peyrol had given way to a base impulse and had betrayed [himself]136-peyrol by kissing [her]1690-a poor creature hand ! [He]136-peyrol recognized with despair that this was no trifling , but that the impulse had come from the very depths of [his]136-peyrol being . It was an awful discovery for [a man who on emerging from boyhood]4479-a man who on emerging from boyhood had laid for [himself]136-peyrol a rigidly straight line of conduct amongst the unbridled passions and the clamouring falsehoods of revolution which seemed to have destroyed in [him]136-peyrol all capacity for the softer emotions . Taciturn and guarded , [he]136-peyrol had formed no intimacies . Relations [he]136-peyrol had none . [He]136-peyrol had kept clear of social connections . It was in [his]136-peyrol character . At first [he]136-peyrol visited [Escampobar]30-escampobar because when [he]136-peyrol took [his]136-peyrol leave [he]136-peyrol had no place in [the world]2656-the world to go to , and a few days there were a complete change from [the odious town]4481-the odious town . [He]136-peyrol enjoyed the sense of remoteness from [ordinary mankind]4482-ordinary mankind . [He]136-peyrol had developed a liking for [old Peyrol]136-peyrol , [the only man who had nothing to do with the revolution - who had not even seen it at work]4483-the only man who had nothing to do with the revolution - who had not even seen it at work . The sincere lawlessness of [the ex - Brother of the Coast]4484-the ex - brother of the coast was refreshing . That [one]2670-one was neither [a hypocrite]4486-a hypocrite nor [a fool]4252-a fool . When [he]136-peyrol robbed or killed it was not in the name of the sacred revolutionary principles or for the love of [humanity]4488-humanity . Of course [Ral]136-peyrol had remarked at once [Arlette]121-arlette 's black , profound and unquiet eyes and the persistent dim smile on [her]121-arlette lips , [her]121-arlette mysterious silences and the rare sound of [her]121-arlette voice which made a caress of every word . [He]136-peyrol heard something of [her]121-arlette story from [the reluctant Peyrol who did not care to talk about it]4489-the reluctant peyrol who did not care to talk about it . It awakened in [Ral]136-peyrol more bitter indignation than pity . But it stimulated [his]136-peyrol imagination , confirmed [him]136-peyrol in that scorn and angry loathing for the revolution [he]136-peyrol had felt as [a boy]1034-a boy and had nursed secretly ever since . [She]121-arlette attracted [him]136-peyrol by [her]121-arlette unapproachable aspect . Later [he]136-peyrol tried not to notice that , in common parlance , [she]121-arlette was inclined to hang about [him]136-peyrol . [He]136-peyrol used to catch [her]121-arlette gazing at [him]136-peyrol stealthily . But [he]136-peyrol was free from masculine vanity . It was one day in [Toulon]1-toulon that it suddenly dawned on [him]136-peyrol what [her]121-arlette mute interest in [[his]136-peyrol person]372-his person might mean . [He]136-peyrol was then sitting outside [a caf]4492-a caf sipping some drink or other with [three or four officers]4493-three or four officers , and not listening to [their]4493-three or four officers uninteresting conversation . [He]136-peyrol marvelled that this sort of illumination should come to [him]136-peyrol like this , under these circumstances ; that [he]136-peyrol should have thought of [her]121-arlette while seated in [the street]309-the street with [these men round [him]136-peyrol]4495-these men round him , in the midst of more or less professional talk ! And then it suddenly dawned on [him]136-peyrol that [he]136-peyrol had been thinking of nothing but [that woman]1461-that woman for days . [He]136-peyrol got up brusquely , flung the money for [his]136-peyrol drink on the table , and without a word left [[his]136-peyrol companions]4497-his companions . But [he]136-peyrol had the reputation of [an eccentric man]4498-an eccentric man and [they]4497-his companions did not even comment on [his]136-peyrol abrupt departure . It was a clear evening . [He]136-peyrol walked straight out of [town]3283-town , and that night wandered beyond [the fortifications]4500-the fortifications , not noticing the direction [he]136-peyrol took . All [the countryside]416-the countryside was asleep . There was [not a human being stirring]4502-not a human being stirring , and [his]136-peyrol progress in [that desolate part of [the country]327-the country between [the forts]4505-the forts]4503-that desolate part of the country between the forts could have been traced only by the barking of dogs in [the rare hamlets]4506-the rare hamlets and scattered habitations . "[150-michel] What has become of [my]0-i rectitude , of [my]0-i self - respect , of the firmness of [my]0-i mind ? " [he]136-peyrol asked [himself]0-i pedantically . "[0-i] [I]0-i have let [myself]0-i be mastered by an unworthy passion for [a mere mortal envelope , stained with crime and without a mind]1983-a mere mortal envelope , stained with crime and without a mind . " [His]136-peyrol despair at this awful discovery was so profound that if [he]136-peyrol had not been in uniform [he]136-peyrol would have tried to commit suicide with the small pistol [he]136-peyrol had in [his]136-peyrol pocket . [He]136-peyrol shrank from the act , and the thought of the sensation it would produce , from the gossip and comments it would raise , the dishonouring suspicions it would provoke . "[0-i] No , " [he]136-peyrol said to [himself]136-peyrol , "[0-i] what [I]0-i will have to do is to unmark [my]0-i linen , put on civilian old clothes and walk out much farther away , miles beyond [the forts]4505-the forts , hide [myself]0-i in some wood or in an overgrown hollow and put an end to [my]0-i life there . [The gendarmes]1985-the gendarmes or [a garde - champtre]1986-a garde - champtre discovering [my]0-i body after a few days , [a complete stranger without marks of identity]1987-a complete stranger without marks of identity , and being unable to find out anything about [me]0-i , will give [me]0-i an obscure burial in [some village churchyard]1988-some village churchyard . " On that resolution [he]136-peyrol turned back abruptly and at daybreak found [himself]136-peyrol outside the gate of [the town]225-the town . [He]136-peyrol had to wait till it was opened , and then the morning was so far advanced that [he]136-peyrol had to go straight to work at [[his]136-peyrol office at [the Toulon Admiralty]3214-the toulon admiralty]4508-his office at the toulon admiralty . [Nobody]2665-nobody noticed anything peculiar about [him]136-peyrol that day . [He]136-peyrol went through [his]136-peyrol routine tasks with outward composure , but all the same [he]136-peyrol never ceased arguing with [himself]136-peyrol . By the time [he]136-peyrol returned to [[his]136-peyrol quarters]1238-his quarters [he]136-peyrol had come to the conclusion that as [an officer in war]4512-an officer in war - time [he]136-peyrol had no right to take [his]136-peyrol own life . [His]136-peyrol principles would not permit [him]136-peyrol to do that . In this reasoning [he]136-peyrol was perfectly sincere . During a deadly struggle against an irreconcilable enemy [his]136-peyrol life belonged to [[his]136-peyrol country]3059-his country . But there were moments when [his]136-peyrol loneliness , haunted by the forbidden vision of [Escampobar]30-escampobar with the figure of [that distracted girl]4514-that distracted girl , mysterious , awful , pale , irresistible in [her]4514-that distracted girl strangeness , passing along the walls , appearing on [the hill - paths]4515-the hill - paths , looking out of the window , became unbearable . [He]136-peyrol spent hours of solitary anguish shut up in [[his]136-peyrol quarters]1238-his quarters , and the opinion amongst [[his]136-peyrol comrades]4517-his comrades was that [Ral]136-peyrol 's misanthropy was getting beyond all bounds . One day it dawned upon [him]136-peyrol clearly that [he]136-peyrol could not stand this . It affected [his]136-peyrol power of thinking . "[0-i] [I]0-i shall begin to talk nonsense to [people]287-people , " [he]136-peyrol said to [himself]136-peyrol . "[0-i] Has n't there been once [a poor devil who fell in love with a picture or a statue]1990-a poor devil who fell in love with a picture or a statue ? [He]1990-a poor devil who fell in love with a picture or a statue used to go and contemplate it . [His]1990-a poor devil who fell in love with a picture or a statue misfortune can not be compared with [mine]0-i ! Well , [I]0-i will go to look at [her]1991-her as at a picture too ; a picture as untouchable as if it had been under glass . " And [he]136-peyrol went on a visit to [Escampobar]30-escampobar at the very first opportunity . [He]136-peyrol made up for [himself]136-peyrol a repellent face , [he]136-peyrol clung to [Peyrol]136-peyrol for society , out there on the bench , both with [their]4518-their arms folded and gazing into space . But whenever [Arlette]121-arlette crossed [his]136-peyrol line of sight it was as if something had moved in [his]136-peyrol breast . Yet these visits made life just bearable ; they enabled [him]136-peyrol to attend to [his]136-peyrol work without beginning to talk nonsense to [people]287-people . [He]136-peyrol said to [himself]136-peyrol that [he]136-peyrol was strong enough to rise above temptation , that [he]136-peyrol would never overstep the line ; but it had happened to [him]136-peyrol upstairs in [[his]136-peyrol room]3498-his room at [the farm]2746-the farm , to weep tears of sheer tenderness while thinking of [his]136-peyrol fate . These tears would put out for a while the gnawing fire of [his]136-peyrol passion . [He]136-peyrol assumed austerity like an armour and in [his]136-peyrol prudence [he]136-peyrol , as a matter of fact , looked very seldom at [Arlette]121-arlette for fear of being caught in the act . The discovery that [she]121-arlette had taken to wandering at night had upset [him]136-peyrol all the same , because that sort of thing was unaccountable . It gave [him]136-peyrol a shock which unsettled , not [his]136-peyrol resolution , but [his]136-peyrol fortitude . That morning [he]136-peyrol had allowed [himself]136-peyrol , while [she]121-arlette was waiting on [him]136-peyrol , to be caught looking at [her]121-arlette and then , losing [his]136-peyrol self - control , had given [her]121-arlette that kiss on the hand . Directly [he]136-peyrol had done it [he]136-peyrol was appalled . [He]136-peyrol had overstepped the line . Under the circumstances this was an absolute moral disaster . The full consciousness of it came to [him]136-peyrol slowly . In fact this moment of fatal weakness was one of the reasons why [he]136-peyrol had let [himself]136-peyrol be sent off so unceremoniously by [Peyrol]136-peyrol to [Toulon]1-toulon . Even while crossing over [he]136-peyrol thought the only thing was not to come back any more . Yet while battling with [himself]136-peyrol [he]136-peyrol went on with the execution of the plan . A bitter irony presided over [his]136-peyrol dual state . Before leaving the Admiral who had received [him]136-peyrol in full uniform in [a room lighted by a single candle]4522-a room lighted by a single candle , [he]136-peyrol was suddenly moved to say : "[0-i] [I]0-i suppose if there is no other way [I]0-i am authorized to go [myself]0-i , " and [the Admiral]3016-the admiral had answered : "[0-i] [I]0-i did n't contemplate that , but if [you]1992-you are willing [I]0-i do n't see any objection . [I]0-i would only advise [you]1992-you to go in uniform in the character of [an officer entrusted with dispatches]1993-an officer entrusted with dispatches . But bear in mind that it would be a long captivity , and [you]1992-you must understand it might affect [your]1992-you promotion . " At the foot of the grand staircase in [the lighted hall of [the official building]4525-the official building]4524-the lighted hall of the official building [Ral]136-peyrol suddenly thought : "[1995-her] And now [I]0-i must go back to [Escampobar]30-escampobar . " Indeed [he]0-i had to go to [Escampobar]30-escampobar because the false dispatches were there in the valise [he]0-i had left behind . [He]0-i could n't go back to [the Admiral]3016-the admiral and explain that [he]0-i had lost [them]4527-them . "[0-i] This , in truth , is [my]0-i last visit for years - perhaps for life . " Going back in [the boat]2705-the boat , notwithstanding that the breeze was very light , [he]0-i would not let [the men]3164-the men take to the oars . [He]0-i did n't want to return before [the women]1227-the women had gone to bed . [He]0-i said to [himself]0-i that the proper and honest thing to do was not to see [Arlette]121-arlette again . [He]0-i even managed to persuade [himself]0-i that [his]0-i uncontrolled impulse had had no meaning for [that witless and unhappy creature]4535-that witless and unhappy creature . [She]121-arlette had neither started nor exclaimed ; [she]121-arlette had made no sign . [She]121-arlette had remained passive and then [she]121-arlette had backed away and sat down quietly . [He]0-i could not even remember that [she]121-arlette had coloured at all . As to [himself]0-i , [he]0-i had enough self - control to rise from the table and go out without looking at [her]121-arlette again . Neither did [she]121-arlette make a sign . What could startle that body without mind ? [She]121-arlette had made nothing of it , [he]0-i thought with self - contempt . "[0-i] Body without mind ! Body without mind ! " [he]0-i repeated with angry derision directed at [himself]0-i . And all at once [he]0-i thought : "[0-i] No . It is n't that . All in [her]1995-her is mystery , seduction , enchantment . " This thought wrung from [him]0-i a faint groan so that [the coxswain]3162-the coxswain asked respectfully : "[0-i] Are [you]0-i in pain , [lieutenant]888-lieutenant ? " "[0-i] It 's nothing , " [he]0-i muttered and set [his]0-i teeth with the desperation of [a man under torture]4537-a man under torture . By the time [he]0-i had left [Peyrol]136-peyrol and walked up [the stairs]4539-the stairs [his]0-i endurance was absolutely at an end . All [he]0-i wanted was to be alone . Going along the dark , [passage]4540-passage [he]0-i noticed that the door of [[Catherine]127-catherine 's room]4541-catherine 's room was standing ajar . But that did not arrest [his]0-i attention . " [He]0-i was so tired out that [he]0-i was almost unable to hold up [his]0-i head , and on going in [he]0-i did n't see [Arlette]121-arlette , who stood against the wall on one side of the window , out of the moonlight and in the darkest corner of [the room]413-the room . If [the whole house]4546-the whole house had fallen into ruins , bringing [him]0-i to the ground , [lie]0-i could not have been more overwhelmed and , in a manner , more utterly bereft of all [his]0-i senses . " A great square of moonlight lay on the floor . [He]0-i obeyed the tug like [a little child]1286-a little child . [She]121-arlette caught hold of [his]0-i other hand as it hung by [his]0-i side . [He]0-i was rigid all over , without joints , and it did not seem to [him]0-i that [he]0-i was breathing . "[174-eugne] [You]1997-you say nothing . [You]1997-you look ill . What is the matter ? Are [you]1997-you hurt ? " [She]121-arlette let go [his]0-i insensitive hands and began to feel [him]0-i all over for evidence of some injury . With [her]121-arlette hands clasped round [his]0-i neck [she]121-arlette hung back a little . [Her]121-arlette little even teeth gleamed , [her]121-arlette black eyes , immensely profound , looked into [his]0-i , not with a transport of passion or fear but with a sort of reposeful satisfaction , with a searching and appropriating expression . [He]0-i came back to life with a low and reckless exclamation , felt horribly insecure at once as if [he]0-i were standing on a lofty pinnacle above a noise as of breaking waves in [[his]0-i cars]4549-his cars , in fear lest [her]121-arlette fingers should part and [she]121-arlette would fall off and be lost to [him]0-i for ever . [He]0-i flung [his]0-i arms round [her]121-arlette waist and hugged [her]121-arlette close to [his]0-i breast . [He]0-i looked at [her]121-arlette head resting on [his]0-i shoulder . [Her]121-arlette eyes were closed and the expression of [her]121-arlette unsmiling face was that of a delightful dream , something infinitely ethereal , peaceful and , as it were , eternal . Its appeal pierced [his]0-i heart with a pointed sweetness . "[1999-she] [She]1999-she is exquisite . It 's a miracle , " [he]0-i thought with a snort of terror . "[1999-she] It 's impossible . " [She]121-arlette made a movement to disengage [herself]121-arlette , and instinctively [he]0-i resisted , pressing [her]121-arlette closer to [his]0-i breast . "[0-i] [Ral]136-peyrol , turning [his]136-peyrol face to the darkest part of [the room]413-the room , seemed to see the spectre of fatality awaiting its time to move forward and crush that calm , confident joy . " [I]2007-you thought this . "[2007-you] " But what did [you]2007-you think of [my]136-peyrol conduct at times ? [You]2007-you see , [I]136-peyrol did not know what was going to be . "[136-peyrol] " [You]2007-you went about with a little smile , "[136-peyrol] [he]136-peyrol whispered , as one would mention an inconceivable marvel . " [I]121-arlette was warm and quiet , "[121-arlette] murmured [Arlette]121-arlette , as if on the borders of dreamland . Tender murmurs flowed from [her]121-arlette lips describing a state of blissful tranquillity in phrases that sounded like the veriest nonsense , incredible , convincing and soothing to [Ral]136-peyrol 's conscience . " [You]2007-you were perfect , "[121-arlette] it went on . " Whenever [you]2007-you came near [me]121-arlette everything seemed different . "[121-arlette] " What do [you]2007-you mean ? That [Peyrol]136-peyrol - [he]136-peyrol is terrible . " [He]136-peyrol was struck by the tone of awe , by its profound conviction . " flashed through that stillness and lost itself in it like a spark flying in an everlasting night . The only result of it was the tightening of [his]136-peyrol hold on [Arlette]121-arlette . " [Catherine]127-catherine , who had been listening to [their]2028-they murmurs , could not bear the long silence . " But when at last [she]2031-her moved [he]136-peyrol seized [her]2031-her again and held [her]2031-her as if [she]2031-her had been [his]136-peyrol very life . " [he]136-peyrol asked in a scared tone . [She]2031-her stopped to answer [him]136-peyrol over [her]2031-her shoulder . "[2031-her] [I]0-i laughed because [I]0-i thought of all the days to come . And [he]136-peyrol was glad to have something to hold on to . [She]2031-her slipped out with a soft rustle of [her]2031-her silk skirt , but before [he]136-peyrol had time to close the door behind [her]2031-her [she]2031-her put back [her]2031-her arm for an instant . [He]136-peyrol had just time to press the palm of [her]2031-her hand to [his]136-peyrol lips . It was cool . [She]2031-her snatched it away and [he]136-peyrol had the strength of mind to shut the door after [her]2031-her . [He]136-peyrol felt like [a man chained to the wall and dying of thirst , from whom a cold drink]4577-a man chained to the wall and dying of thirst , from whom a cold drink is snatched away . [The room]413-the room became dark suddenly . [He]136-peyrol thought , "[2031-her] A cloud over the moon , a cloud over the moon , an enormous cloud , " while [he]136-peyrol walked rigidly to the window , insecure and swaying as if on a tight rope . After a moment [he]136-peyrol perceived the moon in a sky on which there was no sign of the smallest cloud anywhere . [He]136-peyrol said to [himself]136-peyrol , "[0-i] [I]0-i suppose [I]0-i nearly died just now . But no , " [he]136-peyrol went on thinking with deliberate cruelty , "[2031-her] Oh , no , [I]0-i shall not die . [I]0-i shall only suffer , suffer , suffer . . . . " "[0-i] Suffer , suffer . " Only by stumbling against the side of the bed did [he]136-peyrol discover that [he]136-peyrol had gone away from the window . At once [he]136-peyrol flung [himself]136-peyrol violently on the bed with [his]136-peyrol face buried in the pillow , which [he]136-peyrol bit to restrain the cry of distress about to burst through [his]136-peyrol lips . Natures schooled into insensibility when once overcome by a mastering passion are like vanquished giants ready for despair . [He]136-peyrol , [a man on service]4579-a man on service , felt [himself]136-peyrol shrinking from death and that doubt contained in itself all possible doubts of [his]136-peyrol own fortitude . The only thing [he]136-peyrol knew was that [he]136-peyrol would be gone to - morrow morning . [He]136-peyrol shuddered along [his]136-peyrol whole extended length , then lay still gripping a handful of bedclothes in each hand to prevent [himself]136-peyrol from leaping up in panicky restlessness . [He]136-peyrol was saying to [himself]136-peyrol pedantically , "[0-i] [I]0-i must lie down and rest , [I]0-i must rest to have strength for to - morrow , [I]0-i must rest , " while the tremendous struggle to keep still broke out in waves of perspiration on [his]136-peyrol forehead . At last sudden oblivion must have descended on [him]136-peyrol because [he]136-peyrol turned over and sat up suddenly with the sound of the word "[0-i] Ecoutez " in [his]136-peyrol ears . [He]136-peyrol was hungry . [He]136-peyrol had been up all night and had even had a conversation with [Citizen Scevola]123-scevola . [He]136-peyrol had also done some work with [Michel]150-michel after daylight ; however , there had not been much to do because the tartane was always kept ready for [sea]228-sea . While [he]136-peyrol enjoyed [his]136-peyrol coffee [he]136-peyrol listened without any signs of surprise to [Catherine]127-catherine 's comments upon the disappearance of [Scevola]123-scevola . [She]127-catherine had looked into [[his]136-peyrol den]4593-his den . [He]136-peyrol had not slept on [[his]136-peyrol pallet]4594-his pallet last night , of that [she]127-catherine was certain , and [he]136-peyrol was nowhere to be seen , not even in [the most distant field]4595-the most distant field , from the points of vantage around [the farm]2746-the farm . It was inconceivable that [he]136-peyrol should have slipped away to [Madrague]58-madrague , where [he]136-peyrol disliked to go , or to [the village]497-the village , where [he]136-peyrol was afraid to go . [Peyrol]136-peyrol remarked that whatever happened to [him]136-peyrol [he]136-peyrol was no great loss , but [Catherine]127-catherine was not to be soothed . "[136-peyrol] It frightens [a body]2048-a body , " [she]127-catherine said . "[136-peyrol] [He]2049-he may be hiding somewhere to jump on one treacherously . [You]2050-you know what [I]0-i mean , [Peyrol]136-peyrol . " "[0-i] Well , [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant will have nothing to fear , as [he]2881-the lieutenant 's going away . As to [myself]0-i , [Scevola]123-scevola and [I]0-i are [good friends]2052-good friends . [I]0-i had a long talk with [him]2881-the lieutenant quite recently . [[You]2050-you two women]2053-you two women can manage [him]2881-the lieutenant perfectly ; and then , who knows , perhaps [he]2881-the lieutenant has gone away for good . " [Catherine]127-catherine stared at [him]2881-the lieutenant , if such a word as stare can be applied to a profound contemplative gaze . "[2881-the lieutenant] [The lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant has nothing to fear from [him]2881-the lieutenant , " [she]127-catherine repeated cautiously . "[2881-the lieutenant] No , [he]2881-the lieutenant is going away . Did n't [you]136-peyrol know it ? " [The old woman]1151-the old woman continued to look at [him]2881-the lieutenant profoundly . "[136-peyrol] Yes , [he]2881-the lieutenant is on service . " For another minute or so [Catherine]127-catherine continued silent in [her]127-catherine contemplative attitude . Then [her]127-catherine hesitation came to an end . [She]127-catherine could not resist the desire to inform [Peyrol]136-peyrol of the events of the night . As [she]127-catherine went on [Peyrol]136-peyrol forgot the half - full bowl of coffee and [his]136-peyrol half - eaten piece of bread . [Catherine]127-catherine 's voice flowed with austerity . [She]127-catherine stood there , imposing and solemn like [a peasant - priestess]4599-a peasant - priestess . The relation of what had been to [her]127-catherine a soul - shaking experience did not take much time , and [she]127-catherine finished with the words , "[136-peyrol] [The lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant is [an honest man]1955-an honest man . " And after a pause [she]127-catherine insisted further : "[1955-an honest man] There is no denying it . [He]2881-the lieutenant has acted like [an honest man]1955-an honest man . " For a moment longer [Peyrol]136-peyrol continued to look at the coffee in the bowl , then without warning got up with such violence that the chair behind [him]136-peyrol was thrown back upon the flagstones . "[2881-the lieutenant] Where is [he]2881-the lieutenant , [that honest man]2058-that honest man ? " [he]136-peyrol shouted suddenly in stentorian tones which not only caused [Catherine]127-catherine to raise [her]127-catherine hands , but frightened [himself]136-peyrol , and [he]136-peyrol dropped at once to a mere forcible utterance . "[2881-the lieutenant] Where is [that man]495-that man ? Let [me]0-i see [him]495-that man . " Even [Catherine]127-catherine 's hieratic composure was disturbed . "[0-i] Why , " [she]127-catherine said , looking really disconcerted , "[0-i] [he]495-that man will be down here directly . This bowl of coffee is for [him]495-that man . " [Peyrol]136-peyrol made as if to leave [the kitchen]645-the kitchen , but [Catherine]127-catherine stopped [him]136-peyrol . "[128-peyrol] For God 's sake , [Monsieur Peyrol]128-peyrol , " [she]127-catherine said , half in entreaty and half in command , "[128-peyrol] do n't wake up [the child]1284-the child . Let [her]1284-the child sleep . Oh , let [her]1284-the child sleep ! Do n't wake [her]1284-the child up . [God]153-god only knows how long it is since [she]1284-the child has slept properly . [I]0-i could not tell [you]128-peyrol . [I]0-i dare n't think of it . " [She]127-catherine was shocked by hearing [Peyrol]128-peyrol declare : "[0-i] All this is confounded nonsense . " But [he]128-peyrol sat down again , seemed to catch sight of the coffee bowl and emptied what was left in it down [his]128-peyrol throat . "[0-i] [I]0-i do n't want [her]1284-the child on [my]0-i hands more crazy than [she]1284-the child has been before , " said [Catherine]127-catherine , in a sort of exasperation but in a very low tone . This phrase in its selfish form expressed a real and profound compassion for [[her]127-catherine niece]3379-her niece . [She]127-catherine dreaded the moment when [that fatal Arlette]121-arlette would wake up and the dreadful complications of life which [her]121-arlette slumbers had suspended would have to be picked up again . [Peyrol]128-peyrol fidgeted on [his]128-peyrol seat . "[0-i] And so [he]128-peyrol told [you]0-i [he]128-peyrol was going ? [He]128-peyrol actually did tell [you]0-i that ? " [he]128-peyrol asked . "[128-peyrol] [He]128-peyrol promised to go before [the child]1284-the child wakes up . . . . At once . " "[128-peyrol] But , sacr nom d'un chien , there is never any wind before eleven o'clock , " [Peyrol]128-peyrol exclaimed in a tone of profound annoyance , yet trying to moderate [his]128-peyrol voice , while [Catherine]127-catherine , indulgent to [his]128-peyrol changing moods , only compressed [her]127-catherine lips and nodded at [him]128-peyrol soothingly . "[128-peyrol] It is impossible to work with [people like that]2062-people like that , " [he]128-peyrol mumbled . "[2062-people like that] Do [you]0-i know , [Monsieur Peyrol]128-peyrol , that [she]1284-the child has been to see [the priest]852-the priest ? " [Catherine]127-catherine was heard suddenly , towering above [her]127-catherine end of the table . [The two women]4602-the two women had had a talk before [Arlette]121-arlette had been induced by [[her]121-arlette aunt]3529-her aunt to lie down . [Peyrol]128-peyrol gave a start . "[1284-the child] What ? [Priest]2064-priest ? . . . Now look here , [Catherine]127-catherine , " [he]128-peyrol went on with repressed ferocity , "[127-catherine] do [you]127-catherine imagine that all this interests [me]0-i in the least ? " "[127-catherine] [I]0-i can think of nothing but [that niece of [mine]0-i]2065-that niece of mine . [She]127-catherine seemed to be thinking aloud , but noticed that [Peyrol]136-peyrol was listening with attention . "[2064-priest] [He]2064-priest wanted to shut [her]2065-that niece of mine up from [everybody]277-everybody , " and [the old woman]1151-the old woman clasped [her]1151-the old woman meagre hands with a sudden gesture . [I]0-i do n't know much about these things , though [I]0-i have seen [some nuns]2075-some nuns in [my]0-i time , and [some very queer ones]2076-some very queer ones too , but it seems to [me]0-i that [they]2075-some nuns do n't take [crazy people]2077-crazy people into [convents]2078-convents . Do n't [you]0-i be afraid . [I]0-i tell [you]0-i that . " [He]136-peyrol stopped because the inner door of [the kitchen]645-the kitchen came open and [Lieutenant Ral]136-peyrol stepped in . [His]136-peyrol sword hung on [his]136-peyrol forearm by the belt , [his]136-peyrol hat was on [his]136-peyrol head . Then [he]136-peyrol came up to the table . [Peyrol]136-peyrol , who had kept [his]136-peyrol eyes on [him]136-peyrol , thought : "[0-i] Here is [one who looks like a moth scorched in the fire]2079-one who looks like a moth scorched in the fire . " [Ral]136-peyrol 's eyes were sunk , [his]136-peyrol cheeks seemed hollowed and the whole face had an arid and dry aspect . "[2079-one who looks like a moth scorched in the fire] Well , [you]0-i are in a fine state for the work of deceiving [the enemy]627-the enemy , " [Peyrol]136-peyrol observed . "[0-i] Why , to look at [you]0-i , [nobody]2665-nobody would believe a word [you]0-i said . [You]0-i are not going to be ill , [I]0-i hope . [You]0-i are on service . " [He]0-i snatched it from [Catherine]127-catherine 's hand , poured some brandy into [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant 's coffee , pushed the bowl towards [him]0-i and waited . "[0-i] Nom de nom ! " [he]0-i said forcibly , "[0-i] do n't [you]0-i know what this is for ? It 's for [you]0-i to drink . " [Ral]136-peyrol obeyed with a strange , automatic docility . "[0-i] And now , " said [Peyrol]136-peyrol , getting up , "[0-i] [I]0-i will go to [[my]0-i room]847-my room and shave . " Till then [Ral]136-peyrol had not uttered a word , but directly the door closed behind [Peyrol]136-peyrol [he]136-peyrol raised [his]136-peyrol head . "[127-catherine] [Catherine]127-catherine ! " [His]136-peyrol voice was like a rustle in [his]136-peyrol throat . " "[127-catherine] Yes , [[my]0-i good Monsieur]2085-my good monsieur , " said [Catherine]127-catherine in an unmoved voice but clasping [her]127-catherine hands convulsively . "[127-catherine] There is nothing else [I]0-i would dare tell [her]127-catherine ! " "[127-catherine] [She]127-catherine will believe [you]0-i , " whispered [Ral]136-peyrol wildly . "[127-catherine] Yes ! [She]127-catherine will believe [me]0-i , " repeated [Catherine]127-catherine in a mournful tone . [Ral]136-peyrol got up , put the sword - belt over [his]136-peyrol head , picked up the valise . There was a little flush on [his]136-peyrol cheeks . "[127-catherine] Adieu , " [he]136-peyrol said to [the silent old woman]4607-the silent old woman . [She]4607-the silent old woman made no answer , but as [he]136-peyrol turned away [she]4607-the silent old woman raised [her]4607-the silent old woman hand a little , hesitated , and let it fall again . It seemed to [her]4607-the silent old woman that [the women of [Escampobar]30-escampobar]4608-the women of escampobar had been singled out for divine wrath . [[Her]4607-the silent old woman niece]3379-her niece appeared to [her]4607-the silent old woman like [the scapegoat charged with all the murders and blasphemies of the Revolution]4610-the scapegoat charged with all the murders and blasphemies of the revolution . [She]4607-the silent old woman [herself]4607-the silent old woman too had been cast out from the grace of [God]153-god . But that had been a long time ago . [She]4607-the silent old woman had made [her]4607-the silent old woman peace with [Heaven]194-heaven since . Again [she]4607-the silent old woman raised [her]4607-the silent old woman hand and , this time , made in the air the sign of the cross at the back of [Lieutenant Ral]136-peyrol . Meanwhile [upstairs Peyrol]136-peyrol , scraping [his]136-peyrol big flat cheek with an English razor - blade at the window , saw [Lieutenant Ral]136-peyrol on the path to [the shore]231-the shore ; and high above there , commanding a vast view of [sea and land]4612-sea and land , [he]136-peyrol shrugged [his]136-peyrol shoulders impatiently with no visible provocation . [One]2670-one could not trust [those epaulette - wearers]3555-those epaulette - wearers . [They]3555-those epaulette - wearers would cram [a fellow]1369-a fellow 's head with notions either for [their]3555-those epaulette - wearers own sake or for the sake of the service . Still , [he]136-peyrol was too old a bird to be caught with chaff ; and besides , [that long - legged stiff beggar going down [the path]483-the path with all [his]136-peyrol officer]4616-that long - legged stiff beggar going down the path with all his officer airs , was honest enough . At any rate [he]136-peyrol knew [a seaman]2825-a seaman when [he]136-peyrol saw [one]2670-one , though [he]136-peyrol was as cold - blooded as a fish . [Peyrol]136-peyrol had a smile which was a little awry . Cleaning the razor - blade one of a set of twelve in a case [he]136-peyrol had a vision of [a brilliantly hazy ocean]4620-a brilliantly hazy ocean and [an English Indiaman]4621-an english indiaman with [her]4621-an english indiaman yards braced all ways , [her]4621-an english indiaman canvas blowing loose above [her]4621-an english indiaman bloodstained decks overrun by a lot of [privateersmen]4622-privateersmen and with [the island of [Ceylon]91-ceylon]4623-the island of ceylon swelling like a thin blue cloud on the far horizon . [He]136-peyrol had always wished to own a set of English blades and there [he]136-peyrol had got it , fell over it as it were , lying on the floor of [a cabin which had been already ransacked]4624-a cabin which had been already ransacked . "[127-catherine] For good steel - it was good steel , " [he]136-peyrol thought looking at the blade fixedly . And there it was , nearly worn out . [The others]3246-the others too . That steel ! And here [he]136-peyrol was holding the case in [his]136-peyrol hand as though [he]136-peyrol had just picked it up from the floor . Same case . [Same man]4626-same man . And the steel worn out . [He]136-peyrol shut the case brusquely , flung it into [his]136-peyrol sea - chest which was standing open , and slammed the lid down . The feeling which was in [his]136-peyrol breast and had been known to [more articulate men]4627-more articulate men than [himself]136-peyrol , was that life was a dream less substantial than the vision of [Ceylon]91-ceylon lying like a cloud on [the sea]281-the sea . Dream left astern . Dream straight ahead . This disenchanted philosophy took the shape of fierce swearing . "[127-catherine] Sacr nom de nom de nom . . . . [Tonnerre de bon Dieu]2086-tonnerre de bon dieu ! " While tying [his]136-peyrol neckcloth [he]136-peyrol handled it with fury as though [he]136-peyrol meant to strangle [himself]136-peyrol with it . [He]136-peyrol rammed a soft cap on to [his]136-peyrol venerable locks recklessly , seized [his]136-peyrol cudgel - but before leaving [the room]413-the room walked up to the window giving on the east . [He]136-peyrol could not see [the Petite Passe]34-the petite passe on account of [the lookout hill]4215-the lookout hill , but to the left [a great portion of [the Hyres roadstead]2962-the hyres roadstead]4631-a great portion of the hyres roadstead lay spread out before [him]136-peyrol , pale grey in the morning light , with [the land about [Cape Blanc]93-cape blanc]4633-the land about cape blanc swelling in the distance with all its details blurred as yet and only one conspicuous object presenting to [his]136-peyrol sight something that might have been a lighthouse by its shape , but which [Peyrol]136-peyrol knew very well was the English corvette already under way and with all [her]4634-her canvas set . This sight pleased [Peyrol]136-peyrol mainly because [he]136-peyrol had expected it . [The Englishman]1614-the englishman was doing exactly what [he]136-peyrol had expected [he]136-peyrol would do , and [Peyrol]136-peyrol looked towards [the English cruiser]4636-the english cruiser with a smile of malicious triumph as if [he]136-peyrol were confronting [[her]4634-her captain]2941-her captain . For some reason or other [he]136-peyrol imagined [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent as long - faced , with yellow teeth and a wig , whereas [that officer]291-that officer wore [his]291-that officer own hair and had a set of teeth which would have done honour to [a London belle]4639-a london belle and was really the hidden cause of [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent appearing so often wreathed in smiles . [That ship]987-that ship at this great distance and steering in [his]136-peyrol direction held [Peyrol]136-peyrol at the window long enough for the increasing light of the morning to burst into sunshine , colouring and filling - in the flat outline of [the land]386-the land with tints of wood and rock and field , with clear dots of [buildings]4642-buildings enlivening the view . The sun threw a sort of halo around [the ship]2931-the ship . Recollecting [himself]136-peyrol , [Peyrol]136-peyrol left [the room]413-the room and shut the door quietly . Quietly too [he]136-peyrol descended the stairs from [[his]136-peyrol garret]4645-his garret . On [the landing]4113-the landing [he]136-peyrol underwent a short inward struggle , at the end of which [he]136-peyrol approached the door of [[Catherine]127-catherine 's room]4541-catherine 's room and opening it a little , put [his]136-peyrol head in . Across the whole width of [it]4541-catherine 's room [he]136-peyrol saw [Arlette]121-arlette fast asleep . [[Her]121-arlette aunt]3529-her aunt had thrown a light coverlet over [her]121-arlette . [Her]121-arlette low shoes stood at the foot of the bed . [Her]121-arlette black hair lay loose on the pillow ; and [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's gaze became arrested by the long eyelashes on [her]121-arlette pale cheek . Suddenly [he]136-peyrol fancied [she]121-arlette moved , and [he]136-peyrol withdrew [his]136-peyrol head sharply , pulling the door to . [He]136-peyrol listened for a moment as if tempted to open it again , but judging it too risky , continued on [his]136-peyrol way [downstairs]772-downstairs . At [his]136-peyrol reappearance in [the kitchen]645-the kitchen [Catherine]127-catherine turned sharply . [She]127-catherine was dressed for the day , with a big white cap on [her]127-catherine head , a black bodice and a brown skirt with ample folds . "[2086-tonnerre de bon dieu] And [Michel]150-michel too has not been [here]2715-here yet . " [Peyrol]136-peyrol thought that if [she]127-catherine had been only shorter , what with [her]127-catherine black eyes and slightly curved nose [she]127-catherine would have looked like [a witch]4651-a witch . But [witches]4652-witches can read [people]287-people 's thoughts , and [he]0-i looked openly at [Catherine]127-catherine with the pleasant conviction that [she]127-catherine could not read [his]0-i thoughts . [He]0-i continued : "[127-catherine] [You]127-catherine will be alone all the morning . " [She]127-catherine seemed to be listening to some distant sound , and after [Peyrol]136-peyrol had added , "[127-catherine] Everything is all right now , " [she]127-catherine nodded and after a moment said in a manner that for [her]127-catherine was unexpectedly impulsive : "[128-peyrol] [Monsieur Peyrol]128-peyrol , [I]0-i am tired of life . " [He]136-peyrol shrugged [his]136-peyrol shoulders and with somewhat sinister jocosity remarked : "[0-i] [I]0-i will tell [you]127-catherine what it is ; [you]127-catherine ought to have been married . " [She]127-catherine turned [her]127-catherine back on [him]136-peyrol abruptly . "[0-i] No offence , " [Peyrol]128-peyrol excused [himself]128-peyrol in a tone of gloom rather than of apology . "[195-phew] It is no use to attach any importance to things . What is this life ? [Phew]195-phew ! [Nobody]2665-nobody can remember one - tenth of it . Here [I]0-i am ; and , [you]127-catherine know , [I]0-i would bet that if [one of [[my]0-i old - time chums]2092-my old - time chums]2091-one of my old - time chums came along and saw [me]0-i like this , here with [you]127-catherine - [I]0-i mean [one of those chums that stand up for [a fellow]1369-a fellow in a scrimmage and look after [him]1369-a fellow should [he]1369-a fellow be hurt]2093-one of those chums that stand up for a fellow in a scrimmage and look after him should he be hurt - well , [I]0-i bet , " [he]0-i repeated , "[2091-one of my old - time chums] [he]2091-one of my old - time chums would n't know [me]0-i . " "[0-i] [He]0-i paused . [Peyrol]128-peyrol , however , continued , though [his]128-peyrol tone was very far from being that of idle talk : " But [you]127-catherine see , [Mademoiselle Catherine]127-catherine , [you]127-catherine were not like [the others]3246-the others . "[128-peyrol] [Her]127-catherine long thin frame , bent low to work the bellows under the enormous overmantel , [she]127-catherine assented : " Perhaps ! [[We]4657-we Escampobar women]4658-we escampobar women were always hard on [ourselves]4657-we . "[127-catherine] " That 's what [I]127-catherine say . "[127-catherine] " But [[you]127-catherine [men]423-men]4659-you men , [you]127-catherine are different . lt does n't matter what [you]127-catherine do .
