"[2096-he] [He]2096-he remained looking at [her]127-catherine searchingly with something like a hint of a smile on [his]2096-he shaven lips , but [she]127-catherine turned away to the sink where [one of [the women working about]2098-the women working about [the farm]2746-the farm]2097-one of the women working about the farm had deposited a great pile of vegetables . [She]127-catherine started on them with a broken - bladed knife , preserving [her]127-catherine sibylline air even in that homely occupation . " It will be a good soup , [I]822-the rover see , at noon to - day , "[822-the rover] said [the rover]822-the rover suddenly . [He]2096-he turned on [his]2096-he heels and went out through [the salle]782-the salle . [The whole world]354-the whole world lay open to [him]2096-he , or at any rate [the whole of [the Mediterranean]59-the mediterranean]2103-the whole of the mediterranean , viewed down [the ravine]480-the ravine between [the two hills]2105-the two hills . The bell of [the farm]2746-the farm 's milch - cow , which had a talent for keeping [herself]2107-herself invisible , reached [him]2096-he from the right , but [he]2096-he could not see as much as the tips of [her]2107-herself horns , though [he]2096-he looked for them . [He]2096-he stepped out sturdily . [He]2096-he had not gone twenty yards down [the ravine]480-the ravine when another sound made [him]2096-he stand still as if changed into stone . It was a faint noise resembling very much the hollow rumble [an empty farm - cart]2109-an empty farm - cart would make on [a stony road]2110-a stony road , but [Peyrol]128-peyrol looked up at the sky , and though it was perfectly clear , [he]2096-he did not seem pleased with its aspect . [He]2096-he had [a hill on each side of [him]2096-he]2111-a hill on each side of him and [the placid cove]2112-the placid cove below [his]2096-he feet . [He]2096-he muttered " H'm ! Thunder at sunrise . It must be in [the west]4661-the west . It only wanted that ! "[2096-he] [He]2096-he feared it would first kill the little breeze there was and then knock the weather up altogether . For a moment all [his]2096-he faculties seemed paralyzed by that faint sound . On [that sea]2113-that sea ruled by [the gods of Olympus]2114-the gods of olympus [he]2096-he might have been [a pagan mariner]2115-a pagan mariner subject to [Jupiter]198-jupiter 's caprices ; but like [a defiant pagan]2116-a defiant pagan [he]2096-he shook [his]2096-he fist vaguely at space which answered [him]2096-he by a short and threatening mutter . Then [he]2096-he swung on [his]2096-he way till [he]2096-he caught sight of the two mastheads of [the tartane]350-the tartane , when [he]2096-he stopped to listen . No sound of any sort reached [him]2096-he from there , and [he]2096-he went on [his]2096-he way thinking , " Go from one thing to another thoughtlessly ! Indeed ! . . . That 's all [old Catherine]127-catherine knows about it . "[2096-he] [He]2096-he had so many things to think of that [he]2096-he did not know which to lay hold of first . [He]2096-he just let them lie jumbled up in [his]2096-he head . [His]2096-he feelings too were in a state of confusion , and vaguely [he]2096-he felt that [his]2096-he conduct was at the mercy of an internal conflict . The consciousness of that fact accounted perhaps for [his]2096-he sardonic attitude towards [himself]2096-he and outwardly towards [those whom [he]2096-he perceived on board [the tartane]350-the tartane]2118-those whom he perceived on board the tartane ; and especially towards [the lieutenant whom [he]2096-he saw sitting on [the deck]351-the deck leaning against the head of the rudder , characteristically aloof from [the two other persons on board]2122-the two other persons on board]2120-the lieutenant whom he saw sitting on the deck leaning against the head of the rudder , characteristically aloof from the two other persons on board . [Michel]150-michel , also characteristically , was standing on the top of [the little cabin scuttle]2123-the little cabin scuttle , obviously looking out for [his]150-michel " matre . "[150-michel] [Citizen Scevola]123-scevola , sitting on [deck]3083-deck , seemed at first sight to be at liberty , but as a matter of fact [he]123-scevola was not . [He]123-scevola was loosely tied up to a stanchion by three turns of the mainsheet with the knot in such a position that [he]123-scevola could not get at it without attracting attention ; and that situation seemed also somewhat characteristic of [Citizen Scevola]123-scevola with its air of half liberty , half suspicion and , as it were , contemptuous restraint . [The sans - culotte]571-the sans - culotte , whose late experiences had nearly unsettled [his]571-the sans - culotte reason , first by [their]2126-their utter incomprehensibility and afterwards by the enigmatical attitude of [Peyrol]128-peyrol , had dropped [his]571-the sans - culotte head and folded [his]571-the sans - culotte arms on [his]571-the sans - culotte breast . And that attitude was dubious too . It might have been resignation or it might have been profound sleep . [The rover]822-the rover addressed [himself]822-the rover first to [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant . " Le moment approche , "[128-peyrol] said [Peyrol]128-peyrol with a queer twitch at a corner of [his]128-peyrol lip , while under [his]128-peyrol soft woollen cap [his]128-peyrol venerable locks stirred in the breath of a suddenly warm air . " The great moment - eh ? "[128-peyrol] [He]128-peyrol leaned over the big tiller , and seemed to be hovering above [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant 's shoulder . " What 's this infernal company ? "[1154-the latter] murmured [the latter]1154-the latter without even looking at [Peyrol]128-peyrol . " [All old friends]4662-all old friends - quoi ? "[128-peyrol] said [Peyrol]128-peyrol in a homely tone . " [We]4662-all old friends will keep that little affair amongst [ourselves]4662-all old friends . [The fewer]4663-the fewer [the men]3164-the men the greater the glory . [Catherine]127-catherine is getting the vegetables ready for the noonday soup and [the Englishman]1614-the englishman is coming down towards [the Passe]3794-the passe where [he]1614-the englishman will arrive about noon too , ready to have [his]1614-the englishman eye put out . [You]2881-the lieutenant know , [lieutenant]888-lieutenant , that will be [your]2881-the lieutenant job . [You]2881-the lieutenant may depend on [me]128-peyrol for sending [you]2881-the lieutenant off when the moment comes . For what is it to [you]2881-the lieutenant ? [You]2881-the lieutenant have [no friends]1961-no friends , [you]2881-the lieutenant have not even [a petite amie]4669-a petite amie . As to expecting [an old rover like [me]128-peyrol]4670-an old rover like me - oh no , [lieutenant]888-lieutenant ! Of course liberty is sweet , but what do [you]2881-the lieutenant know of it , [[you]2881-the lieutenant epaulette - [wearers]4673-wearers]4672-you epaulette - wearers ? Moreover , [I]128-peyrol am no good for quarter - deck talks and all that politeness . "[128-peyrol] " [I]136-peyrol wish , [Peyrol]128-peyrol , [you]128-peyrol would not talk so much , "[136-peyrol] said [Lieutenant Ral]136-peyrol , turning [his]136-peyrol head slightly . [He]136-peyrol was struck by the strange expression on [the old rover]790-the old rover 's face . " And [I]136-peyrol do n't see what the actual moment matters . [I]136-peyrol am going to look for [the fleet]220-the fleet . All [you]128-peyrol have to do is to hoist the sails for [me]136-peyrol and then scramble [ashore]1002-ashore . "[136-peyrol] " Very simple , "[128-peyrol] observed [Peyrol]128-peyrol through [his]128-peyrol teeth , and then began to sing : " Quoique leurs chapeaux sont bien laids God - dam ! Moi , j'aime les Anglais Ils ont un si bon caractre ! "[128-peyrol] " H ! Citoyen ! "[136-peyrol] and then remarked confidentially to [Ral]136-peyrol : " [He]790-the old rover is n't asleep , [you]136-peyrol know , but [he]790-the old rover is n't like [the English]544-the english , [he]790-the old rover has a sacr mauvais caractre . [He]790-the old rover got into [his]790-the old rover head , "[128-peyrol] continued [Peyrol]128-peyrol , in a loud and innocent tone , " that [you]136-peyrol locked [him]790-the old rover up in [this cabin]4677-this cabin last night . Did [you]136-peyrol notice the venomous glance [he]790-the old rover gave [you]136-peyrol just now ? "[128-peyrol] Both [Lieutenant Ral]136-peyrol and [the innocent Michel]150-michel appeared surprised at [his]128-peyrol boisterousness ; but all the time [Peyrol]136-peyrol was thinking : " [I]136-peyrol wish to goodness [I]136-peyrol knew how that thunderstorm is getting on and what course it is shaping . [I]136-peyrol ca n't find that out unless [I]136-peyrol go up to [the farm]2746-the farm and get a view to [the westward]4679-the westward . [It]4680-it may be as far as [the Rhne Valley]94-the rhne valley ; no doubt it is and it will come out of [it]94-the rhne valley too , curses on it . [One]2670-one wo n't be able to reckon on half an hour of steady wind from any quarter . "[136-peyrol] [He]136-peyrol directed a look of ironic gaiety at all the faces in turn . [Michel]150-michel met it with a faithful - dog gaze and innocently open mouth . [Scevola]123-scevola kept [his]123-scevola chin buried on [his]123-scevola chest . [Lieutenant Ral]136-peyrol was insensible to outward impressions and [his]136-peyrol absent stare made nothing of [Peyrol]136-peyrol . [The rover]822-the rover [himself]822-the rover presently fell into thought . The last stir of air died out in [the little basin]3492-the little basin , and the sun clearing Porquerolles inundated [it]3492-the little basin with a sudden light in which [Michel]150-michel blinked like an owl . " It 's hot early , "[150-michel] [he]150-michel announced aloud but only because [he]150-michel had formed the habit of talking to [himself]150-michel . [He]150-michel would not have presumed to offer an opinion unless asked by [Peyrol]136-peyrol . [His]150-michel voice having recalled [Peyrol]136-peyrol to [himself]150-michel , [he]150-michel proposed to masthead [the yards]2134-the yards and even asked [Lieutenant Ral]136-peyrol to help in that operation which was accomplished in silence except for the faint squeaking of the blocks . The sails , however , were kept hauled up in the gear . " Like this , "[136-peyrol] said [Peyrol]136-peyrol , " [you]4682-you have only to let go the ropes and [you]4682-you will be under canvas at once . "[136-peyrol] Without answering [Ral]136-peyrol returned to [his]136-peyrol position by the rudder - head . [He]150-michel was saying to [himself]150-michel - " [I]150-michel am sneaking off . No , there is honour , duty . And of course [I]150-michel will return . But when ? [They]4683-they will forget all about [me]150-michel and [I]150-michel shall never be exchanged . This war may last for years , - "[150-michel] and illogically [he]150-michel wished [he]150-michel could have had [a God]2135-a god to whom [he]150-michel could pray for relief in [his]150-michel anguish . " [She]121-arlette will be in despair , "[150-michel] [he]150-michel thought , writhing inwardly at the mental picture of [a distracted Arlette]121-arlette . Life , however , had embittered [his]150-michel spirit early , and [he]150-michel said to [himself]150-michel : " But in a month 's time will [she]121-arlette even give [me]150-michel a thought ? "[150-michel] Instantly [he]150-michel felt remorseful with a remorse strong enough to lift [him]150-michel to [his]150-michel feet as if [he]150-michel were morally obliged to go up again and confess to [Arlette]121-arlette this sacrilegious cynicism of thought . " [I]150-michel am mad , "[150-michel] [he]150-michel muttered , perching [himself]150-michel on the low rail . [His]150-michel lapse from faith plunged [him]150-michel into such a depth of unhappiness that [he]150-michel felt all [his]150-michel strength of will go out of [him]150-michel . [He]150-michel sat there apathetic and suffering . [He]150-michel meditated dully : " [Young men]4684-young men have been known to die suddenly ; why should not [I]150-michel ? [I]150-michel am , as a matter of fact , at the end of [my]150-michel endurance . [I]150-michel am half dead already . Yes ! but what is left of that life does not belong to [me]150-michel now . "[150-michel] " [Peyrol]136-peyrol , "[150-michel] [he]150-michel said in such a piercing tone that even [Scevola]123-scevola jerked [his]123-scevola head up ; but [he]150-michel made an effort to reduce [his]123-scevola shrillness and went on speaking very carefully : " [I]150-michel have left a letter for [the Secretary General at [the Majorit]4686-the majorit]4685-the secretary general at the majorit to pay twenty - five hundred francs to [Jean]199-jean - [you]199-jean are [Jean]199-jean , are [you]199-jean not ? - [Peyrol]136-peyrol , price of the tartane in which [I]150-michel sail . Is that right ? "[150-michel] " What did [you]150-michel do that for ? "[136-peyrol] asked [Peyrol]136-peyrol with an extremely stony face . " To get [me]150-michel into trouble ? "[150-michel] " Do n't be [a fool]4252-a fool , [gunner]914-gunner , [nobody]2665-nobody remembers [your]914-gunner , name . It is buried under a stack of blackened paper . [I]136-peyrol must ask [you]914-gunner to go [there]266-there and tell [them]4691-them that [you]914-gunner have seen with [your]914-gunner own eyes [Lieutenant [Ral]136-peyrol]4692-lieutenant ral sail away on [his]136-peyrol mission . "[136-peyrol] The stoniness of [Peyrol]136-peyrol persisted but [his]136-peyrol eyes were full of fury . " Oh , yes , [I]136-peyrol see [myself]136-peyrol going [there]266-there . Twenty - five hundred francs ! Twenty - five hundred fiddlesticks . "[136-peyrol] [His]136-peyrol tone changed suddenly . " [I]136-peyrol heard [some one]4694-some one say that [you]136-peyrol were [an honest man]1955-an honest man , and [I]136-peyrol suppose this is a proof of it . Well , to the devil with [your]136-peyrol honesty . "[136-peyrol] [He]136-peyrol glared at [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant and then thought : " [He]136-peyrol does n't even pretend to listen to what [I]136-peyrol say "[136-peyrol] - and another sort of anger , partly contemptuous and with something of dim sympathy in it , replaced [his]136-peyrol downright fury . " [Pah]4443-pah ! "[136-peyrol] [he]136-peyrol said , spat over the side , and walking up to [Ral]136-peyrol with great deliberation , slapped [him]136-peyrol on the shoulder . The only effect of this proceeding was to make [Ral]136-peyrol look up at [him]136-peyrol without any expression whatever . [Peyrol]136-peyrol then picked up [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant 's valise and carried it down into [the cuddy]2138-the cuddy . As [he]136-peyrol passed by , [Citizen Scevola]123-scevola uttered the word " Citoyen "[123-scevola] but it was only when [he]123-scevola came back again that [Peyrol]136-peyrol condescended to say , " Well ? "[136-peyrol] " What are [you]136-peyrol going to do with [me]123-scevola ? "[123-scevola] asked [Scevola]123-scevola . " [You]136-peyrol would not give [me]136-peyrol an account of how [you]136-peyrol came on board [this tartane]4697-this tartane , "[136-peyrol] said [Peyrol]136-peyrol in a tone that sounded almost friendly , " therefore [I]136-peyrol need not tell [you]136-peyrol what [I]136-peyrol will do with [you]136-peyrol . "[136-peyrol] A low muttering of thunder followed so close upon [his]136-peyrol words that it might have come out of [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's own lips . [The rover]822-the rover gazed uneasily at the sky . [It]2140-it was still clear overhead , and at the bottom of [that little basin surrounded by rocks]2141-that little basin surrounded by rocks there was no view in any other direction ; but even as [he]136-peyrol gazed there was a sort of flicker in the sunshine succeeded by a mighty but distant clap of thunder . For the next half hour [Peyrol]136-peyrol and [Michel]150-michel were busy ashore taking a long line from the tartane to the entrance of [the little basin]3492-the little basin where [they]2143-they fastened the end of [it]3492-the little basin to a bush . This was for the purpose of hauling [the tartane]350-the tartane out into [the cove]3161-the cove . Then [they]2143-they came aboard again . The bit of sky above [their]2143-they heads was still clear , but while walking with the hauling line near [the cove]3161-the cove [Peyrol]136-peyrol had got a glimpse of the edge of the cloud . The sun grew scorching all of a sudden , and in the stagnating air a mysterious change seemed to come over the quality and the colour of the light . [Peyrol]136-peyrol flung [his]136-peyrol cap on [the deck]351-the deck , baring [his]136-peyrol head to the subtle menace of the breathless stillness of the air . " Phew ! a chauffe , "[136-peyrol] [he]136-peyrol muttered , rolling up the sleeves of [his]136-peyrol jacket . [He]136-peyrol wiped [his]136-peyrol forehead with [his]136-peyrol mighty forearm upon which [a mermaid with an immensely long fishtail]2148-a mermaid with an immensely long fishtail was tattooed . Perceiving [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant 's belted sword lying on [the deck]351-the deck , [he]136-peyrol picked it up and without any ceremony threw it down [the cabin stairs]2151-the cabin stairs . As [he]136-peyrol was passing again near [Scevola]123-scevola , [the sans - culotte]571-the sans - culotte raised [his]571-the sans - culotte voice . " [I]571-the sans - culotte believe [you]2881-the lieutenant are one of those wretches corrupted by English gold , "[571-the sans - culotte] [he]571-the sans - culotte cried like [one inspired]2153-one inspired . [His]571-the sans - culotte shining eyes , [his]571-the sans - culotte red cheeks , testified to the fire of patriotism burning in [his]571-the sans - culotte breast , and [he]571-the sans - culotte used that conventional phrase of revolutionary time , a time when , intoxicated with oratory , [he]571-the sans - culotte used to run about dealing death to [traitors of both sexes and all ages]2154-traitors of both sexes and all ages . But [his]571-the sans - culotte denunciation was received in such profound silence that [his]571-the sans - culotte own belief in it wavered . [His]571-the sans - culotte words had sunk into an abysmal stillness and the next sound was [Peyrol]136-peyrol speaking to [Ral]136-peyrol . " [I]136-peyrol am afraid [you]136-peyrol will get very wet , [lieutenant]888-lieutenant , before long , "[136-peyrol] and then , looking at [Ral]136-peyrol , [he]571-the sans - culotte thought with great conviction : " Wet ! [He]136-peyrol would n't mind getting drowned . "[571-the sans - culotte] Standing stock - still [he]571-the sans - culotte fretted and fumed inwardly , wondering where precisely [the English ship]3188-the english ship was by this time and where the devil that thunderstorm had got to : for the sky had become as mute as [the oppressed earth]2156-the oppressed earth . [Ral]136-peyrol asked : " Is it not time to haul out , [gunner]914-gunner ? "[136-peyrol] And [Peyrol]136-peyrol said : " There is not a breath of wind anywhere for miles . "[136-peyrol] [He]571-the sans - culotte was gratified by the fairly loud mutter rolling apparently along [the inland hills]2157-the inland hills . Over [the pool]2158-the pool a little ragged cloud torn from the purple robe of the storm floated , arrested and thin like a bit of dark gauze . Above at [the farm]2746-the farm [Catherine]127-catherine had heard too the ominous mutter and came to the door of [the salle]782-the salle . From there [she]127-catherine could see the purple cloud itself , convoluted and solid , and its sinister shadow lying over [the hills]689-the hills . The oncoming of the storm added to [her]127-catherine sense of uneasiness at finding [herself]127-catherine all alone in [the house]2684-the house . [Michel]150-michel had not come up . [She]127-catherine would have welcomed [Michel]150-michel , to whom [she]127-catherine hardly ever spoke , simply as [a person belonging to the usual order of things]2163-a person belonging to the usual order of things . [She]127-catherine was not talkative , but somehow [she]127-catherine would have liked [somebody to speak to just for a moment]2164-somebody to speak to just for a moment . This cessation of all sound , voices or footsteps , around [the buildings]824-the buildings was not welcome ; but looking at the cloud , [she]127-catherine thought that there would be noise enough presently . However , stepping back into [the kitchen]645-the kitchen , [she]127-catherine was met by a sound that made [her]127-catherine regret the oppressive silence , by its piercing and terrifying character ; it was a shriek in [the upper part of [the house]2684-the house]2167-the upper part of the house where , as far as [she]127-catherine knew , there was only [Arlette]121-arlette asleep . In [her]127-catherine attempt to cross [the kitchen]645-the kitchen to the foot of the stairs the weight of [her]127-catherine accumulated years fell upon [the old woman]1151-the old woman . [She]127-catherine felt suddenly very feeble and hardly able to breathe . And all at once the thought , " [Scevola]123-scevola ! Was [he]123-scevola murdering [her]121-arlette up there ? "[127-catherine] paralyzed the last remnant of [her]127-catherine physical powers . What else could it be ? [She]127-catherine fell , as if shot , into a chair under the first shock and found [herself]127-catherine unable to move . Only [her]127-catherine brain remained active , and [she]127-catherine raised [her]127-catherine hands to [her]127-catherine eyes as if to shut out the image of the horrors [upstairs]411-upstairs . [She]127-catherine heard nothing more from above . [Arlette]121-arlette was dead . [She]127-catherine thought that now it was [her]127-catherine turn . While [her]127-catherine body quailed before the brutal violence , [her]127-catherine weary spirit longed ardently f or the end . Let [him]2172-him come ! Let all this be over at last , with a blow on the head or a stab in the breast . [She]127-catherine had not the courage to uncover [her]127-catherine eyes . [She]127-catherine waited . But after about a minute - it seemed to [her]127-catherine interminable - [she]127-catherine heard rapid footsteps overhead . [Arlette]121-arlette was running here and there . [Catherine]127-catherine uncovered [her]127-catherine eyes and was about to rise when [she]127-catherine heard at the top of the stairs the name of [Peyrol]136-peyrol shouted with a desperate accent . Then , again , after the shortest of pauses , the cry of : " [Peyrol]136-peyrol , [Peyrol]136-peyrol ! "[136-peyrol] and then the sound of feet running [downstairs]772-downstairs . There was another shriek , " [Peyrol]136-peyrol ! "[136-peyrol] just outside the door before it flew open . Who was pursuing [her]127-catherine ? [Catherine]127-catherine managed to stand up . Steadying [herself]127-catherine with one hand on the table [she]127-catherine presented an undaunted front to [[her]127-catherine niece]3379-her niece who ran into [the kitchen]645-the kitchen with loose hair flying and the appearance of wildest distraction in [her]3379-her niece eyes . The staircase door had slammed to behind [her]3379-her niece . [Nobody]2665-nobody was pursuing [her]3379-her niece ; and [Catherine]127-catherine , putting forth [her]127-catherine lean brown arm , arrested [Arlette]121-arlette 's flight with such a jerk that [the two women]4602-the two women swung against [each other]2919-each other . [She]127-catherine seized [[her]127-catherine niece]3379-her niece by the shoulders . " What is this , in [Heaven]194-heaven 's name ? Where are [you]3379-her niece rushing to ? "[127-catherine] [she]127-catherine cried , and [the other]506-the other , as if suddenly exhausted , whispered : " [I]506-the other woke up from an awful dream . "[506-the other] [The kitchen]645-the kitchen grew dark under the cloud that hung over [the house]2684-the house now . There was a feeble flicker of lightning and a faint crash , far away . [The old woman]1151-the old woman gave [[her]1151-the old woman niece]3379-her niece a little shake . " Dreams are nothing , "[1151-the old woman] [she]1151-the old woman said . " [You]3379-her niece are awake now . . . . "[1151-the old woman] And indeed [Catherine]127-catherine thought that no dream could be so bad as the realities which kept hold of one through the long waking hours . " [They]4700-they were killing [him]3379-her niece , "[121-arlette] moaned [Arlette]121-arlette , beginning to tremble and struggle in [[her]121-arlette aunt]3529-her aunt 's arms . " [I]121-arlette tell [you]3379-her niece [they]4700-they were killing [him]3379-her niece . "[121-arlette] " Be quiet . Were [you]3379-her niece dreaming of [Peyrol]136-peyrol ? "[121-arlette] [She]121-arlette became still in a moment and then whispered : " No . [Eugne]174-eugne . "[121-arlette] [She]121-arlette had seen [Ral]136-peyrol set upon by a mob of [men]423-men and [women , all dripping with blood]2187-women , all dripping with blood , in a livid cold light , in front of a stretch of mere shells of [houses]417-houses with cracked walls and broken windows , and going down in the midst of a forest of raised arms brandishing sabres , clubs , knives , axes . There was also [a man]278-a man flourishing a red rag on a stick , while another was beating a drum which boomed above the sickening sound of broken glass falling like rain on [the pavement]4013-the pavement . And away round the corner of [an empty street]2191-an empty street came [Peyrol]136-peyrol whom [she]121-arlette recognized by [his]136-peyrol white head , walking without haste , swinging [his]136-peyrol cudgel regularly . The terrible thing was that [Peyrol]136-peyrol looked straight at [her]121-arlette , not noticing anything , composed , without a frown or a smile , unseeing and deaf , while [she]121-arlette waved [her]121-arlette arms and shrieked desperately to [him]136-peyrol for help . [She]121-arlette woke up with the piercing sound of [his]136-peyrol name in [her]121-arlette ears and with the impression of the dream so powerful that even now , looking distractedly into [[her]121-arlette aunt]3529-her aunt 's face , [she]121-arlette could see the bare arms of [that murderous crowd raised above [Ral]136-peyrol 's sinking head]2193-that murderous crowd raised above ral 's sinking head . Yet the name that had sprung to [her]121-arlette lips on waking was the name of [Peyrol]136-peyrol . [She]121-arlette pushed [[her]121-arlette aunt]3529-her aunt away with such force that [the old woman]1151-the old woman staggered backwards and to save [herself]1151-the old woman had to catch hold of the overmantel above [her]1151-the old woman head . [Arlette]121-arlette ran to the door of [the salle]782-the salle , looked in , came back to [[her]121-arlette aunt]3529-her aunt and shouted : " Where is [he]136-peyrol ? "[121-arlette] [Catherine]127-catherine really did not know which path [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant had taken . [She]127-catherine understood very well that " [he]136-peyrol "[136-peyrol] meant [Ral]136-peyrol . [She]127-catherine said : " [He]136-peyrol went away a long time ago "[127-catherine] grasped [[her]127-catherine niece]3379-her niece 's arm and added with an effort to steady [her]127-catherine voice : " [He]136-peyrol is coming back , [Arlette]121-arlette - for nothing will keep [him]136-peyrol away from [you]121-arlette . "[127-catherine] [She]127-catherine spun round wildly like [a person]2201-a person looking for a way of escape from a deadly peril , and rushed out blindly . About [Escampobar]30-escampobar the air was murky but calm , and the silence was so profound that it was possible to hear the first heavy drops of rain striking the ground . In the intimidating shadow of the storm - cloud , [Arlette]121-arlette stood irresolute for a moment , but it was to [Peyrol]136-peyrol , [the man of mystery and power]2202-the man of mystery and power , that [her]121-arlette thoughts turned . [She]121-arlette was ready to embrace [his]136-peyrol knees , to entreat and to scold . " [Peyrol]136-peyrol , [Peyrol]136-peyrol ! "[121-arlette] [she]121-arlette cried twice , and lent [her]121-arlette ear as if expecting an answer . Then [she]121-arlette shouted : " [I]121-arlette want [him]136-peyrol back . [Arlette]121-arlette flew down [the slope]3155-the slope . The first sign of [her]121-arlette coming was a faint thin scream which really [the rover alone]2205-the rover alone heard and understood . [He]136-peyrol pressed [his]136-peyrol lips in a particular way , showing [his]136-peyrol appreciation of the coming difficulty . [Her]121-arlette eyes were closed , [her]121-arlette hands remained clenched ; every sign of life had left [her]121-arlette white face . [Peyrol]136-peyrol stood up and looked at the tall rocks streaming with water . The rain swept over the tartane with an angry swishing roar to which was added the sound of water rushing violently down the folds and seams of [the precipitous shore]2214-the precipitous shore vanishing gradually from [his]136-peyrol sight , as if this had been the beginning of a destroying and universal deluge - the end of all things . [Lieutenant Ral]136-peyrol , kneeling on one knee , contemplated the pale face of [Arlette]121-arlette . "[136-peyrol] With these words [he]136-peyrol turned away and walked slowly down to the tartane . A breeze had sprung up . [He]136-peyrol felt it on [his]136-peyrol wet neck and was grateful for the cool touch which recalled [him]136-peyrol to [himself]136-peyrol , to [his]136-peyrol old wandering self which had known no softness and no hesitation in the face of any risk offered by life . As [he]136-peyrol stepped on board , the shower passed away . [Michel]150-michel , wet to the skin , was still in the very same attitude gazing up [the slope]3155-the slope . [Citizen Scevola]123-scevola had drawn [his]123-scevola knees up and was holding [his]123-scevola head in [his]123-scevola hands ; whether because of rain or cold or for some other reason , [his]123-scevola teeth were chattering audibly with a continuous and distressing rattle . [Peyrol]136-peyrol flung off [his]136-peyrol jacket , heavy with water , with a strange air as if it was of no more use to [his]136-peyrol mortal envelope , squared [his]136-peyrol broad shoulders and directed [Michel]150-michel in a deep , quiet voice to let go the lines holding the tartane to [the shore]231-the shore . "[204-peyrol] Some dim perception of the solemnity of the occasion seemed to enter [Michel]150-michel 's primitive brain . [He]150-michel connected [Peyrol]204-peyrol 's words with the sense of [his]150-michel own insignificant position at the tail of [all mankind]3905-all mankind ; and , timidly , [he]150-michel murmured with [his]150-michel clear , innocent glance unclouded , the fundamental axiom of [his]150-michel philosophy : " [Somebody]876-somebody must be last in [this world]1878-this world . "[150-michel] " Well , then , [you]150-michel will have to forgive [me]150-michel all that may happen between this and the hour of sunset . "[150-michel] [The tartane , obeying the helm]2255-the tartane , obeying the helm , fell off before the wind , with [her]2255-the tartane , obeying the helm head to the eastward . "[204-peyrol] [His]150-michel unsubdued heart , heavy for so many days , had a moment of buoyancy - the illusion of immense freedom . At that moment [Ral]136-peyrol , amazed at finding no tartane in [the basin]1506-the basin , was running madly towards [the cove]3161-the cove , where [he]136-peyrol was sure [Peyrol]136-peyrol must be waiting to give [her]2255-the tartane , obeying the helm up to [him]136-peyrol . [He]136-peyrol ran out on to the very rock on which [[Peyrol]136-peyrol 's late prisoner]2258-peyrol 's late prisoner had sat after [his]136-peyrol escape , too tired to care , yet cheered by the hope of liberty . But [Ral]136-peyrol was in a worse plight . [He]136-peyrol could see no shadowy form through the thin veil of rain which pitted the sheltered piece of water framed in the rocks . [The little craft]2259-the little craft had been spirited away . Impossible ! There must be something wrong with [his]136-peyrol eyes ! Again [the barren hillsides]2260-the barren hillsides echoed the name of " [Peyrol]136-peyrol , "[136-peyrol] shouted with all the force of [Ral]136-peyrol 's lungs . [He]136-peyrol shouted it only once , and about five minutes afterwards appeared at the kitchen - door , panting , streaming with water as if [he]136-peyrol had fought [his]136-peyrol way up from [the bottom of [the sea]281-the sea]2261-the bottom of the sea . In the tall - backed armchair [Arlette]121-arlette lay , with [her]121-arlette limbs relaxed , [her]121-arlette head on [Catherine]127-catherine 's arm , [her]121-arlette face white as death . [He]136-peyrol saw [her]121-arlette open [her]121-arlette black eyes , enormous and as if not of [this world]1878-this world ; [he]136-peyrol saw [old Catherine]127-catherine turn [her]127-catherine head , heard a cry of surprise , and saw a sort of struggle beginning between [the two women]4602-the two women . [He]136-peyrol screamed at [them]4602-the two women like [a madman]2265-a madman : " [Peyrol]136-peyrol has betrayed [me]136-peyrol ! "[136-peyrol] and in an instant , with a bang of the door , [he]136-peyrol was gone . The rain had ceased . Above [his]136-peyrol head the unbroken mass of clouds moved to the eastward , and [he]136-peyrol moved in the same direction as if [he]136-peyrol too were driven by the wind up [the hillside]3185-the hillside , towards the lookout . When [he]136-peyrol reached the spot and , gasping , flung one arm round the trunk of the leaning tree , the only thing [he]136-peyrol was aware of during the sombre pause in the unrest of the elements was the distracting turmoil of [his]136-peyrol thoughts . After a moment [he]136-peyrol perceived through the rain [the English ship with [her]2267-the english ship with her topsails lowered on the caps topsails lowered on the caps]2267-the english ship with her topsails lowered on the caps , forging ahead slowly across [the northern entrance of [the Petite Passe]34-the petite passe]2268-the northern entrance of the petite passe . [His]136-peyrol distress fastened insanely on the notion of there being a connection between [that enemy ship]2269-that enemy ship and [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's inexplicable conduct . [That old man]4701-that old man had always meant to go [himself]4701-that old man ! And when a moment after , looking to the southward , [he]136-peyrol made out the shadow of the tartane coming round [the land]386-the land in the midst of another squall , [he]136-peyrol muttered to [himself]136-peyrol a bitter : " Of course ! "[136-peyrol] [She]2267-the english ship with her topsails lowered on the caps had both [her]2267-the english ship with her topsails lowered on the caps sails set . [Peyrol]136-peyrol was indeed pressing [her]2267-the english ship with her topsails lowered on the caps to the utmost in [his]136-peyrol shameful haste to traffic with [the enemy]627-the enemy . The truth was that from the position in which [Ral]136-peyrol first saw [him]136-peyrol , [Peyrol]136-peyrol could not yet see [the English ship]3188-the english ship , and held confidently on [his]136-peyrol course up [the middle of [the strait]2275-the strait]2274-the middle of the strait . [The man - of - war]2276-the man - of - war and [the little tartane]2277-the little tartane saw each other quite unexpectedly at a distance that was very little over a mile . [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's heart flew into [his]136-peyrol mouth at finding [himself]136-peyrol so close to [the enemy]627-the enemy . On board [the Amelia]138-the amelia at first no notice was taken . It was simply a tartane making for shelter on [the north side of [Porquerolles]13-porquerolles]2279-the north side of porquerolles . But when [Peyrol]136-peyrol suddenly altered [his]136-peyrol course , [the master of the man - of - war]2280-the master of the man - of - war , noticing the manuvre , took up the long glass for a look . [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent was on [deck]3083-deck and agreed with [the master]2770-the master 's remark that " there was a craft acting suspiciously . "[2770-the master] Before [the Amelia]138-the amelia could come round in the heavy squall , [Peyrol]136-peyrol was already under the battery of Porquerolles and , so far , safe from capture . [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent had no mind to bring [[his]133-captain vincent ship]273-his ship within reach of [the battery]2284-the battery and risk damage in [his]133-captain vincent rigging or hull for the sake of a small coaster . However , the tale brought on board by [Symons]144-symons of [his]144-symons discovery of [a hidden craft]2285-a hidden craft , of [his]144-symons capture , and [his]144-symons wonderful escape , had made every tartane an object of interest to [[the whole ship]2286-the whole ship 's company]2287-the whole ship 's company . [The Amelia]138-the amelia remained hove to in [the strait]2275-the strait while [[her]138-the amelia officers]2289-her officers watched the lateen sails gliding to and fro under the protecting muzzles of the guns . [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent [himself]133-captain vincent had been impressed by [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's manuvre . [Coasting craft]2290-coasting craft as a rule were not afraid of [the Amelia]138-the amelia . After taking a few turns on [the quarter - deck]930-the quarter - deck [he]133-captain vincent ordered [Symons]144-symons to be called aft . The hero of a unique and mysterious adventure , which had been the only subject of talk on board [the corvette]1509-the corvette for the last twenty - four hours , came along rolling , hat in hand , and enjoying a secret sense of [his]144-symons importance . " Take the glass , "[923-the captain] said [the captain]923-the captain , " and have a look at [that vessel under [the land]386-the land]4728-that vessel under the land . Is [she]4728-that vessel under the land anything like the tartane that [you]144-symons say [you]144-symons have been aboard of ? "[923-the captain] [Symons]144-symons was very positive . " [I]144-symons think [I]144-symons can swear to those painted mastheads , [your]144-symons honour . It is the last thing [I]144-symons remember before [that murderous ruffian]4730-that murderous ruffian knocked [me]144-symons senseless . The moon shone on them . [I]144-symons can make them out now with the glass . "[144-symons] As to the fellow boasting to [him]144-symons that [the tartane]350-the tartane was [a dispatch - boat]2295-a dispatch - boat and had already made some trips , well , [Symons]144-symons begged [his]144-symons honour to believe that [the beggar]2296-the beggar was not sober at the time . " [You]144-symons see , [[your]144-symons honour]4731-your honour , "[144-symons] continued [Symons]144-symons , " [he]144-symons thought [I]144-symons was not likely to escape after getting a blow that would have killed [nine out of [any ten men]4733-any ten men]4732-nine out of any ten men . [A regular savage]4739-a regular savage [he]144-symons was . "[144-symons] [Symons]144-symons paused , staring , as if astonished at the marvels of [his]144-symons own tale . [The old master]2299-the old master , standing at [[his]2299-the old master captain]2300-his captain 's elbow , observed in a dispassionate tone that , anyway , that peninsula was not a bad jumping - off place for [a craft]2301-a craft intending to slip through the blockade . [Symons]144-symons , not being dismissed , waited hat in hand while [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent directed [the master]2770-the master to fill on [the ship]2931-the ship and stand a little nearer to [the battery]2284-the battery . It was done , and presently there was a flash of a gun low down on [the water]704-the water 's edge and a shot came skipping in the direction of [the Amelia]3078-the amelia . It fell very short , but [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent judged [the ship]2931-the ship was close enough and ordered [her]2931-the ship to be hove to again . Then [Symons]144-symons was told to take a look through the glass once more . After a long interval [he]144-symons lowered it and spoke impressively to [[his]144-symons captain]2300-his captain : " [I]144-symons can make out three heads aboard , [your]2300-his captain honour , and one is white . [I]144-symons would swear to that white head anywhere . "[144-symons] [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent made no answer . All this seemed very odd to [him]133-captain vincent ; but after all it was possible . [The craft]2251-the craft had certainly acted suspiciously . [He]133-captain vincent spoke to [the first lieutenant]4323-the first lieutenant in a half - vexed tone . " [He]133-captain vincent has done a rather smart thing . [He]133-captain vincent will dodge [here]2715-here till dark and then get away . lt is perfectly absurd . [I]133-captain vincent do n't want to send [the boats]3089-the boats too close to [the battery]2284-the battery . "[133-captain vincent] On board [the tartane]350-the tartane [Peyrol]136-peyrol put [his]136-peyrol own interpretation on [the ship]2931-the ship 's movements . [His]136-peyrol object had been attained . [The corvette]1509-the corvette had marked [him]136-peyrol for [her]1509-the corvette prey . Satisfied as to that , [Peyrol]136-peyrol watched [his]136-peyrol opportunity and taking advantage of a long squall , with rain thick enough to blur the form of [the English ship]3188-the english ship , [he]136-peyrol left the shelter of [the battery]2284-the battery to lead [the Englishman a dance]2316-the englishman a dance and keep up [his]136-peyrol character of [a man anxious to avoid capture]2317-a man anxious to avoid capture . [Ral]136-peyrol , from [his]136-peyrol position on the lookout , saw in the thinning downpour the pointed lateen sails glide round [the north end of [Porquerolles]13-porquerolles]2318-the north end of porquerolles and vanish behind [the land]386-the land . Some time afterwards [the Amelia]3078-the amelia made sail in a manner that put it beyond doubt that [she]3078-the amelia meant to chase . [Her]3078-the amelia lofty canvas was shut off too presently by [the land of [Porquerolles]13-porquerolles]2321-the land of porquerolles . When [she]3078-the amelia had disappeared [Ral]136-peyrol turned to [Arlette]121-arlette . " Let [us]4746-us go , "[136-peyrol] [he]136-peyrol said . [Arlette]121-arlette , stimulated by the short glimpse of [Ral]136-peyrol at the [kitchen]579-kitchen door , whom [she]121-arlette had taken for a vision of [a lost man calling [her]121-arlette to follow [him]136-peyrol to the end of [the world]2656-the world]2323-a lost man calling her to follow him to the end of the world , had torn [herself]121-arlette out of [the old woman]1151-the old woman 's thin , bony arms which could not cope with the struggles of [her]121-arlette body and the fierceness of [her]121-arlette spirit . [She]121-arlette had run straight to the lookout , though there was nothing to guide [her]121-arlette there except a blind impulse to seek [Ral]136-peyrol wherever [he]136-peyrol might be . [He]136-peyrol was not aware of [her]121-arlette having found [him]136-peyrol until [she]121-arlette seized hold of [his]136-peyrol arm with a suddenness , energy and determination of which [no one with a clouded mind]2326-no one with a clouded mind could have been capable . [He]136-peyrol felt [himself]136-peyrol being taken possession of in a way that tore all [his]136-peyrol scruples out of [his]136-peyrol breast . Holding on to the trunk of the tree , [he]136-peyrol threw [his]136-peyrol other arm round [her]121-arlette waist , and when [she]121-arlette confessed to [him]136-peyrol that [she]121-arlette did not know why [she]121-arlette had run up there , but that if [she]121-arlette had not found [him]136-peyrol [she]121-arlette would have thrown [herself]121-arlette over [the cliff]3204-the cliff , [he]136-peyrol tightened [his]136-peyrol clasp with sudden exultation , as though [she]121-arlette had been a gift prayed for instead of a stumbling block for [his]136-peyrol pedantic conscience . Together [they]2328-their walked back . In the failing light [the buildings]824-the buildings awaited [them]2328-their , lifeless , the walls darkened by rain and the big slopes of the roofs glistening and sinister under the flying desolation of the clouds . In [the kitchen]645-the kitchen [Catherine]127-catherine heard [their]2328-their mingled footsteps , and rigid in the tall armchair awaited [their]2328-their coming . [Arlette]121-arlette threw [her]121-arlette arms round [the old woman]1151-the old woman 's neck while [Ral]136-peyrol stood on one side , looking on . Thought after thought flew through [his]136-peyrol mind and vanished in the strong feeling of the irrevocable nature of the event handing [him]136-peyrol to [the woman whom , in the revulsion of [his]136-peyrol feelings]2332-the woman whom , in the revulsion of his feelings , [he]136-peyrol was inclined to think more sane than [himself]136-peyrol [Arlette]121-arlette , with one arm over [the old woman]1151-the old woman 's shoulders , kissed the wrinkled forehead under the white band of linen that , on the erect head , had the effect of a rustic diadem . " To - morrow [you]127-catherine and [I]121-arlette will have to walk down to [the church]835-the church . "[121-arlette] The austere dignity of [Catherine]127-catherine 's pose seemed to be shaken by this proposal to lead before [the God , with whom [she]127-catherine had made [her]127-catherine peace long ago]2334-the god , with whom she had made her peace long ago , [that unhappy girl chosen to share in the guilt of impious and unspeakable horrors which had darkened [her]127-catherine mind]2335-that unhappy girl chosen to share in the guilt of impious and unspeakable horrors which had darkened her mind . "[127-catherine] [Catherine]127-catherine 's head dropped , whether in assent or grief ; and [Ral]136-peyrol felt an unexpected and profound emotion , for [he]136-peyrol , too , was convinced that none of [the three persons in [the farm]2746-the farm]2337-the three persons in the farm would ever see [Peyrol]136-peyrol again . It was as though the rover of [the wide seas]2339-the wide seas had left [them]2337-the three persons in the farm to [themselves]2337-the three persons in the farm on a sudden impulse of scorn , of magnanimity , of a passion weary of itself . However come by , [Ral]136-peyrol was ready to clasp for ever to [his]136-peyrol breast [that woman touched by the red hand of the Revolution]2340-that woman touched by the red hand of the revolution ; for [she]2340-that woman touched by the red hand of the revolution , whose little feet had run ankle - deep through the terrors of death , had brought to [him]136-peyrol the sense of triumphant life . Astern of the tartane , the sun , about to set , kindled a streak of dull crimson glow between [the darkening sea]2341-the darkening sea and the overcast sky . [The peninsula of [Giens]31-the giens peninsula]2342-the peninsula of giens and [the islands of [Hyres]22-hyres]2343-the islands of hyres formed [one mass of land]2344-one mass of land detaching itself very black against the fiery girdle of the horizon ; but to the north [the long stretch of [the Alpine coast]2346-the alpine coast]2345-the long stretch of the alpine coast continued beyond sight its endless sinuosities under the stooping clouds . The tartane seemed to be rushing together with the run of the waves into the arms of the oncoming night . A little more than a mile away on [[her]2340-that woman touched by the red hand of the revolution lee quarter]2347-her lee quarter , [the Amelia , under all plain sail]2348-the amelia , under all plain sail , pressed to the end of the chase . It had lasted now for a good many hours , for [Peyrol]136-peyrol , when slipping away , had managed to get the advantage of [the Amelia]138-the amelia from the very start . While still within the large sheet of smooth water which is called [the Hyres roadstead]2962-the hyres roadstead , the tartane , which was really a craft of extraordinary speed , managed to gain positively on [the sloop]3823-the sloop . Afterwards , by suddenly darting down the eastern passage between [the two last islands of [the group]2352-the group]2351-the two last islands of the group , [Peyrol]136-peyrol actually got out of sight of [the chasing ship]2353-the chasing ship , being hidden by [the Ile du Levant]2354-the ile du levant for a time . [The Amelia]138-the amelia having to tack twice in order to follow , lost ground once more . Emerging into [the open sea]777-the open sea , [she]138-the amelia had to tack again , and then the position became that of a stern chase , which proverbially is known as a long chase . [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's skilful seamanship had twice extracted from [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent a low murmur accompanied by a significant compression of lips . At one time [the Amelia]138-the amelia had been near enough the tartane to send a shot ahead of [her]138-the amelia . That one was followed by another which whizzed extraordinarily close to the mastheads , but then [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent ordered the gun to be secured again . "[133-captain vincent] If those words by some miracle could have been carried to the ears of [Peyrol]136-peyrol , [they]2361-they would have brought to [his]133-captain vincent lips a smile of malicious and triumphant exultation . [The citizen]1232-the citizen had adopted the mode of progression on all fours , and while [Peyrol]136-peyrol looked at [him]1232-the citizen [he]136-peyrol rolled to leeward , saving [himself]136-peyrol rather cleverly from going overboard , and holding on desperately to a cleat , shouted in a hollow voice , pointing with the other hand as if [he]136-peyrol had made a tremendous discovery : " La terre ! [Citizen Scevola]123-scevola , somewhat soothed by the assurance that [he]123-scevola would not die by drowning , had elected to remain quiet where [he]123-scevola had fallen , not daring to trust [himself]123-scevola to move on [the lively deck]2383-the lively deck . "[2401-boatswain 's mates] [Peyrol]136-peyrol , lying on [his]136-peyrol back under the swinging tiller , heard the calls shrilling and dying away ; [he]136-peyrol heard the ominous rush of [Amelia]138-the amelia 's bow wave as [the sloop]3823-the sloop foamed within ten yards of the tartane 's stern ; [he]136-peyrol even saw [her]138-the amelia upper yards coming down , and then everything vanished out of the clouded sky . [The tartane]350-the tartane began to roll heavily , but [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's right arm was sound and [he]136-peyrol managed to put it round a bollard to prevent [himself]136-peyrol from being flung about . A feeling of peace sank into [him]136-peyrol , not unmingled with pride . Everything [he]136-peyrol had planned had come to pass . [He]136-peyrol had meant to play [that man]495-that man a trick , and now the trick had been played . Played by [him]136-peyrol better than by [any other old man on whom age had stolen , unnoticed , till the veil of peace was torn down by the touch of a sentiment unexpected like an intruder]2406-any other old man on whom age had stolen , unnoticed , till the veil of peace was torn down by the touch of a sentiment unexpected like an intruder and cruel like [an enemy]2407-an enemy . [Peyrol]136-peyrol rolled [his]136-peyrol head to the left . Dead , or only scared to death ? And [Michel]150-michel ? Was [he]150-michel dead or dying , [that man without friends whom [his]136-peyrol pity had refused to leave behind marooned on [the earth]723-the earth without even a dog for [company]2708-company]2409-that man without friends whom his pity had refused to leave behind marooned on the earth without even a dog for company ? "[121-arlette] [He]136-peyrol would never hear [anybody]1371-anybody 's voice again ! Under that grey sky there was nothing for [him]136-peyrol but the swish of breaking seas and the ceaseless furious beating of the tartane 's foresail . [His]136-peyrol play - thing was knocking about terribly under [him]136-peyrol , with [her]121-arlette tiller flying madly to and fro just clear of [his]136-peyrol head , and solid lumps of water coming on board over [his]136-peyrol prostrate body . The fear , not of death but of failure , gripped [his]136-peyrol slowing - down heart . Was [this blind Englishman]2416-this blind englishman going to run [him]136-peyrol down and sink the dispatches together with [the craft]2251-the craft ? [An old man with a white head of hair]4816-an old man with a white head of hair was entrusted with the service and really [they]4817-they could have found [nobody]2665-nobody better . [He]4816-an old man with a white head of hair came round [Cape Esterel]20-cape esterel intending to pass through [the Hyres roadstead]2962-the hyres roadstead . Apparently [he]4816-an old man with a white head of hair did not expect to find [the Amelia]138-the amelia in [his]4816-an old man with a white head of hair way . And it was there that [he]4816-an old man with a white head of hair made [his]4816-an old man with a white head of hair only mistake . If [he]4816-an old man with a white head of hair had kept on [his]4816-an old man with a white head of hair course [I]133-captain vincent would probably have taken no more notice of [him]4816-an old man with a white head of hair than of two other craft that were in sight then . But [he]4816-an old man with a white head of hair acted suspiciously by hauling up for the battery on [Porquerolles]13-porquerolles . This manuvre in connection with the information of which [I]133-captain vincent spoke decided [me]133-captain vincent to overhaul [him]4816-an old man with a white head of hair and see what [he]4816-an old man with a white head of hair had on board . "[133-captain vincent] [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent then related concisely the episodes of the chase . " [I]3016-the admiral assure [[your]4820-your lordship]4810-your lordship that [I]3016-the admiral never gave an order with greater reluctance than to open musketry fire on [that craft]4750-that craft ; but [the old man]1452-the old man had given such proofs of [his]4816-an old man with a white head of hair seamanship and determination that there was nothing else for it . Why ! at the very moment [he]4816-an old man with a white head of hair had the Amelia alongside of [him]4816-an old man with a white head of hair [he]4816-an old man with a white head of hair still made a most clever attempt to prolong the chase . [He]133-captain vincent had been up nearly the whole of the last three nights and [he]133-captain vincent wanted to get a little sleep . [His]133-captain vincent slurnbers , however , were short and disturbed . Early in the afternoon [he]133-captain vincent found [himself]133-captain vincent broad awake and reviewing in [his]133-captain vincent mind the events of the day before . The order to shoot [three brave men]2499-three brave men in cold blood , terribly distasteful at the time , was lying heavily on [him]133-captain vincent . Perhaps [he]133-captain vincent had been impressed by [Peyrol]136-peyrol 's white head , [his]136-peyrol obstinacy to escape [him]136-peyrol , the determination shown to the very last minute , by something in the whole episode that suggested a more than common devotion to duty and a spirit of daring defiance . " Yet , "[133-captain vincent] [he]133-captain vincent reflected , " [they]2499-three brave men have been asking for it . There could be only one end to that affair . [That old chap]4853-that old chap now . . . . "[133-captain vincent] [He]133-captain vincent wondered how much of exact truth there was in Symons tale of adventure . [That craft]4750-that craft certainly was fit for blockade running . [Lord Nelson]141-lord nelson had been pleased . [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent went on [deck]3083-deck with the kindliest feelings towards [all men , alive and dead]2503-all men , alive and dead . The afternoon had turned out very fine . [The British Fleet]83-the british fleet was just out of sight with the exception of [one or two stragglers , under a press of canvas]2504-one or two stragglers , under a press of canvas . A light breeze in which only [the Amelia]138-the amelia could travel at five knots , hardly ruffled the profundity of the blue waters basking in the warm tenderness of the cloudless sky . To south and west the horizon was empty except for two specks very far apart , of which one shone white like a bit of silver and the other appeared black like a drop of ink . [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent , with [his]133-captain vincent purpose firm in [his]133-captain vincent mind , felt at peace with [himself]133-captain vincent . "[133-captain vincent] A profound but not disapproving silence reigned over [the decks of [the ship]2931-the ship]2527-the decks of the ship while [Mr. Bolt with three or four hands]2529-mr. bolt with three or four hands was busy executing the order . At the same time [Captain Vincent]133-captain vincent ordered the line holding [the tartane]350-the tartane alongside to be cast off and [the mainyard of [the Amelia]138-the amelia]2534-the mainyard of the amelia to be swung round . [The sloop shooting ahead of [her]138-the amelia prize]2535-the sloop shooting ahead of her prize left [her]138-the amelia stationary on [the sea]281-the sea , then putting the helm up , ran back abreast of [her]138-the amelia on the other side . The port bow - gun was ordered to fire a round , aiming well forward . That shot , however , went just over , taking the foremast out of [the tartane]350-the tartane . The next was more successful , striking the little hull between wind and water , and going out well under water on the other side . A third was fired , as [the men]3164-the men said , just for luck , and that too took effect , a splintered hole appearing at the bow . After that the guns were secured and [the Amelia]138-the amelia , with no brace being touched , was brought to [her]138-the amelia course towards [Cape Cici]68-cape cici . [All hands on board of [her]138-the amelia]2539-all hands on board of her with [their]2539-all hands on board of her backs to the sunset sky , clear like a pale topaz above the hard blue gem of [the sea]281-the sea , watched [the tartane]350-the tartane give a sudden dip , followed by a slow , unchecked dive . At last the tricolour flag alone remained visible for a tense and interminable moment , pathetic and lonely , in the centre of a brimful horizon . All at once it vanished , like a flame blown upon , bringing to [the beholders]2542-the beholders the sense of having been left face to face with an immense , suddenly created solitude . On [the decks of [the Amelia]138-the amelia]2543-the decks of the amelia a low murmur died out . When [Lieutenant Ral]136-peyrol sailed away with [the [Toulon]1-toulon fleet on the great strategical cruise which was to end in the battle of [Trafalgar]106-trafalgar]2544-the toulon fleet on the great strategical cruise which was to end in the battle of trafalgar , [Madame Ral]212-madame ral returned with [[her]212-madame ral aunt]3529-her aunt to [[her]212-madame ral hereditary house at [Escampobar]30-escampobar]2546-her hereditary house at escampobar . [She]212-madame ral had only spent a few weeks in [town]3283-town where [she]212-madame ral was not much seen in public . [The lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant and [[his]2881-the lieutenant wife]608-his wife lived in [a little house near the western gate]2550-a little house near the western gate , and [the lieutenant]2881-the lieutenant 's official position , though [he]2881-the lieutenant was employed on the staff to the last , was not sufficiently prominent to make [her]212-madame ral absence from official ceremonies at all remarkable . But this marriage was an object of mild interest in [naval circles]2552-naval circles . [[Those]2553-those - mostly [men]423-men - who had seen [Madame Ral]212-madame ral at [home]2668-home]2554-those - mostly men - who had seen madame ral at home , told stories of [her]212-madame ral dazzling complexion , of [her]212-madame ral magnificent black eyes , of [her]212-madame ral personal and attractive strangeness , and of the Arlesian costume [she]212-madame ral insisted on wearing , even after [her]212-madame ral marriage to [an officer of the navy]2557-an officer of the navy , being [herself]212-madame ral sprung from farmer stock . Whenever [she]212-madame ral went [abroad]2561-abroad [Madame Ral]212-madame ral was attended by [[her]212-madame ral aunt who aroused almost as much curiosity as [herself]212-madame ral]2562-her aunt who aroused almost as much curiosity as herself : [a magnificent old woman with upright carriage and an austere , brown , wrinkled face showing signs of past beauty]2563-a magnificent old woman with upright carriage and an austere , brown , wrinkled face showing signs of past beauty . [Catherine]127-catherine was also seen alone in [the streets]276-the streets where , as a matter of fact , [people]287-people turned round to look after the thin and dignified figure , remarkable amongst [the passers - by]2566-the passers - by , whom [she]212-madame ral , [herself]212-madame ral , did not seem to see . About [her]212-madame ral escape from the massacres most wonderful tales were told , and [she]212-madame ral acquired the reputation of [a heroine]2567-a heroine . [[Arlette]121-arlette 's aunt]2568-arlette 's aunt was known to frequent [the churches]1333-the churches , which were all open to [the faithful]2570-the faithful now , carrying even into [the house of [God]153-god]2571-the house of god [her]2568-arlette 's aunt sibylline aspect of [a prophetess]2572-a prophetess and [her]2568-arlette 's aunt austere manner . It was not at the services that [she]2568-arlette 's aunt was seen most . [People]287-people would see [her]2568-arlette 's aunt oftener in [an empty nave]2574-an empty nave , standing slim and as straight as an arrow in the shade of a mighty pillar as if making a call on [the Creator of all things with whom [she]2568-arlette 's aunt had made [her]2568-arlette 's aunt peace generously , and now would petition only for pardon and reconciliation with [[her]2568-arlette 's aunt niece]3379-her niece [Arlette]121-arlette]2575-the creator of all things with whom she had made her peace generously , and now would petition only for pardon and reconciliation with her niece arlette . For [Catherine]127-catherine for a long time remained uncertain of the future . [She]127-catherine did not get rid of [her]127-catherine involuntary awe of [[her]127-catherine niece]3379-her niece as a selected object of [God]153-god 's wrath , until towards the end of [her]127-catherine life . There was also another soul for which [she]127-catherine was concerned . The pursuit of [the tartane]350-the tartane by [the Amelia]138-the amelia had been observed from various points of [the islands that close [the roadstead of [Hyres]22-hyres]3826-the roadstead of hyres]2579-the islands that close the roadstead of hyres , and [the English ship]3188-the english ship had been seen from [the Fort de la Vigie]2582-the fort de la vigie opening fire on [her]3188-the english ship chase . The result , though [the two vessels]2583-the two vessels soon ran out of sight , could not be a matter of doubt . There was also the story told by a coaster that got into [Frjus]12-frjus , of [a tartane]345-a tartane being fired on by [a square - rigged man - of - war]2585-a square - rigged man - of - war ; but that apparently was the next day . All these rumours pointed one way and were the foundation of the report made by [Lieutenant [Ral]212-madame ral to [the Toulon Admiralty]3214-the toulon admiralty]2586-lieutenant ral to the toulon admiralty . That [Peyrol]136-peyrol went out to [sea]228-sea in [his]136-peyrol tartane and was never seen again , was of course an incontrovertible fact . The day before [the two women]4602-the two women were to go back to [Escampobar]30-escampobar , [Catherine]127-catherine approached [a priest in [the church of [Ste Marie Majeure]213-ste marie majeure]2591-the church of ste marie majeure]2590-a priest in the church of ste marie majeure , [a little unshaven fat man with a watery eye]2592-a little unshaven fat man with a watery eye , in order to arrange for some masses to be said for [the dead]1382-the dead . " But for whose soul are [we]4602-the two women to pray ? "[852-the priest] mumbled [the priest]852-the priest in a wheezy low tone . " Pray for the soul of [Jean]199-jean , "[127-catherine] said [Catherine]127-catherine . " Yes , [Jean]199-jean . There is no other name . "[127-catherine] [Lieutenant Ral]136-peyrol , wounded at [Trafalgar]106-trafalgar , but escaping capture , retired with the rank of [Capitaine de [Frgate]108-frgate]107-capitaine de frgate and vanished from the eyes of the naval world in [Toulon]1-toulon and indeed from [the world]2656-the world altogether . Whatever sign brought [him]136-peyrol back to [Escampobar]30-escampobar on that momentous night , was not meant to call [him]136-peyrol to [his]136-peyrol death but to a quiet and retired life , obscure in a sense but not devoid of dignity . In the course of years [he]136-peyrol became [the Mayor of [the Commune]2597-the commune]2596-the mayor of the commune in [that very same little village]2598-that very same little village which had looked on [Escampobar]30-escampobar as [the abode of iniquity]2599-the abode of iniquity , the sojourn of [blood - drinkers]2600-blood - drinkers and of [wicked women]2601-wicked women . One of the earliest excitements breaking the monotony of [the Escampobar]30-escampobar life was the discovery at the bottom of the well , one dry year when [the water]704-the water got very low , of some considerable obstruction . After a lot of trouble in getting it up , this obstruction turned out to be a garment made of sail - cloth , which had armholes and three horn buttons in front , and looked like a waistcoat ; but it was lined , positively quilted , with a surprising quantity of gold pieces of various ages , coinages and nationalities . Nobody but [Peyrol]136-peyrol could have put it there . [Catherine]127-catherine was able to give the exact date ; because [she]127-catherine remembered seeing [him]136-peyrol doing something at the well on the very morning before [he]136-peyrol went out to [sea]228-sea with [Michel]150-michel , carrying off [Scevola]123-scevola . [Captain Ral]214-captain ral could guess easily the origin of that treasure , and [he]214-captain ral decided with [[his]214-captain ral wife]608-his wife 's approval to give it up to [the Government]1994-the government as the hoard of [a man who had died intestate with no discoverable relations]2606-a man who had died intestate with no discoverable relations , and whose very name had been a matter of uncertainty , even to [himself]214-captain ral . After that event the uncertain name of [Peyrol]136-peyrol found itself oftener and oftener on [Monsieur]2607-monsieur and [Madame Ral]212-madame ral 's lips , on which before it was but seldom heard ; though the recollection of [his]136-peyrol white - headed , quiet , irresistible personality haunted [every corner of [the Escampobar fields]2609-the escampobar fields]2608-every corner of the escampobar fields . From that time [they]2610-they talked of [him]136-peyrol openly , as though [he]136-peyrol had come back to live again amongst [them]2610-they . Many years afterwards , one fine evening , [Monsieur]2611-monsieur and [Madame Ral]212-madame ral sitting on the bench outside [the salle]782-the salle [the house]2684-the house had not been altered at all outside except that [it]2684-the house was now kept whitewashed , began to talk of that episode and of [the man who , coming from [the seas]274-the seas , had crossed [their]2610-they lives to disappear at [sea]228-sea]2614-the man who , coming from the seas , had crossed their lives to disappear at sea again . " How did [he]136-peyrol get all that lot of gold ? "[212-madame ral] wondered [Madame Ral]212-madame ral innocently . " [He]136-peyrol could not possibly want it ; and , [Eugne]174-eugne , why should [he]136-peyrol have put it down there ? "[212-madame ral] " That , [ma chre amie]4875-ma chre amie , "[212-madame ral] said [Ral]212-madame ral , " is not an easy question to answer . [Men]423-men and [women]2762-women are not so simple as [they]2610-they seem . Even [you]4875-ma chre amie , [fermire]215-fermire [he]136-peyrol used to give [[his]136-peyrol wife]608-his wife that name jocularly , sometimes , are not so simple as [some people]4879-some people would take [you]4875-ma chre amie to be . [I]212-madame ral think that if [Peyrol]136-peyrol were [here]2715-here [he]136-peyrol could not perhaps answer [your]4875-ma chre amie question [himself]136-peyrol . "[212-madame ral] And [they]2617-they went on , reminding [each other]2919-each other in short phrases separated by long silences , of [his]2619-his peculiarities of person and behaviour , when above the slope leading down to [Madrague]58-madrague , there appeared first , the pointed ears , and then the whole body of a very diminutive donkey of a light grey colour with dark points . Two pieces of wood , strangely shaped , projected on each side of [his]2619-his body as far as [his]2619-his head , like very long shafts of [a cart]2620-a cart . But [the donkey]2621-the donkey dragged [no cart]2622-no cart after [him]2619-his . [He]2621-the donkey was carrying on [his]2621-the donkey back on a small pack saddle the torso of [a man who did not seem to have any legs]2623-a man who did not seem to have any legs . [The little animal , beautifully groomed and with an intelligent and even impudent physiognomy]2624-the little animal , beautifully groomed and with an intelligent and even impudent physiognomy , stopped in front of [Monsieur]2625-monsieur and [Madame Ral]212-madame ral . [The man]400-the man , balancing [himself]400-the man cleverly on the pack saddle with [his]400-the man withered legs crossed in front of [him]400-the man , slipped off , disengaged [his]400-the man crutches from each side of the donkey smartly , propped [himself]400-the man on them , and with [his]400-the man open palm gave the animal a resounding thwack which sent it trotting into [the yard]553-the yard . [The cripple of [the Madrague]58-madrague in [his]58-madrague quality of [[Peyrol]136-peyrol 's friend]2629-peyrol 's friend for [the rover]822-the rover]2628-the cripple of the madrague in his quality of peyrol 's friend for the rover had often talked of [him]58-madrague both to [the women]1227-the women and to [Lieutenant Ral]136-peyrol with great appreciation - " [C'est un homme]4881-c'est un homme , [a "]4882-a "[2628-the cripple of the madrague in his quality of peyrol 's friend for the rover] had become [a member of [the Escampobar community]2633-the escampobar community]2632-a member of the escampobar community . [His]58-madrague employment was to run about [the country]327-the country on errands , most unfit , [one]2670-one would think , for [a man without legs]2636-a man without legs . But [the donkey]2621-the donkey did all the walking while [the cripple]3399-the cripple supplied the sharp wits and an unfailing memory . [The poor fellow]2639-the poor fellow , snatching off [his]2639-the poor fellow hat and holding it with one hand alongside [his]2639-the poor fellow right crutch , approached to render [his]2639-the poor fellow account of the day in the simple words : " Everything has been done as [you]136-peyrol ordered , [madame]4883-madame "[2639-the poor fellow] ; then lingered , [a privileged servant]2640-a privileged servant , familiar but respectful , attractive with [his]2639-the poor fellow soft eyes , long face , and [his]2639-the poor fellow pained smile . " [We]4884-we were just talking of [Peyrol]136-peyrol , "[214-captain ral] remarked [Captain Ral]214-captain ral . " Ah , [one]2670-one could talk a long time of [him]136-peyrol , "[3399-the cripple] said [the cripple]3399-the cripple . " [He]136-peyrol told [me]3399-the cripple once that if [I]3399-the cripple had been complete - with legs like [everybody else]4079-everybody else , [I]3399-the cripple suppose [he]136-peyrol meant - [I]3399-the cripple would have made [a good comrade]4887-a good comrade away there in [the distant seas]3519-the distant seas . [He]136-peyrol had a great heart . "[3399-the cripple] " Yes , "[212-madame ral] murmured [Madame Ral]212-madame ral thoughtfully . Then turning to [[her]212-madame ral husband]573-her husband , [she]212-madame ral asked : " What sort of man was [he]136-peyrol really , [Eugne]174-eugne ? "[212-madame ral] [Captain Ral]214-captain ral remained silent . " Did [you]573-her husband ever ask [yourself]573-her husband that question ? "[212-madame ral] [she]212-madame ral insisted . " Yes , "[214-captain ral] said [Ral]214-captain ral . " But the only certain thing [we]4889-we can say of [him]136-peyrol is that [he]136-peyrol was not [a bad Frenchman]4890-a bad frenchman . "[214-captain ral] " Everything 's in that , "[3399-the cripple] murmured [the cripple]3399-the cripple , with fervent conviction in the silence that fell upon [Ral]214-captain ral 's words and [Arlette]121-arlette 's faint sigh of memory . The blue level of [the Mediterranean]59-the mediterranean , [the charmer]2644-the charmer and [the deceiver of [audacious men]2646-audacious men]2645-the deceiver of audacious men , kept the secret of its fascination - hugged to its calm breast [the victims of all the wars , calamities and tempests of its]2647-the victims of all the wars , calamities and tempests of its history , under the marvellous purity of the sunset sky . A few rosy clouds floated high up over [the Esterel range]109-the esterel range . The breath of the evening breeze came to cool [the heated rocks of [Escampobar]30-escampobar]2648-the heated rocks of escampobar ; and the mulberry tree , the only big tree on [the head of [the peninsula]452-the peninsula]2249-the head of the peninsula , standing like a sentinel at the gate of [the yard]553-the yard , sighed faintly in a shudder of all its leaves , as if regretting [the Brother of the Coast]2652-the brother of the coast , [the man of dark deeds]2653-the man of dark deeds , but of large heart , who often at noonday would lie down to sleep under its shade .
